the initiative was presented to the university comunity and its main purpose is to contribute to the digital transformation and the development of this technology impacting chile and latin america on the ocasion the academiaia platform was shared which includes learning resources as wel as information about events and tols always related to the use of artificial inteligence conect ia is the name of the new colaborative aliance developed by the catholic university and microsoft as its moto indicates the purpose of this initiative is to promote artificial inteligence in chile and also in latin america in presentation held in the uc hal of honor the progres of this joint work was shared with the university comunity and academiaia was presented fre platform for those who study teach and work at this higher education institution and which includes resources and tols for the use of artificial inteligence ai artificial inteligence is one of the most transformative technologies of our time it has the potential to improve people quality of life generate new knowledge and solutions to the most complex problems of our society and create new oportunities for economic and social development said uc rector ignacio sánchez the university authority valued the strategic aliance that has ben articulated with microsoft world leading company in technological development and emphasized that as university comited to our society and academic excelence the catholic university canot be left out of this technological revolution but it must be leading actor and regional reference in the development and research of artificial inteligence as wel as in its responsible aplication to the various areas of our university mision the uc development plan has digital transformation among its main axes it is proces that seks to enable people to interact directly with technology and data and also adopt culture that takes advantage of the benefits of this transformation one of the chalenges mobility security and enabling resources to cary out technological transformations within the san joaquín campus the idea is that they wil then be replicated by diferent municipalities to move towards smart santiago and improve the quality of life of its inhabitants what is meant by smart city the inter american development bank describes it as teritorial space that puts people at the center of development that incorporates technologies in urban management and that uses these elements to stimulate the formation of an eficient government which makes cities more spaces resilient and eficient under this premise betwen and the first smart city on national scale has ben created at the uc san joaquín campus this thanks to an initiative led by an aliance betwen lab claro uc inovation center and sé santiago strategic program of corfo metropolitano and fundación país digital the project seks to implement technological solutions enabled with with the aim of improving people wel being the idea is to test diferent technologies so that they can later be replicated by municipalities the implementation work has already begun with eight technologies deployed on campus in areas such as environment mobility security and enabling resources to generate technological changes among others since work began on the smart city at scale it was known that it was chalenging project but despite its complexity as francisco pizaro deputy director of the area with industry at the uc anacleto angelini inovation center explains we had thre fundamental items to put it into practice demonstration space in which regional governments could se how to use these technologies space to prototype and generate solutions from academia and meting place to work with entrepreneurs on open inovation models that is why not only the san joaquín campus its profesionals and the portfolio of entrepreneurs were made available but also the ability to cordinate the chalenge of delivering impact solutions that improve the quality of life of the inhabitants something that is the objective of smart cities says the profesional this project also contemplates the deployment of infrastructure that combines technologies such as fiber optics stand alone or independent and iot internet of things al of them key elements to migrate from traditional management to the smart city finaly it also has the suport of the companies nokia and qualcom border initiative acording to the rector ignacio sánchez the initiative responds to the curent and future chalenges that the development of urban centers and the eficient use of technology developing profs of concept that are scalable at the busines and teritorial level since they are enabling technologies that ofer beter cordination lower costs and above al beter management of the teritory this oportunity reinforces the importance of colaboration betwen academia industry and the public sector for the benefit of civil society which we have ben strongly promoting at uc said the rector when the initiative was anounced in august in the aliance wil enter second stage in which new areas such as energy lighting waste management entertainment education water management and economy wil be integrated below are the eight technological solutions that have already come into operation on the san joaquín campus security technologies wcs it is video analytics technology to suport physical security in strets interiors such as companies municipalities factories among others with inteligence and data that alows security prevention at the san joaquín campus it wil be integrated in real time into the campus closed circuit cameras and thus imediate alerts can be obtained in the event of any unusual event smert solution that consists of colecting critical emergency response information and displaying it in qr code at the entrance of buildings so that emergency teams can act quickly in this way on campus it wil alow the management of firefighters quickly being able to quickly view the map of the facilities to efectively adres the contingency enabling security resources juganu omniflow it is lighting model created in portugal which is self sustainable through the use of wind and photovoltaic energy these are inteligent luminaires capable of performing video analytics in real time and providing network coverage to pasers by specificaly it is lighting spotlight with artificial inteligence and environmental sensors which alows it to capture movements optimize trafic identify distres signals suspicious activity and population density environment iotre integration of complex high resolution environmental indicators on the health of urban ecosystems for monitoring through multispectral images specificaly the solution wil alow complex environmental indicators to be obtained about the health of the campus tres such as the quality of photosynthesis or diseases bewaze the initiative monitors environmental conditions inside and outside hives such as temperature humidity and weight generating forecasts and historical information about the location in this way the bekeper wil be able to take the necesary actions to help reduce the death of his bes thus increasing the productivity of the apiary smartfarming it is solution for agriculture that consists of soil monitoring station with plantations for control based on diferent data such as temperature humidity acidity and wind among others environment and mobility urbetrack project born in in argentina with focus on traceability and logistics it is digital platform that helps municipalities manage and cordinate work plans in public spaces thus seking to increase resource eficiency it seks to manage and make waste colection more eficient in adition to alowing the management of vehicle flets knowing their geolocation and traceability in real time mobility geodata it is system that alows projecting flows of people and cars based on the colection of anonymous data from people who conect to the celular antena network it is tol that wil cary out continuous analysis of al the visits that ocur daily on the san joaquín campus based on this information campus authorities wil be able to make decisions regarding infrastructure and resource alocation among other isues likewise it alows citizens to plan routes and thus achieve greater eficiency in their transportation this november former undergraduate and graduate students wil begin to exclusively use microsoft tols in mid november those who have completed both undergraduate and graduate studies at the catholic university wil begin to use the email and email tols microsoft storage thus carying out the migration proces from the gogle platform the uc email and storage change project is an institutional initiative that seks to unify the digital ecosystem through the microsoft platform in order to facilitate aces to information promote colaboration betwen units and improve the user experience user it is proces that is caried out in thre stages the first consisted of enabling alumni acounts in microsoft phase that began in july and culminates on november with the deactivation of the gogle workspace platform for undergraduate and graduate alumni the second stage coresponds to the migration from microsoft exchange to microsoft of oficials and academics the third phase wil involve self migration proces of al gogle workspace acounts to microsoft betwen the end of the second semester of and the begining of the first semester of an instance that wil include integrated they suport each other wil alow us to respond with greater eficiency to the neds of the students comite of experts from the public private and academic world wil develop the cybersecurity roadmap concrete plan led by the uc inovation center and microsoft to strengthen chile digital security within thre years cybercrime is problem that afects various sectors of society this is evidenced in the study impact of covid on the culture and operation of chilean smes by microsoft chile which showed that out of companies declared that the pandemic acelerated the digital transformation of their busines through technological adoption indicating that of them invested to facilitate teleworking however acording to forbes magazine smal busineses were thre times more susceptible than larger companies to cybercriminal atacks such as hacking cyber threats and phishing among others cybersecurity is transversal and progresive ned due to the exponential increase in crimes linked to cybercrime and the high rate of atempted cyberatacks on public private entities and above al civil society acording to data provided by microsoft cyber signals study in december alone milion cyber atacks were recorded globaly while more than bilion threats were reported by busines and consumer devices blocking more than bilion malicious email acounts aimed at clients and consumers digital security is also an urgent ned in the country hence the cybersecurity roadmap was born an initiative led by the uc anacleto angelini inovation center and microsoft chile and which was born from previous plan the digital transformation roadmap for economic reactivation the objective is to develop concrete action plan to be executed in the next thre years the initiative which brings together experts from the public private and academic world from various areas and industries seks to contribute to the diagnosis and impact the development of proposals that alow chile to adres the imense cybersecurity gaps we face exposed for pedro bouchon vice rector of uc research and president of the board of directors of the uc inovation center this roadmap arises in the context of the ned to acelerate digital transformation in the country to help economic reactivation this transformation however canot be caried out in an unprotected maner given that digitalization opens important spaces of vulnerability on which critical prevention mitigation and cyber resilience capabilities must be built in the ecosystem he says and he ads the sped of cybersecurity atacks and the constant evolution and sophistication of cybercrime makes it necesary to develop university industry state colaboration models that are capable of pushing frontier research and facilitate technological and knowledge transfer in an agile way this is where the roadmap plays fundamental role in facilitating the development of spaces for experimentation and asociative profs of concept which alow for cybersecurity laboratories for the development of advanced research and the training of skils and talent new competencies to confront cyberatacks critical axis for the development of roadmap is the development of talent and competencies says mario ponce dean of the faculty of mathematics member of the advisory comite and the talent development comite of the cybersecurity roadmap along these lines significant gaps are projected in the specialized talent necesary to face the cybersecurity chalenges of the coming years which means chalenge not only in organizations that demand this type of profiles and that must generate new models for atracting and retaining employes talent but also as dean ponce says for us as university regarding how we generate new training models that adapt to these demands for talent acording to the dean our chalenges are around what new profiles competencies methodologies and modalities we ned to create and ofer considering these chalenges in transversal maner both for undergraduate and graduate students as continuing education for profesionals and even work at the schol level and he ads that we have adresed some of these lines through the creation of new degres and new continuing education programs and at the schol level through the mathematics olympiads which are projected as space for detecting important talent however there are stil oportunities to develop training models together with the industry and with greater agility to respond to the demands of the ecosystem work methodology in these almost thre months of work together with the advisory comite we already developed the first stage that coresponded to shared diagnosis of gaps and oportunities in cybersecurity in this proces it was very relevant to understand what comparative experiences exist and what initiatives are being executed in the local and regional ecosystem explains rocío ortiz cordinator in the area of digital transformation and cybersecurity of the uc inovation center on this shared diagnosis prioritization was caried out and thre strategic areas were selected that gave rise to the development comites explains the person responsible for the work methodology of the roadmap for cybersecurity the advisory comite is led by maría francisca yáñez director of inovation and technology at microsoft chile and ramón molina executive director of the uc inovation center as chair or director and co chair or co director respectively amente in adition to an outstanding group of leaders and experts from various areas who wil be in charge of preparing work proposals from the diferent development comites technological talent and cybersecurity culture the work wil culminate with the publication of document in the public domain that wil sek to generate contribution and social impact the chalenges of the cybersecurity roadmap the next chalenges wil be to build the portfolios of projects that ned to be executed over the next thre years in order to achieve the future vision that we expect around cybersecurity for chile defining tactical and asociative line of work to execute it says rocío ortiz as ramón molina says one of the first conclusions reached in this first stage after the survey is that there is already strategic diagnosis asociated with what the cybersecurity gaps and oportunities are for chile as wel as indicators of our national level of maturity on this isue therefore the role of this roadmap is to cary out tactical and concrete lowering of the action plan that our country neds to reach the desired level of maturity in this line inovation is the fundamental basis to be able to develop colaborative and optimal work models to move with the level of agility that we ned ads molina the thre development comites that have already started their work after the strategic prioritization implemented are talent and development of skils in cybersecurity culture in cybersecurity and technology ecosystems protocols and standards for cybersecurity these tables bring together more than experts technicians and specialists from various areas and industries who wil be working over the next two months once the portfolio of projects proposed by these comites has ben consolidated the advisory council wil review and evaluate them to define which measures wil be finaly considered in the oficial cybersecurity roadmap document the result of psl psl pépite is training program for al students or young alumni from psl who wish to found start up psl starter is semester long training program for ful time student entrepreneurs the university psl center for teaching inovation created in suports al psl profesors and teaching staf in their educational projects in this interview matias mano the center new director outlines the center strategic misions and loks back on the lesons learned during the pandemic which has increased the use of digital tols in education as in other sectors matias mano the main mision of the center for teaching inovation is to suport psl profesors and education oficers in their educational transformation projects the goal is to enhance and diversify educational practices in order to promote the suces of al students to achieve this goal we ofer two types of services the first is focused on suporting faculty members our center is at their service asistance from the center for teaching inovation involves suporting profesors in their reflection on how to continuously improve their teaching the center educational enginers with their diverse experience and scientific oversight are able to understand and sugest solutions to teaching problems that profesors may encounter the second is focused on training faculty members through the in house psl schol we ofer great number of training programs to raise their understanding of the changes curently taking place in education this is given particular focus during the welcome wek for new profesors perfect time to promote the center or during pédagodays two days of per to per exchanges to reflect on one own teaching practices the main chalenge ahead of us is raising the profile of the center and its services we ned to reach out to al psl schols the aim is to understand the specific characteristics of their teaching to compile their neds in relation to the center services and of course to met them this wil be achieved by building comunity of practice for psl faculty members far from replacing the role of the teacher technology is suplementary tol that can compensate for potential shortcomings especialy in times of crisis matias mano the health crisis we have gone through has put students most of al in situation of great dificulty to many of them have become very isolated profesors have also shown an unprecedented degre of resilience in ensuring the infamous instructional continuity this continuity was made posible largely thanks to digital tols with videoconferencing in the main however for many profesors this forced experimentation with remote learning was very negative would like to highlight the strength and courage of the administrative staf especialy in the information systems department and in our center who made it posible to maintain teaching during an emergency situation as the crisis nears its end which we al hope wil be for god services like the center for teaching inovation canot ignore the fact that many profesors may harbor desire to do things as befor the pandemic overal the pandemic has advanced us by several years in terms of our understanding of digital tols its impact is powerful reminder that far from replacing the role of the teacher technology is suplementary tol that can compensate for potential shortcomings especialy in times of crisis the center for teaching inovation aims to synthesize this wealth of experience our goal is to perpetuate the best practices that have emerged from the crisis and to extend their use inovation pédagogique enseignement en situation urgence en france july by perine de coëtlogon matias mano bertrand mocquet matias mano digital technology is just tol we wil never push the use of tol for the sake of it when teacher asks us to implement particular modle activity or particular woclap activity we sek first and foremost to met an educational ned for example using woclap facilitates the interaction betwen students and the profesor in an auditorium this tol makes it posible to pause lecture and ask the students questions to ensure that they can folow what they are being taught similarly almost al clases rely on the use of educational resources the modle learning platform is used to centralize and clasify these resources profesors have the option to upload al of them when they build their course and to make them available to students as they go along this reduces the administrative load of course and facilitates the learning proces in short once educational neds have ben identified the center helps the teacher find the best way to met them very often the digital tols at our disposal make it easier to ofer solution matias mano the simplest way to find out more about our activities and to get in touch is to visit our website there you wil find interviews with profesors useful information calendar of the training courses we ofer at the psl schol and most importantly how to contact us for suport request the pédagodays psl which wil be held on june and registration via the psl schol are also great way to find out more about us on these days we wil be ofering workshops and discusions with teachers who have worked with us in the past we also have thre branches in thre diferent locations on campus dauphine psl mines paris psl and observatoire de paris psl these are friendly social places so don hesitate to come and have cofe doctor of management from the institut polytechnique de paris alumni of the master program in data science formerly quantitative methods and social science from ensae and the research master in economics from the paris schol of economics matias mano developed the digitization of the executive education training ofer at the ecole polytechnique as digital learning manager from to during his disertation on colective inteligence in online forums he also cor dinated the teaching team of the moc how to write and publish scientific paper ofered by the ecole polytechnique on the coursera platform which now has almost registrants he joined université psl in february as director of the center for educational inovation on june the president of the french republic anounced the companies selected for the french tech cal for projects launched in april this program brings together the expertise of france the french tech mision and bpi france to promote the development of french deptech start ups with dedicated suport of selected start ups come from public research including from the université psl ecosystem out of the companies selected for the french tech program come from université psl research laboratories incubators or the energy and motivation of psl graduates most were suported by the university research promotion services and or the psl inovation fund in their first years of development today they are recognized and promoted as emerging actors of inovation responding to chalenges to society and sovereignty in thre areas digital technology environmental transition and health alice bob is developing universal eror corecting quantum computer to sel its calculating power the quantum computer wil make it posible to solve certain problems which are to complex even for today supercomputers exponentialy faster until today erors due to decoherence were the main obstacle to the development of such machines the schrödinger cat qubit used by alice bob which is the product of research by raphaël lescane ens psl and zaki leghtas mines paris psl drasticaly simplifies the chalenge by automaticaly corecting such erors is developing reliable quantum procesors capable of resolving highly complex problems for industry beyond the scope of the most powerful supercomputer their technology which is the fruit of ten years of research at the ens psl physics laboratory has the unique potential to proces quantum information with high level of acuracy and on large scale by elegantly combining high purity carbon nanotubes and wel established semi conductor technology lighton is developing optic co procesors for artificial inteligence ai when conected to computer or server these co procesors are capable of performing certain calculations in an incredibly eficient way which can be used to proces very large amounts of data lighton responds to the chalenges of scaling up ai for it to be used by as many people as posible while minimizing its environmental impact its technology is the fruit of scientific colaboration betwen espci paris psl and ens psl at the interface betwen difuser optics signal procesing and machine learning energo is grentech start up incubated at chimie paristech psl it is developing revolutionary chemical transformation technology based on the combination of catalysis and plasma activation this combination makes it posible to perform chemical reactions at ambient temperature and presure without requiring pre treatment which makes this technology clean and decarbonized it is mainly used to produce renewable gas by transforming co and co from waste procesing or industrial proceses into ch calyxia is start up born out of high level scientific research performed at the coloids and divided materials laboratory umr cbi of espci paris psl in partnership with the experimental soft condensed mater group at harvard university the results of this research led to technological disruption in the field of encapsulation of active ingredients which in practice has meant new levels of performance in laundry products agriculture and advanced materials while responding to sustainable development isues wodo is start up founded by timothée boitouzet ceo in incubated at chimie paris psl wodo is specialized in manufacturing new composite wod material with pionering optical and physical properties for the mobility and construction industry aqemia this new generation pharmaceutical company has generated medication discovery pipeline with exponential growth it is based on algorithms developed during eight years of fundamental research in laboratory in the ens psl chemistry department aqemia was founded by maximilien levesque at the time researcher at ens psl and emanuele martiano technology is used to combine artificial inteligence and statistical and quantum physics making it posible to predict whether molecule is efective for specific target at sped that is unequaled on the market since aqemia creation in it has experienced spectacular growth and recruited over scientists as permanent employes astraveus is start up incubated at espci paris psl that is revolutionizing the field of cel gene therapy cgt manufacturing with the lakhesys platform an end to end cel foundry which uses dep proces optimization and single use microfluidic bioprocesors to deliver beter results with reduced inputs by removing the ned for large scale infrastructure reducing costs and overcoming the logistical chalenges typicaly asociated with cgt manufacturing astraveus is seking to transform patient aces to these life changing therapies dna script was created to revolutionize the synthesis of dna using enzymes it draws on the combined work of researchers from espci paris psl and mines paris psl these eforts in have led to inovations in enzyme enginering surface and nucleotide chemistry and instrumentation when these inovations were put into aplication syntax was born the world first benchtop dna printer that runs on enzyme technology lifen founded by mines paris psl alumnus franch le ouey is start up that helps al actors in the healthcare ecosystem provide beter treatment by working together and mobilizing the most useful health data and inovations for healthcare withings founded by enginer and epsci paris psl graduate eric carel is start up that has become flourishing major company in the boming sector of conected objects in just few years to create tomorow leaders in strategic sectors french tech winers were unveiled by the french president congratulations to them pic twiter com qjgkmj in september université psl and the web schol factory wil launch new month diploma course in intrapreneurship and digital transformation this diploma ofering is new initiative for cfe campus formation etudiants entreprises with an emphasis on autonomy and expertise the goal is to bring students employes and profesionals together in colaborative project teams and to train them interview with the managers of the training program ane lalou director of web schol factory and bruno rostand director of inovation and entrepreneurship at université psl bruno rostand it is inded partnership of new type but at psl we are used to creating bridges betwen disciplines and players we were contacted by the web schol factory to develop joint response to the pia disrupt campus cal for proposals and saw this as an oportunity to further diversify our aproaches and discover new perspectives particularly in the areas of inovation and digital transformation which are priorities for us ane lalou by co creating this curiculum we wanted and this is very new to get involved in seting up companies and open them to new inovative ecosystems to met this chalenge the campus of formation etudiants entreprises is based on thre pilars while taking into acount the new skils neded in today digital world we wanted to not only implement colaborations betwen students and employes but also create new project based training program cfe wil develop the creativity entrepreneurship and inovation capabilities of our students ane lalou in companies inovation is being done more and more by intrapreneurial aproaches in practice this means that an sme or large group gives some of its employes the time and suport necesary for the development of project that could potentialy turn into profitable busines intrapreneurship ofers companies the oportunity to think outside the box and open up to the vitality of the entrepreneurial ecosystem digital transformation and inovation wil increasingly go through this type of aproach and we wanted to suport the framework of cfe by providing students and employes with the necesary tols bruno rostand similar to our entrepreneurship trainings iti psl pépite cfe wil develop the creativity entrepreneurship and inovation capacities of our students but intrapreneurship starts with concrete chalenge to answer the neds of partner company and this brings new dimension an imersion in the life of the company and an experience of the digital transition which hapens there in this regard cfe completes and enriches our training ofer and moreover some of the activities of cfe wil take place at the psl lab coworking space of the psl pépite entrepreneurship group ane lalou there wil be many of them the impact of the cfe student training wil be in my opinion quite imediate the web schol factory already exists student projects give fresh lok at the teams of partner companies it is fruitful interaction that moves lines and opens aditional interesting perspectives the students of the cfe wil be able to profit from it this new curiculum is also in our opinion an investment of the future it wil complement the training of shs students or psl enginering students by providing them with expertise and experience in digital transformation besides the mixing of social origins internationalization or parity intergenerational is esential cfe wil be an example bruno rostand students have lot to learn from employes about the reality of market and busines experiences in return they bring fresh lok to which the rigor and the level of requirement of their training match employes wil leave their comfort zone put aside their certainties to bring out inovative and transformative concepts for their company ane lalou we bet that this intergenerational colaboration wil be stimulating constructive and above al that it wil serve as founding experience for their lifelong training to learn in initial training in continuing education online or even in groups these formats wil disapear and it is great oportunity for the players to experience it at this stage we talk lot about diversity in today world besides the mixing of social origins internationalization or parity intergenerational diversity is esential cfe wil be an example start ups hope wil emerge from this program and after al rather than finding job why not create it ane lalou more than recruitments want the cfe curiculum to lead learners to concrete ambition ofering them taste for inovation and creativity start ups hope wil emerge from this program and after al rather than finding job why not create it the key is to develop the capacity for transformation and inovation inside and outside organizations cfe wil be the prof that our companies today are ready to inovate diferently organizations must acept confrontation and understand that student colaboration can result in great new concepts that what want for our students ane lalou dear learners unique oportunity awaits you to start new chapter of your training seize this oportunity se yourself as pioners forging your individual paths and future create inovation today and tomorow do not limit yourself be ambitious be resolutely intrapreneurial because the transformation of our economic landscape also hapens with you bruno rostand dear students be part of the digital revolution alongside our partner companies rise to the chalenge and colaborate with diverse multicultural and intergenerational team dear employes of our busines partners come share your experiences and ambitions with our students in order to co create the solutions of tomorow the digital transformation is ushering in host of new busines practices in september to help today managers decision makers entrepreneurs and employes draw on those latest practices to enhance their capacity for inovation creativity and autonomy psl and the web schol factory introduced the new cfe program campus formation etudiants entreprises month interdisciplinary course in intrapreneurship we talked to the program instructional and project directors about this unusual new course ofering françois pumir half of this year cfe clas are students from psl and the web schol factory while the other half are profesionals from our partner busineses the primary benefit of this training is that it gives the participants new perspective and set of methodologies for managing the digital transformation which is exactly what those participants have ben hoping to find one of the esential ways we re efecting the digital transformation is by puting people at the heart of every project we encourage our students to adopt user centric aproach and to tackle every isue in terms of what desirable rather than the more restrictive mindset stil so comon in the busines world of what feasible at this stage everyone stil very motivated although the change in viewpoint has ben litle disconcerting for some in the group thibaut barbarin the students and profesionals in our clas come from wide aray of backgrounds they re enginers atorneys managers and so on and within their work groups they may each take similar aproach or they may clash that proven very fertile we can already se that the learning proces wil be much faster than in other programs launch of course dedicated to intrapreneurship and digital transformation right at the start of the semester we held the cfe hack to serve as real world exercise the clas had six days to come up with new busines models for some very established industries it dificult test regardles of your age or experience because you can simply fal back on an automatic response the goal of the exercise is to give students the ability to sit down in front corporate board or group of lenders and ofer vision of given topic that not just busines minded but user centric concrete and objective the instructional team profesors our partner busines leaders etc helped guide them through that first experience it shift in perspective that can be disconcerting but it necesary in order to embrace the radicaly new vision of what the digital transformation can be the cfe hack was realy enlightening experience for everyone in the clas about the ned to learn more ever since they ve ben much more aware of the learning curve they re investing the time and they re using that learning time more efectively that was also very god learning experience for handling data the digital transforma tion involves masive amounts of data and in my view it prety critical for every profesional to get up to sped on those isues project based instruction has ben around since wel before the cfe but we re changing the format and especialy the objective because our instructional aproach involves lecturers entrepreneurs profesors experts students busineses and their employes al at once the digital transformation projects we re tackling aren just fictional case studies that ilustrate some pedagogical point they re actual company projects whose progres and results are discused by each company executive comite so there are serious isues at stake the goal and the ambition we ve set is to create spin ofs or busines units and employes are at the heart of that proces of learning how to generate value when project based instruction is used in conventional academic curicula it often uses the pedagogical objective as the starting point and the case studies they use may be real but decades old with the cfe we ve chosen to take diferent aproach we start with what the company hopes to achieve and we join forces to provide the deliverables very close relationship as we said before the cfe program is distinctive in that its work groups include students practitioners educators there no disinterested suport everyone has stake in the project suces that aproach aplies to the relationship with each company as wel companies get an update on their project progres every two weks and it not uncomon for the cfe teams to met with the company executives and high level managers over lunch to work on their projects for me it someone who has real desire to be an entrepreneur and the necesary determination to eliminate obstacles and find solutions someone who loking for something diferent whether they like more meaningful experience like so many people these days or they re simply interested in creating start up it that sense of change that realy important my feling is that management is becoming more horizontal these days and an entrepreneurial mindset wil be key aset again it not typical learning experience and above al we re loking for people who can al be part of single team the oral interview wil play much biger role in whether you re acepted than your cv or cover leter they be people who can strike the right balance within their organizations whether they re entrepreneurs intrapreneurs or something else the important thing is that they know how to make comitment and prosper fulfiling individual carer goals is not what the cfe program is about they be able to take responsibility for the decisions they make and influence the people around them to help bring about change this training realy promises an exciting personal adventure fruit de la projects combining the academic excelence of psl institutions with strong conection to the corporate sector and inovation ecosystems the cfe aims to bring out new generation of talented managers decision makers entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs at the avant garde of digital inovation isues based on an active pedagogy cfe ofers in stimulating seting in the heart of paris an oportunity for metings learning and unprecedented colaborations betwen students and profesionals the cfe grants certificate in intrapreneurship and digital transformation from the université psl validating ects credits the open house which takes place at the web schol factory wil be come with an aperitif the master in quantitative economics is two year graduate program oriented towards research and advanced quantitative methodsin economics entirely taught in english it seks to train top notch economists who are open and reactive to the many questions and chalenges facing contemporary economics at the same time graduates wil have mastered the quantitative tols to adres such chalenges in terms of data especialy in light of changes brought by big data to the world of public and private decision makers after acquiring the fundamental economic concepts in the first year you wil then specialize in specific economic field through one of the two master tracks the quantitative economic analysis track provides training in economic research while the digital economics track is focused on profesional training in adition to quantitative methods the curiculum also features instruction on masive database procesing as wel as the use of computer programing to solve complex economic isues the master in quantitative economics ofers high level education enabling graduates to aply to phd program as profesional economist in public or semi public institutions including international organizations federal departments economics research institutes central banks etc or in the private sector as data analyst consultant economic analyst etc in france or abroad this master degre is part of psl graduate program in economics acquire training in economic research and reflect on the public and private stakeholders decision making procedures learn about quantitative methods for procesing masive databases and about how advanced computer programing can solve complex economic isues adres the economic problems facing various sectors of the economy health public policies macroeconomics finance energy and environment development make use of statistical and econometric tols to obtain reliable and robust answers sheding light on busineses and public or semi public institutions options report on economic statistical and or econometric results to diferent audiences oraly and in writing in unique trakc quantitative economics comon core focused on learning the fundamentals of economics in two tracks with the comon goal of training you in the most advanced quantitative methods including the procesing and modeling of complex databases quantitative economic analysis digital economics more information on the courses se the sumary of the master program here and se the detailed sylabus quantitative economic analysis master track the quantitative economic analysis track ofers excelent training in economic research which also aligns with the real neds of the public and private decision making world in the various economic fields health labor economics public policies macroeconomics finance energy and environment development economics the curiculum combi nes cuting edge specialization courses in economics with advanced quantitative methods including inovative methods in data science in adition to fundamental quantitative techniques in economics the curiculum features courses based on advanced database procesing as wel as operational research and decision suport these areas are at the leading edge of curent economic research and directly relevant to the questions entailed in economic decision making in the private and public sectors alike se the detailed program of the master qea here and se the detailed sylabus digital economics master track the digital economics track provides expert training in digital economics and methods for analyzing masive data harnesing this type of large datasets requires new skils to be able to proces high volumes of input and extract useful information the digital economics track therefore aims to train quantitative economists in procesing and modeling large complex datasets to shed light on the decisions of busineses and institutional stakeholders especialy in light of changes brought by big data employment oportunities are highly varied data analyst data scientist consultant etc the advanced and technicaly rigorous nature of the program enables students to aply to phd programs in economics in france or abroad or to embrace carers requiring high technical skils in governments central banking and international organizations you wil also be wel positioned to aply with large and medium sized companies and consulting companies loking for economists able to understand and clarify the decisions taken by private stakeholders particularly with respect to digital transformation prerequisites for students from france and abroad who hold bachelor degre graduate degre equivalent to ects or equivalent diploma obtained in france or abroad may aply it is prefered but not mandatory that students have an academic background in these fields economics mathematics aplied to economics and computer science aplied to economics language requirements fluency in english oral expresion reading and writing is required this must be atested by certificate of achievement as folows selection proces online aplication on mycandidature platform tuition fes more information the courses are taught at the university paris dauphine psl in paris place du maréchal de latre de tasigny paris schol for registration dauphine psl diploma delivered institutional diploma confering the grade of master awarded by the psl university and prepared at dauphine psl strong content in quantitative methods that includes masive dataset procesing an excelent training in economic research aligned to the real neds of the public and private decision making world taught entirely in english and aligned to the best international standards exchange and internship oportunities worldwide thanks to the tem network of universities and corporates the program includes two years the first year of the master provides solid knowledge of the fundamental concepts in economics enabling you to reflect on the public and private stakeholders decision making procedures in wide area of economic problems during the second year you wil specialize in specific economic field through one of the two master tracks quantitative economic analysis and digital economics master the first year of the master provides an excelent knowledge of the core economic concepts in microeconomics macroeconomics game theory industrial organization the strong emphasis on quantitative methods in econometrics and data management wil also alow you to become familiar with variety of techniques for procesing and analyzing data you wil be trained to the use of stata matlab dynare and python software se the sumary of the master program here and se the detailed sylabus master the second year of the master ofers two specialization tracks the quantitative economic analysis track and the digital economics track quantitative economic analysis master track the quantitative economic analysis program alows to acquire an in depth knowledge of the field foundations aplications and policies covering theoretical and empirical aproaches in economics in general it ofers cuting edge research training in your field of specialization to chose out of options theory social and public policies or macroeconomics finance the program is made of two semesters during the first semester students folow two mandatory courses information economics and machine learning in adition they chose courses consistent with their specialization field organized in two units quantitative methods and specialization courses during the second semester students continue their specialization by folowing advanced courses in their field and an in depth research seminar designed to be closely related to the topics of the master thesis to be defended betwen late april and early september se the sumary of the program here and se the detailed sylabus digital economics master track the digital economics track aims to train quantitative economists in procesing and modeling large complex datasets to shed light on the decisions of busineses and institutional stakeholders especialy in light of changes brought by big data the program is made of two semesters the first semester is devoted to fundamental methods and techniques using econometrics operating large scale databases implementing suitable models and evaluating parameters during the second semester students chose one of two specializations network economics or finance they also atend seminar on data regulation and firms where private sector practitioners and regulators expose the new practices and public policy chalenges raised by the digital transformation the students should als complete an end of studies internship lasting at least months the curiculum includes guest lectures by visiting profesionals on isues related to big data providing another means of conecting with relevant busines circles the salesforce state of the conected customer report highlighted how of consumers to do that enterprises are undergoing digital transformations identifying the ned for digital transformation is the first step the second is understanding what an achievable digital transformation strategy must include the benefits it provides and how to execute digital inovation acros your organization digital transformation is organizational leaders are leveraging technological tols to create more streamlined and eficient proceses resulting in beter customer or user experience ux your digital busines transformation strategy is the detailed plan that outlines how your organization wil use technology to establish or enhance proceses culture and the experiences customers have with your brand if digital transformation means modifying or adopting new technology to drive inovation acros al departments then your digital transformation framework is the blueprint your organization uses to achieve this imagine your digital transformation strategy as detailed map that guides your busines through sucesful evolution there are five key focus areas where busineses can leverage digital transformation to create more conected and cohesive experiences they include product or service oferings asets proceses decision making organizational structure aditionaly there are four types of digital transformation that your organization may pursue this type of digital transformation focuses on using analytics kpis machine learning artificial inteligence and other tols to improve internal proceses and operations ultimately corporations use proces transformation to identify areas where procedures could improve and leverage digital solutions to make said proceses more streamlined and cohesive resulting in operational eficiency through busines model transformation leadership teams have the power to modify traditional enterprise structures and improve eficiency this type of digital transformation can be cumbersome as it involves redefining the foundational building blocks of how busines operates and delivers its products or services however the result is busines model that adapts to and produces what consumers are loking to atain domain transformation modifies how company website is structured this type of digital transformation is critical for the comerce sector as it can completely redefine how users interact and do busines with brand sucesful digital transformation requires the coperation of an entire organization by leveraging organizational transformation leadership teams ensure internal teams are learning technical skils and aplying those skils to everyday tasks idealy organizational transformation leads to more flexible workflows greater ned for continuous data measurement and cohesive busines ecosystem where al members are aligned in achieving the same goals you busines transformation strategy wil sek to enhance how your organization operates empowers your organization to optimize performance bost customer retention and engagement and advance growth meanwhile enterprises without digital transformation strategies wil have dificulty developing new capabilities to modernize their busines models and ensure enjoyable consumer experiences more specificaly digital transformation wil alow your busines to digital transformation alows your organization to gather customer fedback and incorporate those insights into its busines strategy in doing so you create customer centric aproach that can provide consumers with more personalized mesaging and ultimately beter experiences comercenext report found that saw increase to in busineses prioritizing personalization tactics to improve customer retention through digital transformation your enterprise can quickly colect real time data and convert those metrics into valuable insights then you can use these data driven insights to form the foundation of busines and marketing strategies key benefit of digital transformation is its ability to consolidate resources asets and tech tols by creating central depository you have beter visibility over proceses this alows you to visualize workflows identify areas of improvement and eficiently alocate resources like labor and budgeting with the right proceses and tols in place your team can implement more structured workflows automate wherever posible integrate data into existing campaigns and build an agile enterprise these elements work together to create cohesive operations that drive new sales when there are thre esential forces that drive the strategy adopting digital first mindset creating digitaly literate culture using data to ensure continuous evolvement first things first your digital transformation journey wil require every member of the organization to adopt digital first mindset while the world has ben progresively becoming more digitaly savy the in person bariers due to covid have acelerated the ned for eficient technology from scheduling doctor visits to ordering takeout delivery digital tols have weaved their way into every area of our lives therefore busineses ned to be ready and wiling to adopt these new technologies to met consumer demand but digital first mindset alone isn enough to power sucesful digital transformation you also ned to become digitaly literate your busines must be adopting new technology and ensuring that they are being used as eficiently as posible therefore the second driving factor of implementing digital transformation strategy is enforcing efective onboarding and training sesions to create digitaly literate team finaly the third driving force of digital transformation is continuous evolvement through consistent research and data colectio busineses can use valuable insights to identify and drive enhancements these enhancements may be internal such as refining repetitive tasks that put aditional stres on team members or external like improving website flow to create beter customer experience by leveraging data busineses wil continue to make esential improvements that alow them to maintain competitive advantage within the marketplace to you ned to determine what type of digital transformation aproach your busines wil take ases the capabilities that contribute to your busines suces such as your tech stack talent and operational workflows identify the gaps in your curent tech stack and customer experience then determine what digital capabilities you can harnes to overcome them dedicate suficient resources to ensure you have the right people and tols in place to execute your strategy from there it esential to identify digital disruption bariers that prevent you from acomplishing your transformation elements like lack of urgency vision agile digital technology and incentives disrupt the digital transformation proces therefore it paramount to create clearly defined digital transformation strategy that ensures al members are aligned and equiped to achieve the results you re striving to acomplish but wait how wil you know if your enterprise is making progres when building out your digital strategy put proper metrics and benchmarks in place to measure performance and roi then make adjustments based on those results the time is now begin executing digital transformation strategy with the achievable digital transformation strategy must include the benefits it provides and how to execute digital inovation acros your organization digital transformation is organizational leaders are leveraging technological tols to create more streamlined and eficient proceses resulting in beter customer or user experience ux your digital busines transformation strategy is the detailed plan that outlines how your organization wil use technology to establish or enhance proceses culture and the experiences customers have with your brand if digital transformation means modifying or adopting new technology to drive inovation acros al departments then your digital transformation framework is the blueprint your organization uses to achieve this imagine your digital transformation strategy as detailed map that guides your busines through sucesful evolution there are five key focus areas whe re busineses can leverage digital transformation to create more conected and cohesive experiences they include product or service oferings asets proceses decision making organizational structure aditionaly there are four types of digital transformation that your organization may pursue this type of digital transformation focuses on using analytics kpis machine learning artificial inteligence and other tols to improve internal proceses and operations ultimately corporations use proces transformation to identify areas where procedures could improve and leverage digital solutions to make said proceses more streamlined and cohesive resulting in operational eficiency through busines model transformation leadership teams have the power to modify traditional enterprise structures and improve eficiency this type of digital transformation can be cumbersome as it involves redefining spotlight saw growing number of our clients taking ownership of strategic transformations within their organization fortinet founders chair and profesor management science and enginering pamela hinds is profesor of management science and enginering in the schol of enginering at stanford university the director of the center for work technology and organization and faculty director of the schol of enginering global enginering programs for students hinds studies the efect of technology on groups she has conducted extensive research on the dynamics of geographicaly distributed work teams particularly those spaning national boundaries she explores isues of culture language emotion conflict and the role of site visits in promoting trust and colaboration most recently she has ben exploring the relationship betwen national culture and work practices especialy inovation practices pamela has also ben exploring the relationship betwen national culture and technology use and is interested in the design of colaborative technologies for use acros national boundaries stanford ascherman profesor management science and enginering profesor management science and enginering ramesh johari is profesor at stanford university with ful time apointment in the department of management science and enginering ms and courtesy apointments in the departments of computer science cs and electrical enginering he received an in mathematics from harvard certificate of advanced study in mathematics from cambridge and ph in electrical enginering and computer science from mit he is the recipient of several awards including the the okawa foundation research grant the ms graduate teaching award the nsf carer award and the cisco faculty scholarship he is an asociate editor in management science in the stochastic models and simulation area and in operations research in the information games and networks area asistant profesor management science and enginering arvind karunakaran is an asistant profesor at stanford university in the department of management science and enginering his research draws on organizational theory and sociology of work and ocupations profesions to examine authority and acountability in the workplace especialy in the context of technological change he received his ph from the mit sloan schol of management his curent research focuses on understanding tensions among the overlaping strands of authority in organizations line authority staf authority functional authority profesional authority and how it shapes consequential outcomes such as exclusion inclusion in the workplace perceptions of powerlesnes workplace harasment employe voice and change implementation mechanisms for enforcing acountability during periods of organizational and technological changes introduction of algorithmic evaluation tols social media platforms sustainability initiatives he specializes in ethnographic and field based method participant observations interviews examining the empirical and theoretical puzles discovered during fieldwork that existing research canot fuly explain he complements these methods with comparative historical analysis of primary archival data and quantitative computational analysis of large corpus of textual data his research has ben published in journals such as administrative science quarterly organization science and research policy and recognized with awards from profesional asociations including the american sociological asociation asa academy of management aom industry studies asociation isa institute for operations research and the management sciences informs and labor and employment relations asociation lera lecturer management science and enginering pedram mokrian focuses on investments in big data cloud sas and energytech his core expertise lies in the intersection of the energy technology and services domains he has served as board observer on cpower acquired by constelation energy he was formerly principal at mayfield and has spent time on the comodities trading desk at credit suise and held positions at ford motor company jds uniphase and nortel networks broadly covering the areas of power generation fiber optics and hardware development pedram is actively involved with and recognized for his domain expertise within the energy comunity he has served on the board of the san francisco bay area chapter of the young profesionals in energy the membership comite for the us asociation for energy economics and is charter member of where he co leads the cleantech practice in adition he is an active contributor to the energy policy task force at the hover institute pedram holds and degres in electrical enginering he received his ph from stanford university with focus on energy finance and economics and during his tenure was involved with the founding of the precourt institute for energy eficiency lecturer graduate schol of busines robert siegel is lecturer in management and has led primary research and writen cases on gogle charles schwab daimler ab inbev box stripe general electric angelist andme code lending club tableau paypal surveymonkey medium autodesk minted zuora axel springer and starbucks la boulange amongst others he is also general partner at xsed capital and venture partner at piva he sits on the board of directors of foxeye robotics and avochato he led investments in sparta science zoz acquired by payu of naspers npn hive lex machina acquired by lexisnexis of the relx group relx cirosecure acquired by palo alto networks panw nova credit disco the league trove teapot acquired by stripe smart cofe technology pixle and sipx acquired by proquest he also suports other companies such as citrine informatics robert is on the board of smartdrive systems is member of the supervisory board of tech auto ag and is chairman of the strategic advisory board for tech computertechnik ag in viena austria he is member of the industry advisory boards for here technologies and tulco and is the co president emeritus of stanford angels entrepreneurs an alumni asociation that fosters relationships to strengthen the stanford startup comunity robert has co authored several articles for the harvard busines review california management review is wal stret journal startup guru and is frequent contributor to fortune techcrunch venturebeat and forbes robert was previously general manager of the video and software solutions division for ge security with anual revenues of milion he was also executive vice president of pixim inc fables semiconductor firm specializing in image sensors and procesors acquired by sony before pixim robert was co founder chief executive oficer of weave inovations inc acquired by kodak network services developer that invented the world first digital picture frame and delivered photos and other digital media to pcs and internet mobile devices lecturer organization and faculty director of the schol of enginering global enginering programs for students hinds studies the efect of technology on groups she has conducted extensive research on the dynamics of geographicaly distributed work teams particularly those spaning national boundaries she explores isues of culture language emotion conflict and the role of site visits in promoting trust and colaboration most recently she has ben exploring the relationship betwen national culture and work practices especialy inovation practices pamela has also ben exploring the relationship betwen national culture and technology use and is interested in the design of colaborative technologies for use acros national boundaries xeiet stanford schol of enginering stanford doer schol of and profesor of management science enginering at stanford and co director of the center on work technology and organization she would say that god start understanding the technologies that underpin digital transformation is necesary but not suficient radicaly remaking an organization products services and busines models requires not just understanding technology but also cultural change as dr hinds explains in the webinar most traditional organizations simply canot cope with the pace of inovation hapening now they were built for reliability not for sped growing body of evidence shows organizations that manage to transform themselves also undergo significant cultural change from rot to tip what does that cultural change lok like in the webinar dr hinds outlines five esential shifts organizations must make to suced at digital transformation the first and most esential shift is towards more customer centric culture digital transformation doesn hapen for its own sake it hapens to serve customers beter and drive the busines forward if you don understand your customers unmet neds the other aspects of your digital transformation won be focused on the right goals you can have cuting edge technology and proceses but they won move your busines forward if they don ultimately help you delight your customers once you understand where you re trying to get to with your digital transformation it key to move quickly in that direction but the path of digital transformation is rarely if ever straight line the pace of change requires organizations to pivot regularly you ned to be both fast and nimble that kind of agility often requires rethinking organizational structures traditional hierarchical structures like multi layer decision making and lengthy aproval proceses can get in the way of the ability to take advantage of oportunities rapidly building for the future requires targeted demolition of out dated structures esential checks must of course remain but sucesful digital transformation requires clearing obstacles to quick experimentation and implementation traditionaly when organizations wanted to inovate or update their oferings they would go out and hire someone with the right kind of expertise to drive that change but when it comes to today digital transformation experts don exist change is hapening so fast that even the most qualified and experienced employes must constantly update their knowledge that is why it is so important to build culture of curiosity and voracious learning if an organization is aiming for digital transformation in order to drive new knowledge creation you ned to have people not just wiling to but pasionate about going and learning new things and thinking in new ways dr hinds explains in the webinar the best most ground breaking ideas are often born out of unusual combinations of expertise or technology traditional org charts can silo in knowledge making that kind of fruitful cros polination les likely culture of unbounded colaboration on the other hand alows or even incentivizes employes to work acros traditional boundaries for instance in cros functional groups sometimes it even means working outside of the organization when you ned to aces expertise that doesn exist within the organization itself historicaly this kind of interdisciplinary work was handled asynchronously one team would work on their portion of project before handing it of to another team that iterative proces is just not fast enough anymore for digital transformation to suced culture of unbounded colaboration is esential trying lots of new and out of the box ideas is esential to learn what works and what doesn in the uncertain and fast moving proces of digital transformation but employes are unwiling to try new things if they believe they wil be laughed at or even punished if their ideas fail organizations must explicitly incentivize risk taking and even failure by this hinds doesn mean when we know how to do something right and just get slopy that preventable failure that should be discouraged but organizations should encourage the other kind of failure discused by edmonsdon inteligent failures at the frontier these are failures that provide new knowledge they re learning oportunities for digital transformation to suced an organization culture must embrace this second sort of failure the botom line for dr hinds and for those both leading and participating in digital transformation is that suces is as much about the right culture as it is about the right technology digital transformation requires rethinking organizations cultures structures and systems and the way that people think about their work and work together she believes these changes aren just for industries that we usualy think of as hi tech nor are they just the preserve of top executives even industries that are typicaly thought about as being low tech wil be and are experiencing radical changes dr hinds says recaling recent trip to dairy farm where the cows were milked automaticaly and output was monitored remotely via ipad it important to be ready she concludes digital transformation is pervasive and it is always beter to be in the know and be able to anticipate some of these things so that we can get ahead of the and make contribution for those loking to prepare is available here or learn more about
