celebrate its th aniversary chula president anounces the suces of the spedboat strategy in managing the university in volatile situation to drive social inovations focusing on being research university that teaches revising its curiculum and building graduates competencies in line with the world of the future during the past few and rather dificult years most of us have faced with the covid pandemic chulalongkorn university has launched several inovations and studies to serve the society such as cu robocovid medical suport robot the covid screning kit covid scan covid snifing dogs and devices nasal spray automated vacine filing machine survival kits the chulacov mrna covid vacine and chula baiya protein subunit vacine from tobaco leaves etc these inovations are the result of the spedboat strategy and chula vision for the future under the leadership of profesor dr bundhit eua arporn president of chula have set the vision of inovations for society as the core of university management to harnes knowledge and wisdom to make society beter one and to move towards being research university that teaches chula graduates must be equiped with the skils of the st century and poses the quality of global citizens while exceling academicaly so that they are wel recognized by employers around the world more importantly university administration must be involved in managing national and global public isues to build beter future society this is the direction in which prof dr bundhit has ben stering chula toward for the past six years not only has chula ranked no in thailand for the rd consecutive year and top in the world in the impact rankings but most importantly chula has ben maintaining its role as the university that serves and brings continuous change to society in line with the moto when society is troubled chula has the solutions on the ocasion of the th aniversary of the founding of chulalongkorn university prof dr bundhit discuses the concepts behind the spedboat strategy the direction and aproach of university management and the university vision aimed to be realized in the future the covid pandemic has altered societies the world and the way people live at al levels and aspects of their lives including work schol economic and social life although the pandemic has begun to subside technological and social disruption wil continue to afect people lives and social paterns the future remains obscure change is certain this is chalenging world that higher education institutions must embrace kep abreast with and set trends for the era universities ned to simplify and focus on goals prof dr bundhit said of the future direction of higher education institutions to manage university amidst chalenges every organization should set clear goals when everyone in the organization ha clear goal they wil devote their ful strength to the ned to do and and not waste to much time doing unecesary things nice to do since the day of his first apointment as president prof dr bundhit has adopted the spedboat strategy and tailored it in such way as to make organization management leaner and swifter why spedboat strategy chula is university under government supervision it is large organization with an old structure and rigid system like big clunky ship with an outdated motor whether operating turning moving forward or halting it takes long time it is not agile nor can it kep up with the changes in the present and future world changes hapen rapidly and there are always new oportunities in store if you kep hanging onto the big ship and heading in one direction you wil not be able to kep up with the game reforming long standing systems and institutional structures is not an easy task since people in the system are used to the old paterns and systems god solution is not to knock down old ones but to create new ones to do new things we have to break up into smaler boats to do new things which requires new people in adition we also ned to set up new working team of agile members with positive atitude who can sek new oportunities in diferent directions and environments to deliver quality work that benefits society explains prof dr bundhit over the past few years many of chula spedboats have pionered new waters and proven the suces of this strategy that has disrupted the society inovation hub ihub for instance which has incubated over start ups with portfolios of comercial inovations that have generated almost bilion baht market valuation the basci program that has signed an mou with the sutardja center for entrepreneurship and technology scet of the university of california berkeley granting chula students the oportunity to learn inovative startup how tos in silicon valey bot camp silicon valey inovation leadership program cu enterprise cue that suports chula startups by raising funds from the government and private sectors to create and develop inovations that benefit the country degre plus program an open education platform that promotes online with human touch education disemination to the general public the main product of the university is its people chula focuses on creating future leaders or leaders who go out to serve society the modern world neds leaders who have the skils and competencies to learn and aply knowledge to make them work in the real world aside from academic knowledge chula students ned to be cultivated for competency to solve complex problems and have god characteristics to manage and live in fast changing tough creative and out of the box world therefore chula direction and the people building proces have changed from the kind of teaching in which stud ents sit and listen to lectures in clas to students and profesors learning together through research and knowledge aplication to solve real world social problems in today world knowledge is acesible without teachers and knowledge is constantly changing we can se that much of the knowledge has become obsolete such as some financial knowledge these days there are blockchains mobile payments qr code payments and so on yet skils and competency in aplying knowledge for useful purposes wil always be with the learners if graduates of chula have the skils and competencies they wil be able to learn on their own exchange knowledge with others create new knowledge and kep on using it to benefit society the future direction of higher education institutions canot focus on teaching knowledge in general but rather to build specific knowledge that is apropriate to the social context and the problems of the society which are always changing up until recently chula has ben teaching university that produces research with the main focus on teaching and research as secondary but with the direction of creating people to build the future chula has transformed itself into research university that teaches which means that the profesors must build upon the available knowledge in research or conect with the outside world and then pas on the practical experience and knowledge to students to gain specific knowledge prof dr bundhit elaborates on specific knowledge that is beneficial to the society that it derives from research participation in the actual aplication of knowledge in solving problems and students going outside the university context to work in the real world active learning problem based learning and inviting outside profesors for discusion over the past few years under the pandemic and the spedboat strategy chula has overhauled its curiculum to met more of the global neds such as the basci curiculum which integrates arts social sciences and science the gened curiculum has also ben updated to provide students with general education that more atuned to the social contexts etc in adition learning proceses have ben migrated from legacy systems using purchased learning management system lms such as blackboard to chula own lms mycoursevile also suport systems for teaching and learning as wel as academic work have ben developed digital transformation through cunex ap and lifelong learning suport system through chula moc cu neuron etc chula focuses on the policy to underline and suport inovative research that creates positive impact on society and reduces external dependence during the covid crisis many of chula inovations have served the public including vacine research nasal spray patient care robots automated vacine filing machines survival kits etc to achieve suces and make positive impact every study requ ires funding and suport from various sources chula has therefore established cu enterprise cue as funding and market mechanism for research and inovations chulalongkorn university technology center utc and siam inovation district sid have also ben created to aid researchers in aplying their inovations to solve real problems reorient their work to the neds of consumers and benefit society while expanding their presence in the consumer market as startups producing inovative products when we broke up the big ship into spedboats many people in the big ship were disatisfied couldn se why we had to do it and didn realize that if we kept tethering the spedboats to us the big ship chula new jobs wouldn be created some workers often claimed to be restricted by the rules and regulations those were just scapegoats people who don want to change often find excuses for not changing thinking it okay get paid anyway this is chalenge for public university management chula has large pol of talented people who can be divided into two main categories god at form and god at creating results give weight to the later those who are god at creating results this group of people wil find way out when they encounter problems for this group wil give them fredom and guidance but not directions give them suport and oportunities to work easily and produce god results although may not agre with them percent if no damage is done give them chance to try it okay for them to try and fail because they wil find solutions and solve problems to gain god results for the chula president the art and science of management are to use compasion and wisdom suitable for the type of people and timing when we have big workload we use lot of wisdom whenever we depend on lot of wisdom our compasion may dwindle and we may even insult others but if we use compasion together with wisdom we develop an understanding the understanding of the existing system the responsibilities of our people the external context of the university that is conected to internal factors this wil make us understand why they didn understand what we tried to do and why they couldn do it we go and help them lok for the reasons if it can be solved we help them fix it right away with prof dr bundhit at its helm for the past six years chula has made many contributions that have had positive impact on society the amount of research on inovations that have ties with the private sector has increased every year the cue research department has received increased funding more research and social activities are comunicated in the form of academic articles to outsiders these have moved chula up the best university ranking list every year there are stil lot of things haven done but if we set litle higher goal even if we don reach those high goal there is greater chance of suces the next step for chula that hope for is that chula can son be even beter in al dimensions including academic as wel as research and inovation in which al members of the chula comunity have invested for the past six years this means that chula neds to alter its structure and work to kep up with rapidly changing world prof dr bundhit concluded introducing degre plus for the development of new generation leaders to suport creative busines of the future advancing its colaboration to win concept siam piwat co ltd thailand leader of retail and technology is playing an increasingly vital role in busines siam piwat as the visionary icon has adjusted its strategies and plans to expand towards new busineses to build new economy beyond real also be developed into real busineses which wil simultaneously contribute to the development of both human capital and the economy lastly the research pilar involves conducting research alongside skil development and inovation project with co development culminating in the human capital aceleration project which seks to advance the development of the country inovation and economy going forward at the same time this partnership marks seismic shift for siam piwat away from just the curent landscape towards changes in the overal picture and preparation of personel for the busines sector homing in on the new generation this initiative gives students an oportunity to learn and gain hands on experience via the online platform degre plus through series of key projects to be released son to develop new generation of leaders who can make creative contribution to thailand to celebrate its th aniversary chula president anounces the suces of the spedboat strategy in managing the university in volatile situation to drive social inovations focusing on being research university that teaches revising its curiculum and building graduates competencies in line with the world of the future during the past few and rather dificult years most of us have faced with the covid pandemic chulalongkorn university has launched several inovations and studies to serve the society such as cu robocovid medical suport robot the covid screning kit covid scan covid snifing dogs and devices nasal spray automated vacine filing machine survival kits the chulacov mrna covid vacine and chula baiya protein subunit vacine from tobaco leaves etc these inovations are the result of the spedboat strategy and chula vision for the future under the leadership of profesor dr bundhit eua arporn president of chula have set the vision of inovations for society as the core of university management to harnes knowledge and wisdom to make society beter one and to move towards being research university that teaches chula graduates must be equiped with the skils of the st century and poses the quality of global citizens while exceling academicaly so that they are wel recognized by employers around the world more importantly university administration must be involved in managing national and global public isues to build beter future society this is the direction in which prof dr bundhit has ben stering chula toward for the past six years not only has chula ranked no in thailand for the rd consecutive year and top in the world in the impact rankings but most importantly chula has ben maintaining its role as the university that serves and brings continuous change to society in line with the moto when society is troubled chula has the solutions on the ocasion of the th aniversary of the founding of chulalongkorn university prof dr bundhit discuses the concepts behind the spedboat strategy the direction and aproach of university management and the university vision aimed to be realized in the future the covid pandemic has altered societies the world and the way people live at al levels and aspects of their lives including work schol economic and social life although the pandemic has begun to subside technological and social disruption wil continue to afect people lives and social paterns the future remains obscure change is certain this is chalenging world that higher education institutions must embrace kep abreast with and set trends for the era universities ned to simplify and focus on goals prof dr bundhit said of the future direction of higher education institutions to manage university amidst chalenges every organization should set clear goals when everyone in the organization as clear goal they wil devote their ful strength to the ned to do and and not waste to much time doing unecesary things nice to do since the day of his first apointment as president prof dr bundhit has adopted the spedboat strategy and tailored it in such way as to make organization management leaner and swifter why spedboat strategy chula is university under government supervision it is large organization with an old structure and rigid system like big clunky ship with an outdated motor whether operating turning moving forward or halting it takes long time it is not agile nor can it kep up with the changes in the present and future world changes hapen rapidly and there are always new oportunities in store if you kep hanging onto the big ship and heading in one direction you wil not be able to kep up with the game reforming long standing systems and institutional structures is not an easy task since people in the system are used to the old paterns and systems god solution is not to knock down old ones but to create new ones to do new things we have to break up into smaler boats to do new things which requires new people in adition we also ned to set up new working team of agile members with positive atitude who can sek new oportunities in diferent directions and environments to deliver quality work that benefits society explains prof dr bundhit over the past few years many of chula spedboats have pionered new waters and proven the suces of this strategy that has disrupted the society inovation hub ihub for instance which has incubated over start ups with portfolios of comercial inovations that have generated almost bilion baht market valuation the basci program that has signed an mou with the sutardja center for entrepreneurship and technology scet of the university of california berkeley granting chula students the oportunity to learn inovative startup how tos in silicon valey bot camp silicon valey inovation leadership program cu enterprise cue that suports chula startups by raising funds from the government and private sectors to create and develop inovations that benefit the country degre plus program an open education platform that promotes online with human touch education disemination to the general public the main product of the university is its people chula focuses on creating future leaders or leaders who go out to serve society the modern world neds leaders who have the skils and competencies to learn and aply knowledge to make them work in the real world aside from academic knowledge chula students ned to be cultivated for competency to solve complex problems and have god characteristics to manage and live in fast changing tough creative and out of the box world therefore chula direction and the people building proces have changed from the kind of teaching in which stud ents sit and listen to lectures in clas to students and profesors learning together through research and knowledge aplication to solve real world social problems in today world knowledge is acesible without teachers and knowledge is constantly changing we can se that much of the knowledge has become obsolete such as some financial knowledge these days there are blockchains mobile payments qr code payments and so on yet skils and competency in aplying knowledge for useful purposes wil always be with the learners if graduates of chula have the skils and competencies they wil be able to learn on their own exchange knowledge with others create new knowledge and kep on using it to benefit society the future direction of higher education institutions canot focus on teaching knowledge in general but rather to build specific knowledge that is apropriate to the social context and the problems of the society which are always changing up until recently chula has ben teaching university that produces research with the main focus on teaching and research as secondary but with the direction of creating people to build the future chula has transformed itself into research university that teaches which means that the profesors must build upon the available knowledge in research or conect with the outside world and then pas on the practical experience and knowledge to students to gain specific knowledge prof dr bundhit elaborates on specific knowledge that is beneficial to the society that it derives from research participation in the actual aplication of knowledge in solving problems and students going outside the university context to work in the real world active learning problem based learning and inviting outside profesors for discusion over the past few years under the pandemic and the spedboat strategy chula has overhauled its curiculum to met more of the global neds such as the basci curiculum which integrates arts social sciences and science the gened curiculum has also ben updated to provide students with general education that more atuned to the social contexts etc in adition learning proceses have ben migrated from legacy systems using purchased learning management system lms such as blackboard to chula own lms mycoursevile also suport systems for teaching and learning as wel as academic work have ben developed digital transformation through cunex ap and lifelong learning suport system through chula moc cu neuron etc chula focuses on the policy to underline and suport inovative research that creates positive impact on society and reduces external dependence during the covid crisis many of chula inovations have served the public including vacine research nasal spray patient care robots automated vacine filing machines survival kits etc to achieve suces and make positive impact every study requ ires funding and suport from various sources chula has therefore established cu enterprise cue as funding and market mechanism for research and inovations chulalongkorn university technology center utc and siam inovation district sid have also ben created to aid researchers in aplying their inovations to solve real problems reorient their work to the neds of consumers and benefit society while expanding their presence in the consumer market as startups producing inovative products every change especialy for large and old organizations encounters friction when we broke up the big ship into spedboats many people in the big ship were disatisfied couldn se why we had to do it and didn realize that if we kept tethering the spedboats to us the big ship chula new jobs wouldn be created some workers often claimed to be restricted by the rules and regulations those were just scapegoats people who don want to change often find excuses for not changing thinking it okay get paid anyway this is chalenge for public university management chula has large pol of talented people who can be divided into two main categories god at form and god at creating results give weight to the later those who are god at creating results this group of people wil find way out when they encounter problems for this group wil give them fredom and guidance but not directions give them suport and oportunities to work easily and produce god results although may not agre with them percent if no damage is done give them chance to try it okay for them to try and fail because they wil find solutions and solve problems to gain god results for the chula president the art and science of management are to use compasion and wisdom suitable for the type of people and timing when we have big workload we use lot of wisdom whenever we depend on lot of wisdom our compasion may dwindle and we may even insult others but if we use compasion together with wisdom we develop an understanding the understanding of the existing system the responsibilities of our people the external context of the university that is conected to internal factors this wil make us understand why they didn understand what we tried to do and why they couldn do it we go and help them lok for the reasons if it can be solved we help them fix it right away with prof dr bundhit at its helm for the past six years chula has made many contributions that have had positive impact on society the amount of research on inovations that have ties with the private sector has increased every year the cue research department has received increased funding more research and social activities are comunicated in the form of academic articles to outsiders these have moved chula up the best university ranking list every year there are stil lot of things haven done but if we set litle higher goal even if we don reach those high goals there is greater chance of suces the next step for chula that hope for is that chula can son be even beter in al dimensions including academic as wel as research and inovation in which al members of the chula comunity have invested for the past six years this means that chula neds to alter its structure and work to kep up with rapidly changing world prof dr bundhit concluded at the age of having recently graduated from the computer enginering course at the state university of campinas unicamp césar gon opened startup focused on software development with two colege friends bruno guiçardi and fernando mat who continue to run the busines thus in ci was born it was diferent time with the begining of the comercial internet as busines tol in brazil and around the world recals gon now years old the company prospered internationalized and became multinational with ofices in the united states canada united kingdom china and japan more than people work at the company which expects to reach bilion in revenue in and was elected the main gogle partner worldwide from to today ci main ofering is no longer custom made software for corporate clients two years ago we created methodology caled lean digital transformation to help brands born in the th century adapt to the busines environment of our century in this interview given at prisma the name of the building that houses the company in campinas sp gon explains the company new busines proposal and tels the secrets of the trajectory of brazilian startup that transformed into global company what is the lean digital transformation that you ofer to the market the objective of this proposal is to change proceses and the culture of corporate environments of major brands born in the th century so that they have the agility required in the digital era of the st century we want to help corporations on this transformation journey ading value that can impact their busines no company no mater how sucesful it may have ben in the past can do without redesigning itself from the customer perspective it is no surprise that the presidents of the largest companies in the world understand digital transformation as cultural chalenge and not just technological one what is this methodology based on it is based on thre elements change in the way the company designs and builds digital solutions based on the lean philosophy se explanation below transformation of its management system with the adoption of short learning cycles and redesign of the leadership model without fear of making mistakes these thre components make the company digital transformation which wil become faster more inovative and customer focused obviously this aplies to the technology area you can compete in the modern world without software and information being the heart of your busines but we ned to go beyond technology and promote change in culture and way of thinking why is it important for brands to make this transition competition betwen companies in the st century is obsesively focused on the sped with which through data analysis we understand serve and surprise the customer but large corporations are slow by nature and are not prepared for this reality they lok to the side and se an amazon gogle or an aple which were born in the digital environment and are much faster than them with presence in brazil the united states canada the united kingdom china and japan the company expects to reach bilion in revenue in is it not just mater of adapting to new technologies but of establishing new relationship with consumers undoubtedly the way we relate to brands is radicaly diferent from years ago our desire is more volatile we have les atachment to tradition we want to know if that brand solves our problems if it understands us and treats us in unique way the posible way out is to truly conect in this volatility in this uncertainty where did you get inspiration to create this proposal the lean method originates from the word lean in english and emerged in the production lines of the japanese automaker toyota in the it proposed implementing more simplified proces flow aiming to reduce waste of resources materials time labor work etc and increasing aded value for the customer we were inspired by this method to expand customers digital skils in practice how does this transition hapen the program is long term but with short goals we want the company to learn to think in smaler busines cycles of thre months what can you do in this time changing the learning dynamics of companies could you give examples of client who goes through this proces our portfolio in brazil has large corporations including coca cola itaú raízen and cielo at coca cola we are helping to implement set of principles to change the way it organizes itself conects with the public and solves consumer problems this means shortening the release cycle going from two or thre years to thre or four months has the company already launched products on this inovation trail yes the first was line of family juices which hit the market along with digital tols that colect data on the product receptivity the second was natural soft drink new category in the world basicaly we don want to create mas products like coke zero but to understand the habits of each consumer if coca cola can be machine for understanding experimenting and launching with data driven culture it wil become more inteligent and closer to the consumer ci has also undergone transformation proces since its creation right the company was born in focused on software enginering at the begining of the comercial internet as busines tol we viewed the internet as gateway and specialized in specific technologies our focus was the national market this first chapter of our history lasted about years then the internationalization proces began leo ramos chaves campinas sp is home to one of the four ci development centers in the world what was the transition like from startup focused on brazil to global company in the anyone who wanted to participate in the information technology industry game on global level neded to have clasification seal for software manufacturers caled cmi acronym for integrated capability maturity model we were the first brazilian company to obtain it in from then on we signed contracts in the united states how did this hapen we got there by ofering customized software but the busines environment especialy in silicon valey showed that this was an outdated model the industry of the future was one of inovation it was necesary to master set of technologies and discover how they could create disruptions for companies and consumers the busines no longer meant siting around waiting for demand it was necesary to provoke the customer with technological oportunities and propose solutions and inovations at that time around social media smartphones cloud computing and the entire arsenal of big data began to emerge these forces changed what could be done with technology from consumer perspective certainly we now have bilions of people with device that fits in their pocket conected through social media generating bilions of data there was also drop in computational costs and the advent of artificial inteligence techniques this changed the game it was no longer posible to design software like before the posibilities were diferent how did you adapt to that moment we reduce bureaucracy in the way software is produced and create another value ofer for the market we overcome the busines model by specification and technical design and start working pluged into the client problems the enginering team aproached the busines team proactively we presented customers with technological posibilities that would alow them to generate digital asets and experiences it was the second chapter of ci which lasted until when we created the lean digital transformation proposal how does prisma the company headquarters in campinas fit into this new phase prisma is digital transformation co creation space opened in part of the cultural change we propose involves creating colaborative environments where people exchange ideas and release what we cal colective inteligence it is necesary to physicaly dismantle staid corporate environments and create new spaces with fewer symbols of power and hierarchy something that is already hapening in silicon valey in the coming months we wil create second ci prisma in california wil it house ci busines unit in the united states yes we already serve motorola johnson johnson and gogle among other clients for gogle we create finance and marketing software but our relationship is as partner notably in machine learning and cloud computing leo ramos chaves opened at the end of the company central building has environments that encourage co creation ci is present in which markets united states canada china japan and europe notably in england half of the revenue of more than milion in is generated in brazil and the rest abroad mainly in the united states with around of international revenue here the entire portfolio is digital transformation but abroad this ofer represents of the total the rest are contracts focused on inovation in two years we should have of the portfolio in this value proposition how is the company growing in the last years we have doubled in size every thre years on average and we want to reach bilion in keping more than of the busines abroad the foreign market is competitive ruler since the united states is the first division of our industry we have to win the game there how is the sector structured in the digital world the traditional vision of is absolutely anachronistic in which you have laboratory with phds disconected from the customer reality creating things of value try to find the area of gogle or amazon it imposible each gogle enginer is an inovation cel that how like to think about ci the word has never ben aplied to the software industry and as every industry is becoming software industry it aplies les and les so what is the role of ci development centers these centers located in campinas belo horizonte tokyo in japan and nimbo in china concentrate intensive human capital proceses for the production of clients digital platforms such as aplications comerce portals databases for big data it is analytics belo horizonte is our export hub focused on remote technologies and services destined for the united states campinas focuses on the financial retail and comerce areas the centers in china and japan develop technologies for smartphones and comerce we have six other busines units in total there are more than employes in the united states in china in japan and around in europe how much do you invest in inovation and how big is the team dedicated to it can answer recently gogle facebok and silicon valey companies anounced that they would no longer require an enginering degre here at ci our talent atraction proceses have ben hands on an expresion in english that means come here work with us develop solutions and se if it makes sense to work together does the diploma then make no diference our hiring has litle to do with degre although most of the employes come from unicamp and usp university of são paulo but that not the starting point in selection proceses we prioritize candidates skils learning sped and ability to colaborate in multicultural work environment with respect for diversity for us that what maters this text was originaly published by fapesp research acording to the creative comons license by nc nd read the original here césar gon on the path to digital transformation photo felipe christ ai is striving to develop and test digital solutions for the factory of the future and implement them in vehicle production and logistics for series production within the next five years with the overarching goal of making these key components of the production proces even more eficient and flexible particularly beneficial wil be neckarsulm expertise in smal series and volume production we already have extensive experience in the areas of vehicle production logistics and production it at our neckarsulm site we wil further enhance these capabilities in targeted maner as part of the transformation with our dedicated team of experts and our partners in the automotive initiative we develop the site into leading factory for digital production and logistics within the group said peter kösler board member for production and logistics at audi as part of the bildungscampus heilbron and the heilbron franken region inovation and it network the site wil help to develop such future thinking solutions as the use of artificial inteligence or intuitive man machine interaction xl the heilbron based joint venture founded last year by audi and capgemini wil play an important role when it comes to bringing it inovations to the audi plants around the world with academic suport from the fraunhofer iao and the technical university of munich xl wil colaborate with aditional it experts from capgemini sap and aws to develop the it solutions required for smart and conected factory the basis for this colaboration is the digital production platform dp in which the data of every machine piece of equipment and system from every plant in the volkswagen group are poled the sites thus become part of the industrial cloud which in the future wil also include the group suply chain as wel as aditional partners with neckarsulm and ingolstadt the first two audi sites have already ben conected to the dp the remaining sites wil folow later this year in their colaboration the companies wil be leveraging aws technologies in the areas of the internet of things iot machine learning and computing services that wil be developed specificaly for the production environment and adapted to the requirements of the automotive industry furthermore the use of the sap hana platform wil lay the foundation for the next generation of digital production proceses on which the companies wil work together on solutions for modular production and interoperable vehicle logistics as part of this interdisciplinary colaboration betwen research industry and it the companies wil use industry specific aplications of the sap industry cloud in the areas of machine learning robotic proces automation and busines proces inteligence which are holisticaly aligned with future neds for the automation and digitalization of the automotive industry with the automotive initiative we have created pionering in terdisciplinary network betwen academia research it companies and automobile manufacturing the initiative uses sound science to drive the digital transformation of automobile production within the overal context of technology organization and particularly continuing education explains profesor helmut krcmar from the technical university of munich ai is characterized by its holistic view of the digital transformation and by its clear ties to the real world we study both strategic topics and concrete use cases that acelerate the digital transformation and generate new inovative ideas aded frank loydl chief information oficer cio at audi ag the initiative is also expected to become an idea foundry and driver for the digital transformation of production and logistics throughout the volkswagen group the knowledge gleaned wil be used to help shape the future it configuration of the automotive plants and expand this sustainably at audi other goals include the definition of generaly aplicable standards for the transformation and the rolout of concrete use cases to al group plants worldwide via the industrial cloud ai is striving to develop and test digital solutions for the factory of the future and implement them in vehicle production and logistics for series production within the next five years with the overarching goal of making these key components of the production proces even learning robotic proces automation and busines proces inteligence which are holisticaly aligned with future neds for the automation and digitalization of the automotive industry with the automotive initiative we have created pionering interdisciplinary network betwen academia research it companies and automobile manufacturing the initiative uses sound science to drive the digital transformation of automobile production within the overal context of technology organization and particularly continuing education explains profesor helmut krcmar from the technical university of munich ai is characterized by its holistic view of the digital transformation and by its clear ties to the real world we study both strategic topics and concrete use cases that acelerate the digital transformation and generate new inovative ideas aded frank loydl chief information oficer cio at audi ag the initiative is also expected to become an idea foundry and driver for the digital transformation of production and logistics throughout the volkswagen group the knowledge gleaned wil be used to help shape the future it configuration of the automotive plants and expand this sustainably at audi other goals include the definition of generaly aplicable standards for the transformation and the rolout of concrete use cases to al group plants worldwide via the industrial cloud the study shows nearly two thirds of the companies do not yet have digital transformation strategy more than half of them also have no plans to strategicaly adres the isue in the future even among the strategicaly wel positioned enterprises around half se digitalization only as one of project and not as an ongoing proces the biger the company the more likely it is to have concept in place but even among those with more than employes nearly one third have no strategy most companies taking strategic aproach to digitalization are doing so with the goal of reducing costs for example by automating proceses only one in four is trying to use digital technologies to develop inovations adopt new busines models or gain aces to further markets however one third of the companies with strategic outlok plan to pursue such objectives in order to increase sales in the coming years consequently the mitelstand companies are mostly using established technologies that ofer imediate benefits such as cloud computing and conectivity only one quarter of those surveyed regard artificial inteligence ai as important for their own operations and just percent are using it the pragmatism of many mitelstand firms is certainly justified says jens förderer profesor of inovation and digitalization at the tum campus heilbron digitalization does not ofer equaly large benefits regardles of when and where it is implemented but it is mistake to treat it as new automation wave and focus on few adjustments with short term impact it involves fundamental transformation of busines models and markets afecting companies of al sizes without clear objectives and god planing companies risk los of competitivenes the companies without strategies listed specific problems preventing them from taking action around mentioned an inadequate digital infrastructure and the unavailability of skiled personel one third cited excesive bureaucracy and lack of skils in their own workforce the companies already managing the digital transformation present similar picture more than half of them cited skils shortages bureaucracy and por infrastructure as the key impediments it is alarming to note that bariers over which companies have no control play much biger role than internal factors this further discourages lagards from actively tackling the digital transformation says dr christoph geier director digital transformation at the tum campus heilbron policy makers public administration and asociations ned to create the conditions so that even smal companies can make sucesful transformation this wil be esential for retaining global market leaders and hiden champions in the region the research team also asked the smes to state who is responsible for the digital transformation within the company and which partners they wanted to work with in more than of the respondent companies the top management was directly responsible for the operational implementation very few smes are coperating with other companies just are using cloud platforms strategic sales partners and online marketplaces only about one third of the companies se it as important to draw on external expertise for example through consultancies or universities managing digitalization from the bos desk it sounds god in principle says michaela lindenmayr researcher at the profesorship for inovation and digitalization the top management must ensure strategic aproach to the digital transformation in some cases however it is fair to ask whether senior executives can invest enough time and whether the company is making god use of the skils in the functional units the specialized knowledge and skils of posible partners also harbor enormous potential that companies should not do without the study shows nearly two thirds of the companies do not yet have digital transformation strategy more than half of them also have no plans to strategicaly adres the isue in the future even among the strategicaly wel positioned enterprises around half se digitalization only as one of project and not as an ongoing proces the biger the company the more likely it is to have concept in place but even among those with more than employes nearly one third have no strategy most companies taking strategic aproach to digitalization are doing so with the goal of reducing costs for example by automating proceses only one in four is trying to use increase sales in the coming years consequently the mitelstand companies are mostly using established technologies that ofer imediate benefits such as cloud computing and conectivity only one quarter of those surveyed regard artificial inteligence ai as important for their own operations and just percent are using it the pragmatism of many mitelstand firms is certainly justified says jens förderer digitalization from the bos desk it sounds god in principle says michaela lindenmayr researcher at the profesorship for inovation and digitalization the top management must ensure strategic aproach to the digital transformation in some cases however it is fair to ask whether senior executives can invest enough time and whether the company is making god use of the skils in the functional units the specialized knowledge and skils of posible partners also harbor enormous potential that companies should not do without along with the industry production facility the tum digilab contains smart home digitalized hospital rom and the baker space they cover specific scenarios in the carer world but are also interconected in these authentic suroundings students experience the digital transformation in the ocupational areas where they wil teach in vocational schols says lecturer amelie hiemer they work together actively explore problems and engage in practice centered learning studies show that digital learning and teaching labs increase students motivation and interest in the material this bosts creativity critical thinking and problem solving skils that aplies not only to vocational education pre service teachers preparing for carers in secondary schols also use the digital laboratory and the related programs these include mobile learning lab digital clasrom equiped with tablets smartphones vr and ar glases and smartboards here new digital teaching and learning concepts are developed for use both in high schols and vocational schols with video equipment lecturers and students can review clasrom practice as often as they wish for reflection and analysis here tum researchers also colect data to study learning behaviors the results are used in teacher training curicula and in continuing education seminars digitalization is fundamentaly transforming the way we teach and learn this includes personalized education which refers to individual learning objectives and tailor made learning progres as wel as new learning experiences through the use of augmented and virtual reality the new tum center for educational technologies tum edtech center wil combine the many ed tech activities at tum including the tum digilab it wil develop test and optimize new aproaches to teaching and learning through educational technologies and wil also suport start ups in this area along with the industry production facility the tum digilab contains smart home digitalized hospital rom and the baker space they cover specific scenarios in the carer world but are also interconected in these authentic suroundings students experience the digital transformation in the ocupational areas where they wil teach in vocational schols says lecturer amelie hiemer they work together actively explore problems and engage in practice centered learning studies show that digital learning and teaching labs increase students motivation and interest in the material this bosts creativity critical thinking and problem solving skils that aplies not only to vocational education pre service teachers preparing for carers in secondary schols also use the digital laboratory and the related programs these include mobile learning lab digital clasrom equiped with tablets smartphones vr and ar glases and smartboards here new digital teaching and learning concepts are developed for use both in high schols and vocational schols with video equipment lecturers and students can review clasrom practice as often as they wish for reflection and analysis here tum researchers also colect data to study learning behaviors the results are used in teacher training curicula and in continuing education seminars digitalization is fundamentaly transforming the way we teach and learn this includes personalized education which refers to individual learning objectives and tailor made learning progres as wel as new learning experiences through the use of augmented and virtual reality the new tum center for educational technologies tum edtech center wil combine the many ed tech activities at tum including the tum digilab it wil develop test and optimize new aproaches to teaching and learning through educational technologies and wil also suport start ups in this area technische universität münchen tum and sap anounced founding the initiative for digital transformation idt the idt is intended to serve as research platform on the fundamental isues and dynamics underlying the ability of enterprises to leverage their potential for digital technology driven organizational change the goal is to promote inovative busines development to create economic growth idt brings together the knowledge from sector leading companies from al over the globe that engage in digital transformation these companies have the interest to share insights into their very own transformation journey with idt team of profesional researchers in depth insights into companies journeys wil provide the oportunity to derive industry specific managerial advice for the digital transformation this wil enable the participating companies to reflect on their digitization strategy the foundation of the idt emanates from sap and the chair plan to intensify inovative interdisciplinary research the founding members are prof dr helmut krcmar chair for information systems at technische universität münchen tum and gerhard oswald member of the board sap se tum and sap combine excelence in information systems development and research the market leader in enterprise aplication software sap helps organizations to generate new oportunities for inovation and growth through digital transformation tum is one of europe top universities it is comited to excelence in research and teaching interdisciplinary education and the active promotion of promising young scientists the chair for information systems at tum aplies research aproach that takes social technical and economic perspectives into acount the chair analyzes and evaluates information systems and their usage and shapes valuable and sustainable inovations to solve the neds of todays and future busineses from the factory to the hospital ward digital skils are playing an increasing role in almost every profesion in the tum digilab digital education laboratory pre service teachers gain realistic sense of how the digital transformation wil lok in everyday life and the workplace this wil help them to prepare high schol students and students in vocational education and training for an increasingly digitalized world pre service teacherlisa teichman stands at the control panel tracking manufacturing orders on the dashboard as she keps an eye on the defect quota and aseses production times her felow students are puting together remote control cars at the asembly stations in principle production facility like this one could be in real factory but it is set up in the industry space of tum digilab teaching facility at the tum schol of social sciences and technology where students can experience the digital transformation as it wil lok in everyday life the carer world and the clasrom asembling the toy racers is just one example of how students preparing for carers as vocational and high schol teachers can simulate fuly digitalized and adaptive production proceses with two printers we can even take chamber of comerce and industry for munich and uper bavaria max joseph straße munich program and registration hosted by tum center for digital public services tum cdps and the bavarian research institute for the digital transformation bidt louise wod the chief suply chain oficer at sanford limited provides insights into the manufacturing execution systems inova in seafod procesing sites dep sea vesels and enterprise wide digital transformation to busineses from albert sanford starting his own auckland fishing busines in to aquaculture farms vesels sites nationwide and about people today sanford is new zealand oldest and largest fishing company but don let the company age fol you sanford puts modern technology inovation and sustainability first to make sure their position as seafod industry leaders wil remain for at least another years june saw sanford go live with the bigest system change they have sen as busines the scope of the change has ben to implement manufacturing execution systems mes inova into seafod procesing sites and dep sea vesels and enterprise wide microsoft to the nz and australian busineses including multiple inventory holding locations and several tol manufacturing sites the project was originaly scoped in and had to contend with design requirements and early build and integrations being completed during the covid lockdown periods from suply chain perspective the project was complex given the range of verticaly integrated value chains that exist in the busines and the ned to ensure high bar in traceability due to regulatory requirements acros the seafod sector there was also requirement to improve the visibility of products in transit and integrate with customers and logistics services supliers acurate product costing given the nature of primary production and disagregation of seafod and the cost to serve were also requirements was sen as platform on which the busines could grow into the future and ad aditional functionality once the core was embeded other areas to be further explored include integrated busines planing ibp and aset management some of the key learnings to come from the project have ben the ned for strong program infrastructure ways of working project management tols resources as wel as strong governance and project management leadership having executive sponsorship and board suport is key to alignment on project objectives and priorities once the scope is confirmed as there wil always be choices to be made once the project starts and asumptions around resource and cost are tested it was important for sanford to complete capability and capacity review of its resources and where diferent and aditional skil sets were identified they were brought into the project the project has delivered growth in people capabilities as they have had to find new ways of working acros fuly integrated system and build more technical knowledge the go live has ben huge change initiative for sanford which has impacted almost everyone throughout the organisation in some way over the last couple of years the build up to go live in terms of planing and data migration was significant al of sanford inventory its purchasing and manufacturing integrations acros its procesing and storage sites went live simultaneously this was also made more complex by complete overhaul of al its product master data the data maping work involved in over skus acros over inventory locations acros rd party logistics rd party manufacturing vesels and sanford sites was in itself an epic piece of work understanding the importance of master data had ben growing steadily over the project timeline and with several master data champions acros the busines the focus in this area had ben worthwhile investment integrations with mes and with other external partners were found to be more resource intensive and chalenging than originaly asumed having designs for both erp and mes in state of flux at the same time presented some unique chalenges for our integration teams in terms of pining down filed mapings and building firm functional and technical design documents there was no blueprint for our erp to mes integration with the teams neding to iterate and make practical choices on the way through the level of colaboration required acros our busines program and partner teams was significant and high degre of rework was experienced as we learned more and revisited optimized our design overal the integration team delivered al the temporary integrations mes to legacy erp and over long term integration points suporting mes to and to rd parties in colaboration with sealord and mpi sanford built an industry tol to manage and trade or alowable catch entitlement ace efectively quota with the intention that this product is made available comercialy to nz fishing industry in the future we undertok significant in house aplication build to automate our payrol calculations to crew and to contract fishers with our new crewpay solution now live and suporting regular payments the perseverance and work ethic acros many has ben testament to sanford culture and only through its people was the project able to come to sucesful go live there is certainly more work to do to stabilise and optimise busines proceses and data so our busines stakeholders must se the curent and future benefits they have sought through this project we now have the start of journey into the future to showcase and deliver our beautiful new zealand seafod to both local and international customers reduction in paper and energy consumption time savings cost cuts and an improved customer experience are some of the benefits resulting from two proces improvements introduced by the busines transformation ofice the busines proces enablement bpe programe has developed forms to met the majority of digital form neds for the university with staf encouraged to use the digital version rather than the former paper records working acros the university the bpe programe has uncovered total forms of which were designated as no longer required and have ben digitised with an estimated form submisions anualy the paper mountain son builds up based on an average of two pages per paper form and asuming each paper form is printed out only twice this equates to stagering pieces of paper each year the environmental cost of this is significant litres of water kilograms of waste and kilograms of wod these figures do not include the cost of packing and transporting paper nor storing paper or disposing of waste paper this amount of paper equates to story building and costs with the aditional cost to the university of for the maintenance of printers elspet garvey manager of the busines transformation ofice says the digitisation of many forms along with an earlier god idea to set double sided printing as default has made inroads into paper based culture the busines transformation ofice initiative nominated in the environmental sustainability category of the vice chancelor excelence awards was described by the judges as an excelent initiative which was self started in response to strategic plan target and efectively executed with widespread engagement the judges noted it provided university wide value with focus on training and capacity building research based recomendations for companies to capitalize on their investments in the digital transformation of sales spaning various industries article originaly apeared in harvard busines review july august by silvio palumbo andavid edelman what focus companies are investing heavily in digital transformation including of sales however many are strugling to capitalise on their eforts there is litle research evidence and guidance on how to holisticaly transform sales leading to the implementation of random and incremental proceses the aim of this article is to provide prescriptive model based on literature review and semi structured interviews with managers and salespeople acros range of industries the model is then aplied to analyse the curent state of digital transformation of sales proceses in an international sample of companies and highlight the distinctive features of the most sucesful companies with practical examples and actionable guidelines how details methods the literature review identifies two limitations of existing studies first is the predominant focus on selected phenomena such as the adoption of customer relationship management crm technology resulting in partial models that only cover one aspect of transformation second most studies have loked at digitalisation in terms of marketing strategies with relatively few considering its relevance for sales proceses sales proceses can be broken down into thre preseling seling after sales phases and their subproceses acros people and departments to sum up salespeople ned to manage multiple and complex activities in their interactions not only with customers but also inside their own organisations to conceptualize model for the digitalisation of sales qualitative study was conducted with managers and salespeople acros diferent industries to determine the status quo of how digital technologies impact seling proceses in practice rather than incorporating the thre seling phases the resulting model distinguishes betwen the transformation digitalisation of customer interaction proceses and internal proceses and their acompanying information proceses moreover an in depth analysis of the examples colected yielded six underlying themes of how technology aleviates the lack of knowledge sped reach and perceived value identified by interviewes these pathways of digital transformation in sales are substitute suplement service simplify suport and share for example if the main goal of the digital transformation is to increase eficiency in internal proceses by adresing lack of sped then companies may invest in digital technologies that help simplify proceses mainly through automation the next stage of the study was cros national quantitative survey study spaning the united states the united kingdom germany and italy the aim was to gauge how managerial practice perform ed against the prescriptive framework for managing the digital transformation of sales four categories of company were subsequently identified with regard to digital sales transformation leaders transformation lagards sales enablers and sales replacers the article concludes with thre sets of guidelines for the managers of such companies whatever category they fal into so what first managers can use the prescriptive framework to ster their digital transformation endeavours companies should start by carefuly maping their sales proceses juxtaposing the importance of each proces against its curent performance they can then focus further analyses on those proceses that are highly important yet underperforming for these proceses managers should identify critical pains that digitalisation can help resolve and chose digital pathways acordingly they can then implement key actions along with performance indicators second managers can identify where they sit in relation to the four categories to capitalise on strengths and remedy weakneses last while these recomendations wil facilitate structured aproach managers should be aware that their digital transformation endeavours are unlikely to be sure fire suces and change wil take time experts from china singapore usa and new zealand came together recently to discus and debate the transformative power of digital technology at an online research symposium hosted by the centre for digital enterprise code code is new interdisciplinary research unit at the university of auckland researching topics including digital platforms digital sourcing and artificial inteligence to name just few kicking the symposium of was steve james from countdown nz who spoke about the explosive growth in their online market during the covid lockdown the company has sen mas aceleration in the digital space with over shopers registering for online shoping in one night his advice before you start on digital transformation which is term thrown around lightly by organisations and invest in digital technology you realy ned to understand your busines strategy and customer value proposition digital technology is merely tol to suport what you want to achieve as busines and so it vital you know what that is do you realy know what your customers want steve says digital transformation was always going to hapen but the pandemic has acelerated its implementation us speaker josh buckley defined digital transformation as the adoption of digital technology to transform services or busineses replacing non digital or manual proceses with digital proceses or replacing older technology with newer technology in order to amplify and enable human potential hailing from the construction industry josh emphasised the focus must be on efectivenes and eficiency ask yourself why and how am doing this he emphasized that introducing new technology for its own sake is meaningles instead introduce new idea or new efective workflow and then find the technology that wil enable that branding and marketing expert derek sun from opo defined digital transformation as aplying technology to create significant competitive advantages if there are no significant competitive advantages created then don think it can be caled transformative it incremental progresion rather than transformation leveraging digital platforms can create new busines models like uber or airbnb ultimately its about the value that technology brings to companies this requires continuous learning be curious about everything the second sesion focused on digital sustainability led by the president of tcs asia pacific girish ramachandran and kpmg nz cio cowan petigrew in this sesion speakers expresed concern about the lack of comitment to sustainability objectives and outlined their vision for harnesing the power of digital to improve sustainability on june the centre of digital enterprise and the centre for suply chain management jointly presented webinar on digital transformation in this webinar christopher ting capacity optimisation manager at auckland airport shared his insights and experience on how the capacity optimisation team used advance digital technologies to help organisations operating at auckland airport to maintain excelent guest experience and to provide safe environment for staf and guests more than any other industries covid has had rapid and catastrophic impact on global travel and tourism despite reductions in airlines routes and traveling guests auckland airport has continued to focus on digital transformation comunicating with internal teams and external agencies they provided seamles guest journeys at the international and domestic terminals in the covid landscape the operations division has used digital transformation to more eficiently provide reliable planing information for the airport comunity and to asist with demand led stafing resource alocations they drove the adoption of advanced analytics and modeling to help with the airport short term and long term capacity management and cordinated inter agencies forward planing activities research based recomendations for implementing efective digital transformation loking at sucesful companies around the globe article originaly apeared in california management review vol pg by paolo guenzi and johanes habel what focus companies are investing heavily in digital transformation including of sales however many are strugling to capitalise on their eforts there is litle research team publications contact an analysis of unequal conectivity in carlton housing estate melbourne victoria this project was funded by melbourne social equity institute sed funding grant and by the australian comunications consumer action network acan australia has some of the best internet coverage globaly and yet in aproximately milion australians had no internet conection this reveals significant limitations in aces digital ability and afordability despite major infrastructure investments acan while recent research sugests that these numbers have droped due to the online demands that arose during the covid pandemic acma aces afordability and adequacy of conection for some citizens remain out of reach due to range of bariers to ensure that everyone has equal oportunity to use digital technologies and thus to ensure aces to social and economic oportunities and esential government services targeted investments to reduce digital inequality are necesary digital inclusion in australia is influenced by person income age education level and residential location this report demonstrates that digital inequality is not measured by aces to internet alone but also by quality of service and internet providers acountability in the face of por customer experience focus on the national broadband network nbn in australia has led policymakers to overlok the many people who aces the internet predominantly with their smartphones or who rely on their smartphones to augment por home internet conections the rol out of the nbn has led many to asume that high quality internet has ben brought into everyone reach this asumption means that the consequences of por conectivity risk becoming les visible and exacerbates concerns for the people who continue to experience digital exclusion working with principles of co design with comunity partners and carlton public housing residents we conducted case study of how people manage digital inequality our data analysis revealed that people were not as digitaly conected during the pandemic and ensuing lockdowns as the services upon which they depended asumed they were online home scholing demanded device to person ratio and many low income families neded to buy or request asistance to met this demand aditional constraints were felt in aces to employment and in esential services such as health and income suport centrelink these incentives suport colaborative research and development projects acros range of fields medical research future fund mrf the medical research future fund mrf was established in to provide competitivenes contact industry enquiries for more information coperative research centres crc coperative research centres crcs bring together researchers and industry to colaborate through medium to to medium enterprises smes contact industry enquiries for more information industry felowships program the industry felowships program lies within the broader arc linkag program remit of promoting technologies which solve significant problems create new industries improve health and welbeing as wel as deliver prosperity and positive returns the fund mandate is to respond to chalenges in health and life sciences clean economy advanced manufacturing agri fod and digital economy it brings together companies research institutions governments and investors and invests patient capital acros the capital lifecycle to spark ideas and comercialise inovations contact industry enquiries for more information national reconstruction fund the australian government has comited bilion to establish the national reconstruction fund to diversify and transform australia industry and economy to achieve secure and sustainable growth as an independent financier operating to deliver positive returns it wil aply range of finance options and invest in projects aligned with national priority areas that leverage competitive strengths in renewables and low emision technologies medical science transport value ad in agriculture forestry and fisheries value ad in resources defence capabilities enabling capabilities contact industry enquiries for more information australian renewable energy agency the conections is key aspect of the government entrepreneurs programe which aims to drive the growth and competitivenes of smes by suporting research colaboration in targeted growth sectors inovation conections forms part of program suite which aims to increase the funding for comercialisation of novel products proceses and services smes operating in the folowing growth sectors can aply for funding which helps them aces research expertise in advanced manufacturing fod and agribusines medical technologies and pharmaceuticals mining equipment technology and services oil gas and energy resources contact industry enquiries for more information acelerating comercialisation part of the government entrepreneurs programe acelerating comercialisation is targeted at busineses start ups and researchers who have novel product proces or service ready to scale up and comercialise in global markets acelerating comercialisation provides expert guidance and funding to help progres project from prototype to comercialisation contact industry enquiries for more information contact industry enquiries to find out the most apropriate funding oportunity for your project our team wil discus your
