industry to government cordination and citizen participation theoretical framework this chapter aims to bring the reader closer to conceptual aproach and contextualization to the concepts and notions that wil be worked on throughout the document as wel as the most notable generalities in these fields to search for information in this section structured indexed and unstructured also known as gray literature which theoreticaly define the concepts to be treated and they provide information on the curent context of these fields geographic data science in the field of science there are multiple branches of knowledge that as it is in this case they are usualy intertwined to share and create new knowledge aribas bel reades point out that computer and information sciences have ben intertwined with geographical sciences which gave way to new field that caled geographic data science in which polination could ocur crusade for the benefit of both geography and the data comunity in general to from this new branch whole series of conceptual aproaches adapted to modern times and digitalization geographic data geographic data also known as spatial data describes the location and atributes of objects on earth they can be clasified into absolute defined location by cordinates and relative location based on topological relationships the data geographic areas are comonly represented in the form of maps and are georeferenced in terestrial cordinate systems asociated with spatial reference frame for obtain information and perform analysis adequate data procesing is required which may include statistical analysis and geometric features in adition development of digital transformation model of geographic data can be through information and comunications technologies icts combine both perspectives to achieve complete spatial analysis morea rodriguez huerta rodríguez vilareal et al madrid soto ortiz lópez geographic information systems gis geographic information systems gis are computer systems that capture they store and display data related to the location on the planet surface these systems alow us to understand spatial relationships preserve data and perform analysis combining them with graphical and maping interfaces gis includes both hardware as software and can use cartographic photographic digital and spreadshets national geographic society morea rodríguez huerta rodríguez the combination of knowledge presented in geographic information system and science by longley et al and multicriteria decision analysis in geographic information science by malczewski riner provides comprehensive view of the aplication of gis in geographic data science on the one hand longley and godchild they cover the fundamentals and general aplications of gis such as capture storage and analysis of geographic data as wel as the use of technologies and advanced gis techniques aditionaly they explore the relationship betwen gis and disciplines such as cartography remote sensing and spatial analysis while malczewski and riner they focus on multi criteria decision analysis within the context of gis are combined perspectives ofer solid foundation for understanding and adresing problems complexes in spatial decision making longley et al malczewski riner digital focus on geographic data traditionaly cartographic information is presented in analog form that is representing the reality of ma physical nature and continues however with the advance technological it becomes necesary to adapt this information to digital format in way discretly that is analyticaly morea rodríguez huerta rodríguez for obtain digital cartography it is necesary to continue with two fundamental requirements chapter digital data must be georeferenced in such way that each data geographical location has label that defines its spatial position in reference the spatial characteristics of the geographic data must be described in terms digital through topological relationships aditionaly it is important to encode geographic data using geocoding which acording to morea rodríguez huerta rodríguez can be direct or indirect direct geocoding it consists of determining the absolute spatial location for each geographic data in system of orthogonal cordinate axes the the most used systems are those of plane cordinates for spaces on the earth surface in cartesian plane with two perpendicular axes indirect geocoding it consists of the posibility of geographicaly locating elements from the values of an atribute of an entity such as the adres the postal code the municipality among others this geocoding has huge spectrum of demographic analysis on cartography and data science geographical digital transformation dt delimitation digital transformation is an evolutionary proces that goes beyond the adoption of technologies afecting al aspects of an organization rodríguez abitia bribiesca corea there are diferent interpretations of this concept some se it as an incremental aplication of information technologies heilig et al while others consider it disruptive change driven by inovations cumulative digital data skog et al rodríguez abitia bribiesca corea digital transformation involves changes in proceses organization comercial domain and society parviainen et al it also requires multidimensional aproaches such as the development of digital capabilities gurbaxani dunkle and considerations development of digital transformation model from geographic data to through information and comunications technologies icts specific to the industry and size of the organization demlehner laumer to be sucesful it is important to adres aspects such as organizational culture colaboration digital leadership and workforce capabilities muehlburger et al digital transformation seks to improve organizational performance through simplification of proceses the creation of new services and the inovation of products and services westerman et al in adition it can generate benefits such as improving the quality of the customer services and obtaining competitive advantages davenport fitzgerald et al rajabi bolhari sahu et al westerman bonet in conclusion digital transformation involves profound changes in an organization and its environment and requires clear strategic vision and the integration of digital capabilities to make the most of the oportunities of the digital age figure ilustrates the td area uper left quadrant the two axes show the operational proceses of an organization the vertical axis presents value creation and provision of services and the horizontal axis the services or products ofered by the company the focus is on the transition from conventional to inovative busines models figure digital transformation of an organization operational proceses source adapted from berman bel chapter the key factors for digital transformation projects were described by sandkuhl et al and are strategy leadership products people culture operations governance and technology digitalization is not digital transformation td digitizing involves converting analog information into digital format such as scaning documents or use electronic forms reis et al on the other hand the digitalization uses digital technology to create value in new ways improving the operational eficiency and reducing erors goble examples of digitization can be the cordinate records in excel tables and the colection of cordinates through geospatial readers goble hsu et al without however digitizing does not imply changes in the proces itself nor does it promote new models that is part of digitalization hsu et al in short digitizing makes analog information into digital while digitalization takes advantage of technology digital to generate value digitizing involves implementing registration systems and increasingly comitment on the other hand digitalization involves taking advantage of data and proceses digitized to generate knowledge and take action manyika et al the digitalization lays the foundations for digital transformation which implies complete reconstruction of the busines around the oportunities and demands it ofers digital technology goble acording to jeane ros digitalization is necesity operational while digitization or going digital requires value proposition visionary that has the potential to redefine busines and even an industry ros figure development of digital transformation model of geographic data to through information and comunications technologies icts figure diference betwen digitize digitization and digital transformation source adapted from abdul malak chapter impacts of the transformation digital mation td digital transformation is changing the way organizations work and their organizational environment ignoring this proces can pose risk in markets highly competitive digital transformation has an impact on both aspects internal operations of an organization as wel as in the creation of new oportunities comercial proceses and the restructuring of roles in the value chain for example you can eliminate traditional intermediaries and give rise to new intermediaries through the direct aces to consumers and the use of mobile devices parviainen et al digital transformation can be aproached from thre perspectives internal eficiency external oportunities and disruptive change in terms of internal eficiency the digitalization improves internal proceses through digital means resulting in greater eficiency quality and consistency it also provides beter vision in real time of the operation and the results by integrating structured and unstructured data structured alowing for more complete understanding of the data in the organization and integration of information from other sources parviainen et al figure impacts of digital transformation source adapted from parviainen et al digital transformation has significant impact on organizations by improving the internal eficiency ofer external busines oportunities and bring about change disruptive in the operating environment this is achieved by automating work routine improving customer service and creating new busines models development of digital transformation model from geographic data to through information and comunications technologies icts aditionaly the covid pandemic has acelerated the adoption of digital transformation and companies with high level of digital maturity have obtained competitive advantages the digital maturity is asesed through characteristics such as aces automation customer orientation eficiency flexibility inovation operational efectivenes vision and quality parviainen et al performance improvement partners von solms kohleger et al figure digital transformation maturity and maturity models there is ned to adopt diferent aproach towards industry and transformation digital considering various levels of maturity gradual aproach is proposed based in the implementation of industry technologies and methodologies as wel as changes organizational tols to advance from one level of maturity to the next isa et al maturity is represented through matrix that shows the potential development of an organization in sequential periods nolan model nolan was the precursor of maturity in information systems folowed by capability maturity model cm paulk et al used to evaluate the development of software and related areas it is asumed that the organization performance is related to their level of maturity isa et al maturity model is valuable technique for measuring diferent aspects of proces or organization providing measure for auditing evaluation benchmarking evaluating progres and understanding strengths weakneses and oportunities proença borbinha maturity is defined as proces to define manage measure and control the evolutionary growth of an entity where the objective is to reach state in which the organization is capable of achieving its objectives maturity involves advancing from state initial to more advanced final state fiterer rohner metler sen et al mature organizations measure diferent indicators compared to les mature ones mature and maturity is related to evolutionary progres toward an ability or goalchapter specific amaral araújo coke davies arzymanow koshgoftar osman figure shows that the maturity models represent sequential levels that form an anticipated logical path from an initial state to final state of maturity evaluating progres in relation to defined levels kohleger et al proença borbinha röglinger pöpelbusß digital transformation involves changing workflows and proceses through digital technologies while digital maturity is the understanding and ability to implement those changes both are interelated and afect operations comercial and eficiency lack of understanding of digital maturity can hamper digital transformation and the lack of digital maturity model makes it dificult evaluation of critical areas for change antonizi smuts del pozo crab liu et al digital maturity model dm or digital transformation maturity model mtd is framework that aseses company curent level of digital maturity and provides roadmap to achieve digital maturity goals brown brown liu et al there are generic and industry specific mds which ofer information based on data on curent levels of digital maturity and aply to diferent aspects of the busines but performance improvement partners sandkuhl et al development of digital transformation model from geographic data to through information and comunications technologies icts figure thre types of digital maturity models source adapted from performance improvement partners dimensions of digital transformation digital transformation requires extensive reinvention that encompases considerations strategic technological human capital and organizational culture gil vanboskirk wulf et al competitive advantage now comes from ideas that become new busineses and inovative busines models beter products and services and greater productivity and eficiency through software coding and taking advantage of digital platforms at the same time physical asets that used to confer competitive advantage are becoming comoditizing especialy with the rise of global suply chains gurbaxani dunkle this has led to crucial change in the source of advantage competitive towards software creating value through software requires vision and redefined strategy alignment betwen comercial and digital strategies codification of intelectual property and valuable knowledge culture of inovation technical talent and digital technology capabilities gurbaxani dunkle table sumarizes the research of gurbaxani dunkle which identified six key busines dimensions for sucesful digital transformation that positions company in competitive position strategic vision includes the existence of strategic vision for the world digital and strategy to execute it as wel as the capacity of the executive team to lead digital transformation chapter inovation culture refers to management practices that encourage inovation such as compensation metrics tolerance for failure and culture asesment organizational know how and intelectual property ip asets the amount of knowledge and ip asets that the company poseses and how it leverages them in terms of operations customer understanding and product development digital capabilities talent the talent available in the company is considered to suport digital transformation both at strategic and technical level strategic alignment refers to the company ability to cary out financial investments that suport your strategic vision including the wilingnes to canibalize existing revenue streams and busineses in the short term technological asets the level of use of emerging digital technologies is evaluated such as big data data analytics mobile technologies cloud computing and internet and wireles comunications these dimensions are fundamental to position company in position competitive in the digital era heilig et al liu et al reis et al teichert table dimensions of digital transformation dimension strategic vision clearly defined strategic vision maped to an understanding of neds digital the company has strategy for digital transformation senior executive team has clear understanding of technology capabilities digital and how they wil suport busines objectives there is no problem with the lack of digital leadership to define the strategy without dificulty developing the company digital strategy dimension culture of inovation there is culture of inovation and risk taking new ways of thinking and solutions from diverse perspectives are encouraged you must learn from failure by taking calculated risk it not black mark on the carer of one inovators are rewarded there is no problem with cultural resistance development of digital transformation model of geographic data to through information and comunications technologies icts dimension know how and intelectual property increasing use of software to improve operations performance increasing use of software to improve customer understanding increasing use of software to improve product knowledge suficient intelectual property asets to implement the strategic vision increasing use of software to improve interactions with supliers dimension digital capability availability of digital experience in general there are visionary inovative skils necesary within the company to define the apropriate digital strategy ratings are asigned to people based on their level of knowledge about digital transformation technical talent for inovation is now available in the company there is no problem with the lack of digital skils to execute the strategy dimension strategic alignment company wiling to finance strategic digital initiatives with uncertain returns short term wilingnes to canibalize revenue streams and busines models existing to obtain profits in the long term colaboration and alignment betwen digital and busines unit teams no problem with the lack of budget resources alocated to digital transformation information and comunications technologies icts relevance of icts in the industry paradigm the term icts is defined in broad sense as technologies dedicated to storage procesing and comunication of information rao acording to martyn et al ict constitute range of technologies aplications and chapter software hardware telecomunications and information management devices that are used to create produce analyze proces package di distribute recover store and transform information therefore icts are comunication networks organized and data resources that colect transform and diseminate information within and betwen organizations seyal et al sharma and bhagwat the adoption of the icts provide many benefits in wide range of transactions and proceses comercial within and betwen companies the adoption of icts improves the management of information and knowledge within the company and can reduce costs of transaction and increase the sped and reliability of transactions for both busines to busines and from busines to consumer bc ongori migiro besides they are efective tols to improve external comunications and the quality of the services for new and established clients oecd although the fourth industrial revolution has not yet taken place various technologies that wil drive its development acording to the literature reviewed figure provides sumary of the technologies considered fundamental wichman et al of the technologies mentioned share similar characteristics although they are clasified as industrial technologies their objective is not to afect cels individual production proceses in proceses such as machining joining or forming in instead they focus on colecting interconecting and managing factory data with the in order to optimize and streamline the production sequence schmidt et al besides the robotics and aditive manufacturing the other technologies use information as resource in the value creation chain wichman et al development of digital transformation model from geographic data to through information and comunications technologies icts figure key technologies fundamental to industry source adapted from wichman et al the predominant technologies in the fourth industrial revolution belong to the field of ict these technologies alow interoperability and comprehensive comunication of the production systems in the factory since they function as media they are unlikely to be implemented individualy wichman et al within these technologies the cyber physical system cps is considered especialy instrumental for industry since the main mentions in the literature have synonymous features and functionalities that canot be separated from each other wichman et al an industrial revolution drives the paradigm of best practices in manufacturing and enables previously unatainable levels of productivity the industry is expected to folow this patern schmidt et al both academics and manufacturers have high expectations for this evolving paradigm as it is anticipated to create extraordinary oportunities to increase income and or productivity liao et al figure highlights the most comon benefit propositions that are predicted to be characteristics of future manufacturing these emerging features arechapter closely related to the search for industry and the benefits of next industrial revolution wichman et al wait and therefore lose market oportunities weyer et al research to develop sucesful cps must continue to search for robust method that alows al production systems conect to the network comunicate their status and react to the updated information lu digital divide index in colombia the digital divide index in colombia is tol that evaluates the digital divide in the country on scale from to developed by the mintic is adopted caled the technological solutions architecture guide aplicable to entities public mintic as contribution to this research within the framework of development of model emphasis is placed on flows involving spatial data this methodology starts from the general to the specific within the regulatory framework of the open group here an architecture is defined as structure that contains components and their interelationships this section proposes the development of the architectures reference and solution within the framework of digital transformation proces since these they are transversal to the axes adresed data people proceses and technologies the reference architecture is defined as high level design it has no details refering to technologies or products comonly it is used as template for development of other architectures that involve higher level of detail his main characteristic is that it includes the design principles that govern the organization this proces produces an agnostic template transparent to implementation technologies and deployment likewise presents logical grouping at the level of service areas mintic the solution architecture represents materialization of solution architecture reference that is it includes specific technical components involved in the architecture as wel as the interaction of these comunication chanels and protocols this architecture details at technical level the components involved in the configuration of solution represents the scenario in which these components development of digital transformation model of geographic data to through information and comunications technologies icts interact with each other respecting the guidelines and governance rules documented in the reference architecture figure overview of the enterprise architecture and its domains source taken from mintic the main advantage of developing solution architecture is that it seks to solve the problem of integrating new component in harmonious way with the asets existing technological resources of the organization aditionaly it must adhere to some guidelines technicians that ultimately obey the neds of the busines and ad value strategic to the entity having solution architecture also adreses data components integration protocols execution environments and service areas requirements not functional high availability schemes among other aspects mintic development this stage includes the creation of repositories and the construction of the code for the neds defined in the design of the technological platform previous considerations in this case study field work is required where the resources of conectivity and computing are limited in the best of cases smartphone or laptop the work areas have low or no coverage of mobile data networks since the work wil be caried out in rural areas of colombia areas of interest that they are usualy located far from populated centers in response to this ned it is validated that the technological platform wil have to incorporate the mechanisms necesary to have device that can function in ofline way this device wil be able to host the data on storage unit local until they can be sent to the component that colects and centralizes al the data submited by users there are users who prefer to record the data they take in the field in physical bok caled field notebok consequently the platform must have mechanism that incorporates keyboard mechanism that alows for the transcription of this data quickly the aplications that can be run on laptop or workstation of either type development of digital transformation model of geographic data to through information and comunications technologies icts web or standalone are emerging as alternative solutions to the ned hereby mas loading can also be caried out that is results from many stations or samples the upload forms must be friendly with help elements and that incorporate validation rules such as length types drop down lists or domains for users who have validation and int functions data egration wil be alowed aces to data through an information system that alows the management of data with geographic component this may be system developed by third parties and that can be conected to the technological solution to be developed functional requirements the functional operation being implemented on this paradigm it incorporates advantages such as horizontal scalability easy migration and deployment is agnostic to the operating system of the server since it operates on docker technology the aplication makes use of the htp protocol to expose its services to users and others systems this is the case of the esri ecosystem and for the use of gogle oauth through of are described below planing phase the requirements of the technological platform its structure components are identified and relationships sandoval vargas design phase the design phase includes the the first presents the results of the research regarding the achievement of the proposed objectives and research questions formulated the second presents the general conclusions and the third describes the proposed points to expand the research in future work research results objectives prepare the diagnosis of the curent technological state of the digital transformation of the data from the cartography and geological and geomorphological research group of the colombian geological service sgc to identify the chalenges in the digitization of geographic data this objective was met through the characterization of the proces through the review of literature and the partial aplication of the digital transformation framework for entities public of the mintic for this exercise the available tols were used to measure the digital maturity level and identify and prioritize through the heat map the proceses that demand intervention in terms of digital transformation no however this was an aproximation of the curent technological state and had to be complemented with the evaluation and disagregation of the proceses section frames the proces to performed within the model and section details the result of the objective through the geotd validation this research involved an intervention for geographical data therefore it was necesary to review in detail the key proceses of the case study group through chapter work sesions with the diferent functional areas of the group in order to know the dynamics of proceses inputs and products identify the conceptual and functional components based on icts for the digital transformation of geographic data the fulfilment of this objective is achieved through thre instances the first adresed the conceptual review of icts and the exploration of previous aplication works documented in chapter the second instance involved the identification of the problems in the prioritized proceses in the characterization and the third instance included the selection of apropriate methods and technologies to solve the problems isues it should be noted that the conceptual and functional components based on icts selected in this research are detailed in section however also they are listed in sections and to validate the model in this research the folowing concepts were used icts cloud computing geolocation microservices edge computing however the projects derived from this research especialy for the case study can be framed in the use of machine learning and big data design the digital transformation model for geographic data the design and construction of the digital transformation model for geographic data geo td was based on the dimensions proposed by the mintic in the transformation framework digital for public entities it is model oriented to the user and internal proceses and intermediate organizations geo td seks to enable proceses that use geographic data to evolve transversaly in terms of people and digital culture digital data and analytics digital proceses and iv technology providing the tols to groups and organizations to build solutions based on icts development of digital transformation model of geographic data to through information and comunications technologies icts likewise it contemplates the mintic architecture metamodel which guides the selection and definition of technological components for the design and construction of the platform the design characterization and construction of geo td is detailed in chapter validate the proposed model for the digital transformation of geographic data use case cartography and geological and geomorphological research group of the colombian geological service sgc this objective was met through the aplication of geo td in the cartography group and geological and geomorphological research of the colombian geological service sgc this case study was selected because it brings together potential scenarios for the model validation aditionaly because one belongs to the group and knows the misionality and data used in the group in adition to the objectives and in order to suport the validation of the model it was developed and implemented web oriented technological platform which works under an engine relational database with an architecture based on microservices uses htp protocol to expose services to users and systems of esri and gogle through the use of wlan lan networks and implements internet security certificates sl in that sense this research presents the fulfilment of the stated objectives the code repository and asociated documentation of the technology platform geo td validation can be consulted in the azure link enabled for this purpose research question what methodological and conceptual elements can be incorporated into model to enhance the digital maturity of organizations that generate and use information geographical in their misionary proceses within the framework of digital transformation and considering the slr there are various instruments aimed at enhancing digital maturity at the organizational level however chapter models like geo td bring together and specify the necesary instruments and tols to enhance the digital maturity of organizations that generate and use data geographical in that sense and in the first instance the characterization and calculation tols of the level of digital maturity are valuable instrument to diagnose the technological state and guide ict aplication initiatives in the second instance the implementation of technological platforms and solutions based on ict concepts they concentrate instruments that enhance misional proceses in organizations this research describes in greater detail in chapters and the instruments designed and implemented to validate the geo td model in the case study selected conclusions this research constitutes contribution from geomatics to organizations public and private that involve geographic data in their proceses and lack of elements to undertake digital transformation initiatives in diferent scenarios and levels geo td alows you to consult historical works without wasting efort and resources eliminates the use of email or instant mesaging systems with atached files strengthens certainty in decision making and adjustments or corections are reflected with greater imediacy geo td reduces execution time in prioritized proceses since it has information in services for consultation management analysis and generation of geological and geomorphological products icts have become fundamental element for the transformation digitalization of proceses in organizations however this entails guiding eforts to increase investments in technology and highly human talent trained who can take on the chalenges of digital transformation centralizing geographic data in single system avoids duplication of records and alows beter use of ict resources besides the setings or corections are reflected with greater imediacy geo td represents an alternative solution apropriate to the neds of the case study since it eliminates neck botles use of files development of digital transformation model of geographic data to through information and comunications technologies icts decentralized incorporates elements of geographic data quality through forms with validation in fields and eliminates the transcription of cordinates know first hand the neds of the actors including acompanying field days to understand the scenarios should be fundamental in corect gathering of requirements for the development of system of information that responds to the neds and expectations of the organization which which avoids resistance in its adoption digital transformation models should not focus solely on the adoption of technologies to achieve changes in their proceses there must be organizational culture that fosters encourages and adopts changes at the level technological technology must be understod as an enhancer of proceses and not as threat public servants must be alies of these initiatives and changes and not become an obstacle to its adoption digital transformation must be state policy and not government policy which sugests continuity of the proceses and eforts made despite the ideological and political changes that arise future work it is necesary to introduce validations from quality metrics based on standards iso that evaluate the technological platform and the quality of the gi the functionalities that provide suport must be incorporated into the technological platform to proceses not atended to and that have apeared in the list of proceses prioritized in the heat matrix incorporate machine learning and big data capabilities on the data geographical data colected represents an interesting work chalenge since the initiatives of this nature have ben unsucesful due to the non existence of single digital data source containing al historical records of stations and samples it is important to develop your own mobile ap that incorporates functions specialized in the area of cartography qr scaning for samples for the national university of colombia manizales campus description digital transformation is chalenge that al organizations face in world where technology is constantly evolving the national government of colombia has established digital transformation and artificial inteligence policy aproved in november where it specifies that one of the limitations has to do with with digital capabilities to incorporate changes from the institutional vision of ino vation with social conscience the national university of colombia becomes the first public institution of higher education in the country comited to digital transformation incorporating it at the national level in the global development plan pgd and at the headquarters level in the action plan as the main axis at the local level to start this proces it is necesary to know the curent situation of the campus this final thesis work focuses on incorporating digital capacity models recognized internationaly in the digital transformation proceses of the un headquarters manizales for the development of the work mixed methodology is folowed which is the systematic integration of quantitative and qualitative methods with focus non experimental methodological of an exploratory type that also combines aspects descriptive diagnosis of digital capabilities is caried out at the manizales headquarters where the level of competence of students teachers and administrators is determined to based on these results roadmap and training plan are proposed as starting point for the strategies of the un digital transformation digital skils training plan introduction today digital transformation has become chalenge for al companies organizations in world where technology is constantly evolving the future of governments companies and society in the fourth industrial revolution ir driven by information and comunication technologies ict wil depend on its ability to adopt digital technologies world economic forum therefore it is necesary to transform to survive in this new environment this is what it is aimed at the digital transformation in recent years the importance of capabilities has grown digital as mechanisms in digital transformation in order to take advantage of the oportunities that the environment ofers in relation to the economic political and social therefore there are studies focused on models or frameworks of digital capabilities at the level international that have ben developed with the purpose of providing tols that alow us to evaluate the state in which the organizations find themselves the government of colombia has identified the importance of this transformation therefore for this reason in its global development plan it formulates the national policy of digital transformation and artificial inteligence which seks to bost productivity and promote the wel being of citizens as wel as generate transversal enablers for sectoral digital transformation so that colombia can take advantage of the oportunities and adres the chalenges related to ir this policy is limited to be surpased by promoting in citizens the necesary knowledge and skils to face the changes in the economic and social structures that the ir brings hence the importance of digital capabilities this policy is mandatory in public entities of the country therefore the national university of colombia un is becomes the first public institution of higher education in the country comited with digital transformation and incorporates it into its institutional strategic project for the global development plan pgd with vision until in which aims to create culture that transforms learning and goes hand in hand with the new introduction technologies national university of colombia to start the proces of digital transformation in the university it is necesary to evaluate curent capabilities as wel as the obstacles or dificulties that could prevent the achievement of the transformation to as result of this institutional policy the manizales headquarters in its action plan contemplates the project transformation of the organization which aims to know the curent situation of the headquarters and one of the main themes is digital transformation this is how the present study arises due to the ned for the headquarters to know the capacity curent conditions to begin the digital transformation proces where identifies that it is esential to integrate digital capabilities consequently this work focuses on incorporating digital capability models recognized at the level international in the digital transformation proceses of the un headquarters manizales for your development mixed methodology is folowed which is the systematic integration of methods quantitative and qualitative with non experimental methodological aproach of an exploratory type which also combines descriptive aspects and what is intended is to determine the existing best practices to evaluate digital capabilities in educational institutions higher education identify the level of advancement of digital capabilities at the un manizales headquarters and establish the lines of action of the digital transformation for the un manizales headquarters based on the curent state of its digital capabilities this final work is made up of four chapters namely chapter study design the literature is reviewed where the elements are identified found by several authors in order to determine the focus of the study from this review describes the situation found the objectives sought with the study its methodology and scope in chapter digital capabilities and their main frames of reference systematic review of literature on the models or frameworks of international digital capabilities where they were identified and analyzed six studies taking into acount some criteria determined in the review of literature acording to the results of the analysis it is determined that the framework of digital competence digcomp is the study that mets of the criteria analyzed therefore it is selected as the framework to folow in the analysis of the digital capabilities at the manizales headquarters chapter capacity diagnosis introduction digital at the manizales headquarters the design of the instrument is developed from the framework of digcomp competition selected in chapter likewise the research method to folow the instrument is aplied to the selected population in in this case they were students teachers and administrators then the results where the report on the level of advancement of digital capabilities is writen at the headquarters chapter development of the proposal based on the capacity diagnosis headquarters the aspects to improve are identified to strengthen the capabilities digital in the university comunity of the headquarters where roadmap and training plan finaly the conclusions and recomendations of the study are presented which in sumary the level of competence of students teachers and administrators is determined which wil alow us to have starting point for the strategies of the digital transformation project in thirst manizales and respond to the factors of change that are intended front facing on the other hand it can be stated that the theoretical proposal and methodology proposed by the digcomp competition framework its aplication is valid in institutions of higher education consequently the recomendations focus on promoting the proposed proposal in chapter and also that from this work studies can be undertaken comparative with other higher education institutions whether public or private in where not only digital capabilities are included but also the capabilities socioemotional and cognitive aspects that became more relevant with the pandemic chapter study design the future of governments companies and society in the fourth industrial revolution ir driven by information and comunication technologies ict wil depend of their ability to adopt digital technologies world economic forum acording to klaush schwab founder of the world economic forum it is the combination of digital physical and biological systems for the transformation of humanity in the digital and inteligent era ict is increasingly recognized as tol for facilitate socioeconomic transformation and inclusive growth world economic forum new technologies are generating inovation and generating new jobs further half of al new jobs in the united states are now in new jobs profesions that did not exist few years ago in the last decade four out of ten jobs were created in highly digital intensive sectors oecd without however this transformation presents chalenges acording to fiero santilán indicate that as this stage progreses the consequences in al areas of life wil change they propose that in the short term there wil be changes in employment proposals and that acording to study caried out by carlos toxtli entrepreneur and researcher from west virginia university of positions wil be replaced by technology which wil produce progresive unemployment in this sense the ir produces transformations in relation transformation is oriented towards this new environment duparc states that true digital transformation is achieved when the entire organization asumes the importance of digital culture and makes it its own at al levels it is not problem of technology but of people and organizational structures adopting new management model arango serna branch castro benavides burgos while westerman asks the question if digital transformation is the solution to emerging busines chalenges in the digital age or whether it is another buzword of marketing however or comes to the conclusion that digital artificial inteligence policy proposed by the national government theoretical framework and related works the world has had to live various transformations related to industry and technology in each one changes were made in the energy sources proceses and industrial activities the means of comunication and transportation which has alowed great social transformations the first industrial revolution can be traced back to with the invention of the railway and the invention of the steam engine and marked the begining of production mechanics the second industrial revolution began in the mid th century characterized by the mechanical and metalurgical industry and made mas production posible fostered by the advent of electricity and the asembly line third industrial revolution began in the it is known as the digital revolution or the computer because it was catalyzed by personal computing and and the internet schwab and the fourth industrial revolution ir begins starting in the th century characterized by the masive adoption of digital technologies such as internet smart mobile phones along with the growth of computing and storage capacity acording to gonz there are thre transformations derived from the combination of the technological advances first consumer behavior second the iruption of technology characterized by the exploitation of data artificial inteligence and development of new infrastructure and the third the emergence of new models of busines that arise from the digital world the digital transformation has generated interest in research academia and busines some authors who have ben interested in the subject have their own concept such as as can be sen in table which lists various definitions of digital transformation compiled by the authors study with the in order to obtain more complete photograph of the phenomenon sampieri hernández roberto colado fernández carlos likewise methodological aproach is folowed experimental exploratory type acording to what sampieri points out exploratory studies are caried out when the objective is to examine topic or litle studied research problem about which there are many doubts or not has ben adresed before that is when the review of the literature revealed that there are only unresearched guides and ideas vaguely related to the problem of study or if we want to investigate topics and areas from new perspectives this exploratory study wil also combine descriptive aspects since the studies descriptives aim to measure or colect information independently or jointly about the concepts or variables to which they refer that is their objective is not to indicate how these are related sampieri hernández roberto colado fernández carlos the methodology is integrated into thre stages digital capabilities and their main frames of reference systematic review of literature on beter practices to evaluate digital capabilities in heis methodology the systematic literature review rsl methodology proposed by kitchenham which consists of presenting an evaluation of research topic through the use of reliable rigorous and auditable methodology the proces of search as can be sen in figure consists of phases planing the review development of the review and publication of results figure systematic literature review proces review planing identification of the ned for review development of review protocol development of the review research identification selection of primary studies evaluation of study quality data extraction and tracking data synthesis publication of results write review report source prepared from kitchenham the adaptation of the methodology of the phases presented in figure systematic literature review proces review planing at this stage the planing of the systematic review is caried out and reference is taken guide kitchenham researchers must sumarize al existing information about some phenomenon in an exhaustive and impartial maner in order to establish general conclusions that individual studies or as begining of activities of future research identification of the ned for review this identification establishes the objective of the review the questions of research and what resources are available to cary it out the objective of the review is to cary out systematic literature search in order to determine existing best practices for asesing digital capabilities in higher education institutions the specification of the research questions is the paradigm by which studies and clasifies bibliographic material therefore what is sought to be established is what folowing what is meant by digital capabilities how to determine existing best practices for asesing capabilities digital in an hei how many studies have ben published in recent years on best practices of digital capabilities in heis what are the existing models and methodologies to evaluate the capabilities digital in higher education institutions which studies have ben validated in institutions higher education development of the search protocol guz and rushchitsky and aghaei chadegani et al establish that the bases of most widespread data in the scientific field and widely used in searches for literature are scopus and web of science hence they have ben selected as the bases of data to be used in the development of the systematic literature review however and given the relevance that gogle scholar has taken on in recent years it was decided incorporate it into the study as complement to the search proces as part of the search strategy the folowing search string was adopted to scopus and web of science databases digital competence or digital literacy or digital inclusion and model or methodology or strategy or evaluation or maturity model and higher education or university to cary out the search within the databases the title sumary and keywords as strategy to improve the precision of information search spante hashemi lundin algers likewise no temporal restriction and its search was restricted to articles and reviews in spanish language and english the search is delimited by defining publication interval in this case betwen to in order to identify what have ben the most recent practices in relation with digital capabilities and coroborate what has ben the curent view on the isue of investigation when searching for information without any time restriction it was noted that some terms were confused with other branches such as medicine and enginering and in second the search for the query was caried out with the restriction of the field of life sciences computing and busines development of the review research identification once the search protocol has ben aplied figure shows the phases of the search review digital competence and digital literacy to begin with the main foundation of this work search is caried out for the major studies in the area and outlines the terms of competence literacy or digital skils that these concepts are often used synonymously although have diferent meanings martin grudziecki therefore it is necesary to give conceptual clarity of these terms digital competence is about skils esential for life they are even conceived as survival skils in the era digital eshet alkalai or vital asets in the information society van deursen dijk ala mutka points out competence as the ability to aply knowledge and skils in diferent contexts such as work leisure or learning ala mutka acording to deursen literacy refers to certain competencies and knowledge while skils refer to the more technical aspects of these skils and knowledge iordache mariën baelden agre with alka mutka by indicating that digital competence is discused as the ability to aply these knowledge and skils to various contexts of life from personal to profesional to do this digital literacy colects the awarenes practical skils and competencies necesary to for users to aces understand evaluate comunicate with others and create digital content in strategic and aplied way iordache mariën baelden acording to ferari he defines digital competence as the set of knowledge skils atitudes including abilities strategies values and awarenes that are required when using the ict and digital media to cary out tasks solve problems comunicate manage information to colaborate create and share content and build knowledge in an efective eficient apropriate critical creative autonomous flexible ethical and reflective for work leisure participation learning socialization consumption and empowerment in this same sense laraz understands digital competence as the some of literacies technological or computer informational audiovisual or media and comunicative to participate in safe ethical and civic way of digital identity in general it can be sen how the various authors perceive digital competence as set of esential life skils and their aplication and digital literacy is the compilation of these skils and knowledge such as technological comunicative informational audiovisual and skils are understod as something more technical than those skils and knowledge based on the review of concepts from diferent authors this project asumes the concept of digital competence by iordache mariën baelden and ferari as the set of knowledge skils and atitudes that are neded when use ict and digital media and the ability to aply them in various contexts of the life from personal to profesional thus after the clarification of the concepts of digital competence and digital literacy that was explained above review and comparison of the best practices converted into models and frameworks of digital competence review and evaluation of digital competence best practices in the bibliographic review it was posible to find series of studies related to standards frameworks and models of competencies or digital literacy eight of them with relevance at the international level and one at the national level aplied to an hei to cary out the content analysis of each of the studies the folowing are defined selection criteria the number of references in other studies and recognized in the literature specialized they had to be relevant to the discusion of digital competence or literacy around the analysis of digital skils and competencies found included in the selected models and frameworks the studies could be aplied in higher education institutions therefore for this reason some of them are focused on teaching while others are aplicable to any type of institutions its structure was built as frame with clasification of skils knowledge and competencies your publication had to cover the last years betwen and respectively although one of the selected frames is from due to number of citations and its relevance in the specialized literature was taken into acount to have comparison with the other selected studies based on this review it was decided to exclude thre studies and select six the excluded studies were the folowing icdl international computer digital literacy standard icdl is an organization international which has knowledge certification program computing this standard measures person ability to handle computer drive to basic it concepts despite being an international standard is not included because its structure only includes basic knowledge of computing is not constructed as framework which is required for analysis model for the development and acreditation of digital competence at the university virginia laraz rada it is model created at the university of andora its objective is to develop and acredit the competence of students it is model litle recognized by specialized literature and unclear in its content nets standard it is standard developed by the international society for technology in education iste standards is recognized worldwide international as standard for teaching and focused on learning without however for the development of this work and when reviewing the other studies where thre of them focus on teaching and can be implemented in other setings it was decided not to include the nets standard in the evaluation the six studies mentioned below were selected acording to to the criteria as relevant study the unesco framework of ict competencies of teachers ict cft as tol to guide the initial and ongoing training of teachers on the use of ict throughout the educational system it is an international framework which has had several versions and now this instrument is designed to adapt to national and institutional objectives providing an updated framework for the policy making and capacity building in this dynamic area unesco the framework is organized into thre stages or sucesive levels of development of the teachers regarding the pedagogical use of ict acquisition of knowledge depening of knowledge knowledge creation in turn the framework consists of competencies organized around the six aspects of the profesional practice of teachers at thre levels of pedagogical use of the ict by teachers the underlying idea is that teachers who have competencies to use ict in their profesional practice wil provide quality education and in ultimately they wil be able to efectively guide the development of the competencies of the students in ict maters the six aspects of teachers profesional practice are as folows understanding the role of ict in educational policies curiculum and evaluation pedagogy aplication of digital skils organization and administration and profesional learning of teachers the iskils model developed by educational testing service ets is another of selected studies is an outcomes based framework that measures the ability to think criticaly in digital environment ets is an international institution which is recognized for its ectory in the development of acreditation for both students like the citizen establishes digital literacy framework caled digital transformation framework for ict literacy in its definition of literacy in ict identify five components that they consider esential and that represent continum of skils and knowledge for functioning in society of knowledge each of the components is defined by ets as folows aces know and know how to colect and or retrieve information manage aply an existing organizational or clasification scheme integrate interpret and represent information it involves sumarizing comparing and to contrast evaluate make judgments about the quality relevance usefulnes or eficiency of the in five dimensions this framework of competition has several updates the original version was created in the by ferari in the digcomp version is published vuorikari punie caretero van den brande in their daily activities evaluation of digital competence frameworks or models to evaluate the frameworks and models quick scan analysis is performed as it describes multiple smal case studies based on limited set of variables by maping the variables and their indices into single aray it becomes posible to analysis of similarities diferences and variances betwen the cases audenhove baelden mariën this is how the digital skils and competencies found are analyzed for each of the models and frameworks matrix is created with the competencies similarities that were found in each of the studies clasifying them into five categories operations for the use of ict information and knowledge digital comunication creation of digital content strategic competencies likewise each of these categories contains its criteria that in total aded up twenty one which have ben maped using matrix as can be sen observe in table for each of the studies in such way that it could be identified the similarities or diferences betwen them and determine which of them could be evaluated in complete digital competencies in an hei this comparison is made through visual analysis and review of the literature therefore it was not an analysis statistical even though there are numerical results in the matrix for the development of the matrix the cases that are the models and frameworks are maped into columns and criteria are maped to rows aditional rows are introduced to determine the number of themes that given case shows audenhove et al the selected categories are shown in the folowing table table capacity diagnosis digital at the manizales headquarters the objective of this stage of the study is to identify the level of progres of digital capabilities at un headquarters manizales to achieve of the manizales campus once the aplication has ben made the data colected is tabulated and analyzed indicating the reliability of the instrument and finaly the conclusions are made about the level of advancement of the capabilities digital at the un headquarters manizales instrument design in the previous chapter systematic literature review is caried out to determine the best practices to evaluate digital capabilities in heis review is caried out and categorization of the variables found from six models or competency frameworks digital and acording to the evaluation it is concluded that the reference model to be developed for fulfiling of the competencies and variables analyzed is the framework of digital competence digcomp vuorikari et al and from this framework of competition the instrument is built the purpose of the instrument is to identify the digital capabilities of the comunity university of the un headquarters manizales to met this objective the gqm goal question instrument it is aplied cronbach alpha test in order to cary out the characterization of the digital capabilities of the un headquarters manizales below the conceptual data of the participants of the the statistical analysis ten hypothesis tests are contemplated to contrast the five areas of the digcomp competency framework aplied to the instrument the hypotheses are folowing first hypothesis the information and information literacy area is not significantly related with the comunication and colaboration area the information and information literacy area is significantly related to the area of comunication and colaboration second hypothesis the information and information literacy area is not significantly related with the creation and digital content area the information and information literacy area is significantly related to the creation and digital content area third hypothesis the information and information literacy area is not significantly related with the security area the information and information literacy area is significantly related to the security area fourth hypothesis the information and information literacy area is not significantly related with the problem solving area the information and information literacy area is significantly related to the problem solving area fifth hypothesis the area of comunication and colaboration is not significantly related to the area creation and digital content the area of comunication and colaboration is significantly related to the area of creation and digital content sixth hypothesis the area of comunication and colaboration is not significantly related to the area of security the area of comunication and colaboration is significantly related to the area of security seventh hypothesis the area of comunication and colaboration is not significantly related to the area of problem solving the area of comunication and colaboration is significantly related to the area of problem resolution eighth hypothesis the area of creation and digital content is not significantly related to the area of security the area of creation and digital content is significantly related to the area of hour security ninth hypothesis the area of creation and digital content is not significantly related to the area of security the area of creation and digital content is significantly related to the area of hour security tenth hypothesis the security area is not significantly related to the problem resolution area isues the security area is significantly related to the problem resolution area isues the results obtained with the estimation of reliability precision consistency and reproducibility and the analysis of relationships and direction of asociation betwen the variables is presented in the folowing study was proposed ending the year and the aplication of the instrument was caried out in may by therefore the manizales headquarters had ben in the context of the covid pandemic for more than year which gave it digital bost and the activities stoped being face to face to move to virtual environment it is thus that the university comunity autonomously had to learn and obtain knowledge to face digital technologies and this it is evident in the results of the study where the vast majority of the indices analyzed they were valued at an intermediate level now this qualification is only reference and does not indicate the quality of competencies that the university comunity has since the instrument was designed to generaly evaluate each of the areas raised by the digcomp digital competence framework therefore in order to improve the levels of digital competence at the manizales headquarters it is recomended to go deper into training in the five areas of competence analyzed strengthen their capabilities and can reach an intermediate level where they can aply the knowledge and those at higher levels manage to improve their abilities digital alows them to propose strategies and participate in practice acording to iorio afirms that the digital transformation scenario imposes changes that do not alow anything static whether they are companies people or societies everything must change and especialy people and institutions must be open to unlearning and relearning constant chapter development of the proposal situation to transform recognizing the digital resources and capabilities that an institution has is esential to achieve its development growth and sustainability have mastery of competencies alows people to have the ability to create and exchange digital content comunicate and colaborate as wel as provide solutions to problems with view to achieving efective and creative development in life work and activity social services in general unesco in adition are esential to aces range of oportunities in the st century digital capabilities must be updated periodicaly to respond to the introduction of new technologies and their impact on the digital economy and digital society itu academy acording to the study caried out by gan andi the low qualification of workers colombians becomes structural problem in times of economic crisis since they present low level of adaptability to changes in the work environment on al that generated by the covid pandemic this restructuring of labor demand has increased the search for people with strengths in digital skils as wel as in advanced socioemotional and cognitive skils fedesarolo within the profiles required by companies include soft skils such as conflict resolution self learning teamwork among others which have gained greater relevance by increasing the ability to adapt to new environments labor by the workers gan andi the national university of colombia in its digital transformation proces has had to adapt to changes caused by the global public health crisis with the pandemic covid in the particular case the manizales headquarters has ben forced to restructure an acelerated way the development of teaching research extension as wel as its administrative proceses which gave digital bost and as mentioned in the report of the previous chapter the changes that the university comunity to learn about the management of digital technologies were sen reflected in the results of the study where the vast majority of the analyzed indices are evaluated at an intermediate level with the digcomp model however being the pionering university in education it is important that the university comunity and in especialy teachers and students improve their skils to higher level in such way so that they are not only involved in the aplication intermediate level but that they can have the ability to propose be critical and participate in practices at an advanced level it should be noted that the instrument used generaly evaluated the areas of digital capabilities therefore it canot be said that the analysis has ben developed in profound way and aspects such as the capabilities advanced socioemotional and cognitive skils that have become more relevant during the pandemic the university in its digital transformation project has identified thirty five change factors which are listed in six dimensions when refering to factors of change refers to phenomena that can influence to generate changes significant in the future national university of colombia when reviewing the facts of changes it is detected that the areas of competence analyzed are directly related with these factors se table and wil be fundamental element within the proces of digital transformation projected for the university likewise at the manizales headquarters the transformation program project is curently being developed organization which is carying out diagnosis of result cronbach alpha aplied to the instrument obtained very close to it can be concluded that in general it is highly reliable furthermore it is highly favorable result to cary out factor analysis to reduce dimension of the variance of the empirical scores is due to the result of covariation betwen al the questions on the form the remaining is due to the eror variance this alows the confidence interval to be used as excelent parameter for statistical credibility recomendations the present investigation has potential since from this it can be undertaken studies in other headquarters strengthen the digital capabilities of the university comunity of the headquarters anex instrument identification of the digital capabilities at the university national of colombia headquarters manizales dear student teacher administrator or contractor the purpose of this survey is to identify the digital capabilities that the university comunity at the national university of colombia manizales campus each of the questions shown below asks about the frequency in which you perform certain digital actions therefore there are no corect answers or wrong we are only interested in your opinion and it is required that they be answered sincerely the information from this survey wil be procesed solely for research purposes and it is confidential thank you very much for your help general data role in the university undergraduate student post graduate student plant teacher plant administrator contractor select your gender female male select the age range in which you are under find to years to years to years to years more than select your secondary education level technique technological profesional specialization master degre doctorate digital capabilities answer the folowing questions acording to the frequency with which you perform each action never almost never sometimes almost always always element values question acording to the likert scale information and information literacy area use specialized search engines or metasearch engines search search engines such as metacrawler inded zapmeta etc to consult information specific on the internet use filtering operators like site or to improve internet search results use platforms such as gogle drive onedrive or dropbox to save and manage files on the web when find information on the internet usualy compare it with other sources to verify and or expand it when find information on the internet verify that comes from reliable source element values question acording to the likert scale synthesize the information selected for the construction and asimilation of new content through tables graphs or schemes when have to search for file or folder on the hard drive or other storage devices usualy find it with ease comunication and colaboration area can comunicate with other people using tols comunication such as chat instant mesaging services skype share information of interest with my coleagues employing variety of digital environments and media show positive atitude towards the use of ict to suport colaboration learning and productivity interact with other coleagues and users using the social networks facebok ning twiter and comunication chanels comunication blog youtube chanel others based on ict have the ability to function in local networks profesional linkedin use digital resources and tols for exploration of curent world isues and the solution of real problems atending to personal social and profesional neds asume an ethical comitment in the use of digital information and ict including respect for copyright intelectual property and proper reference to sources have the ability to make constructive criticism judging and making contributions to the ict work developed by my companions creation and digital content area aces and edit web content through mobile devices like tablets or cel phones use fre image audio or video files to generate new content that adapts to my neds when use an internet resource check its license type to avoid infringing copyright aply diferent licenses to each content create to protect your intelectual property which wil alow or prohibit other people make certain uses of them can determine the use can give to resource internet acording to your license type security area use protection such as antivirus on the computer or devices mobile phones to protect against threats of viruses malware etc element values question acording to the likert scale use on devices computer mobile device others protection systems such as aces control privileges paswords etc protect information related to the people around me close coleagues family etc control the time spent using the mobile device lok for balance betwen my virtual life and my personal life take precautions in the position use when meting in front of computer or using mobile device to avoid future problems from misuse of digital devices usualy close aplications once no longer use them the mobile device verify that the router is away from my place of work work when use wifi problem solving area configure and solve problems that arise related with hardware software and networking systems to optimize their use for learning and productivity perform computer maintenance to avoid posible operational problems updates cleaning of cache or hard drive etc detect when the peripherals use microphones headphones printers etc are compatible with my computer and the conectivity requirements plan searches for information to resolve problems problems bibliography aghaei
