researcher and bring to fruition the completion of this thesis which we hope wil be valuable contribution to the science of knowledge sumary digital transformation in higher education institutions model imple mentation higher education institutions higher education institutions have ben permeated on the one hand to the technological advance that the fourth revolution brings with it industrial on the other hand to compliance with regulations embodied in policies of state nation and solutions services required by external situations as powerful that has forced them to face digital transformation in al their dimensions although growing interest in the area is evident from the literature it is stil there is litle research caried out in this regard in the education sector superior it is necesary to elucidate the path of aplication of the aproaches of digital transformation to the domain higher education institutions as field emerging that has aroused interest during the recent past developing model of implementation that alows describing complex relationships betwen dimensions interveners in an educational domain with technological suport are required to perform empirical studies on the nature of the interelationships betwen dimensions involved organizational socio cultural and technological and their efect on the maturity level of the digital transformation of higher education institutions it is for this reason that the purpose of this research is to adres this gap by designing an implementation model that alows describing complex relationships betwen dimensions and that also facilitates the understanding and implementation of digital transformation in higher education institutions to achieve this objective systematic literature review rsl is caried out that facilitates the identification of the dimensions involved in the digital transformation proceses and their main features then an instrument for measuring the digital transformation in higher education institutions and through the methodx digital transformation in heis deployment model delphi expert judges validate its content finaly the models of structural equations to check the validity and fit of the proposed model one of the main contributions of this work lies in the confirmation of model that integrates the relationship betwen set of variables organizational socio cultural and technological that positively influence the maturity of the digital transformation in the higher education institutions keywords digital transformation higher education institutions implementation model structural equation model sumary and abstract xi abstract digital transformation in higher education institutions implementation model higher education institutions have ben permeated on the one hand to the technological advance that brings with it the fourth industrial revolution on the other hand to compliance with regulations embodied in state nation policies and solutions services required by external situations so powerful as the covid pandemic that have forced higher education institutions to face digital transformation in al its dimensions although the growing interest in the area is evident from the literature there is stil litle research caried out in this regard in the higher education sector it is necesary to elucidate the way of aplying digital transformation aproaches to the higher education institutions domain as an emerging field that has aroused interest in the recent past developing an implementation model that alows describing complex relationships betwen dimensions involved in an educational domain with technological suport it is necesary to cary out empirical studies on the nature of the interelationships betwen the dimensions involved organizational sociocultural and technological and their efect on the level of maturity of the digital transformation of higher education institutions it is for this reason that this research aims to adres this gap by creating an implementation model that alows describing complex relationships betwen dimensions and facilitates the understanding and implementation of digital transformation in higher education institutions to achieve this objective systematic literature review rsl is caried out to facilitates the identification of the dimensions involved in the digital transformation proceses and their main characteristics subsequently digital transformation at heis measurement instrument is created and through the delphi method expert judges validate its content finaly the structural equations model theory was used to check the validity and adjust the proposed implementation model one of the main contributions of this work lies in thexi transformación digital en las ies modelo de implementación confirmation of model that integrates the relationship betwen set of variables organizational sociocultural and technological that positively influences the maturity of value table mediating efects introduction digital transformation has become priority for educational institutions superior in this second decade of the st century given that this is natural proces and necesary for organizations that claim to be leaders of change and highly competitive in their domain furthermore today societies face chalenges and complex changes that can only be adresed and resolved only by grouping the expert knowledge and finding responsible solutions stolze et al several authors have defined digital transformation from the field of busines among them hes et al who expres that digital transformation is concerned with changes that digital technologies can cause in company busines model and resulting in modified products or organizational structures or automation of proceses from the vision of higher education institutions the transformation digital is the proces of technological and organizational change induced in them by the development of digital technologies almaraz et al consequently the higher education institutions face disruptive scenario that is establishes new busines models transforming the way they evolve in over time actively linking internal and external clients increasing your comitment and strengthening their experience in the organization this change is caled digital transformation arango serna et al on the other hand higher education institutions are also influenced and conditioned by the policies of the nation state by the global trends of the system capitalist world due to events such as the one that ocured due to the covid pandemic which are much more powerful than the changes and transformations that the institutions of higher education can produce within themselves and in the society where they reside lópez segrera acording to wrana maría pazini cited by barcos for her transformation the university must met global demands increase the number digital transformation in heis deployment model of quotas improve quality promote research optimize extension promote leadership provide lifelong educational services focus on learning and skils training redefining its mision and above al the dynamics of relationships and the sped of information they must have management structures and systems of information to make transparent agile and efective decisions and for proces continuous and careful evaluation capable of measuring the objectives that are achieved for its part kuzu expreses that digital transformation ocurs to determine the neds and behaviors of stakeholders and provide education research and social services in acordance with the demands of users beneficiaries who take advantage of the services in competition in an environment changing this means digitization of basic services academics students with advanced digital capabilities and decision suport systems that can adapt to circumstances it is crucial that each university develops its own digital transformation strategy to achieve this goal they must evaluate the potential of digital teaching and learning oferings for their institutions and take them decisions about which ones to use based on your individual profiles budgets and specific objectives furthermore this wil require partners and close coperation with the government the busines sector and civil society dräger et al however even though the concept of digital transformation has gained importance within the academic comunity there is stil lack of consensus on the implementation around digital transformation in educational institutions higher on which components are relevant which architectures are the most apropriate to develop digital transformation in educational institutions superior this interest has ben increasing since the begining of the pandemic as garner describes in the heis rapidly promoted proceses of digital transformation then in they were forced to venture into blended learning learning methodologies and in the interest in improve and or sustain these changes over time garner at the end of the road no there is an implementation model that facilitates the understanding of the transformation digital in higher education institutions in colombia aded to the above it has ben posible to identify that the basis of the literature of the digital transformation in latin american universities is stil limited with respect to introduction to empirical studies idc infodoc ara ngo serna et al castro benavides et al ramírez montoya rodriguez abitia bribiesca corea aditional eforts are required to gain beter understanding of how integrate and complement the dimensions involved in transformation proceses and how to improve the maturity levels of the digital transformation of institutions of higher education castro benavides et al fernández et al consequently and taking into acount the knowledge gap identified the research aims to design an implementation model that explains and guide digital transformation in public higher education institutions in colombia the novelty of this work is in proposing holistic model of digital transformation that sen as an organizational transformation relates the organizational socio cultural and technological perspectives within the institutions of higher education reflected in their level of maturity as part of this objective wil explore the interelationships betwen the perspectives considered and their efect on the maturity levels of digital transformation in higher education institutions this phase of the study is considered original both for the creation of the instrument of measurement of digital transformation in higher education institutions as wel as for its content validation proces by experts absent in the literature the research considers the quantitative study aproach whose livelihod epistemological is positivism sampieri et al the models are implemented structural equations structural equation modeling sem as multivariate data analysis technique becket et al martínez fiero in sem modeling the aproach wil be folowed refering to the method partial least squares pls sem the scope of the study focuses on al of the public universities of colombia for which survey wil be caried out by university with specific actors rectors cio heads of administrative departments directors vice rectors researchers it leaders with respect to the empirical study as it is only aplied to public universities of colombia it is not posible to make statements about other educational levels or global contexts as wel as the analysis of information on factors digital transformation in heis deployment model potentialy influential factors such as the size of the university the date of foundation the main methodology the funds alocated to digital transformation proceses the institutional quality and the educational level of digital transformation leaders this document is made up of chapters chapter describes the design of the investigation refering to the pl aproach to the research problem adreses the problematic situation literature review knowledge gap question general research subsequently in chapter the methodology of the research specifying the sem pls phases that wil be caried out to achieve the proposed objectives in chapter the theoretical framework that wil suport the creation of the implementation model of digital transformation in healthcare institutions higher education then in chapter the description of the study design takes place empirical definition of the research hypotheses the study population dimensions variables and measurements are constructed the measurement instrument is designed and validated measure of digital transformation in higher education institutions and defines the information colection protocol next there is chapter with the results of the empirical study starting with the explanation of the foundations conceptual concepts of structural equation models the results are described and analysis of the measurement and structural models and the results are discused finaly there is chapter of conclusions which presents the main results limitations of the research as wel as some theoretical and practical implications he the chapter ends with future lines of research finaly it includes the bibliographic references and anexes that suport the research design of the investigation problematic situation organizational transformation is topic that has ben studied for some time now several decades considering it as proces through which organizations they examine what they were what they are what they wil ned to be and how to make changes necesary to face the future kilman et al this is how in the environment contemporary busines where organizations must be inovative flexible and faster due to uncertainty complexity and changing environment the complex and diverse nature of strategy makes the concept of fit each increasingly problematic hiekanen et al curently and as consequence of the fourth industrial revolution companies in almost al industries have caried out series of initiatives to explore new digital technologies and take advantage of their benefits mat et al facing organizational transformation in world digital as digital transformation which to date has ben analyzed from the perspectives technological digital transformation is based on the use of new digital technologies such as social networks mobile devices analytics or devices integrated organizational digital transformation requires change in proceses organizational or the creation of new busines models and social the digital transformation is phenomenon that is influencing al aspects of life human for example improving the customer experience reis et al this reality makes there diferent definitions and apropriations of digital transformation authors such as reis et al expres that digital transformation is the use of new digital technologies that enable significant busines improvements and influence al aspects of clients lives for schwab digital transformation is the result of organizational change where people proceses and the busines model busines they understand technology as tol to generate value among their consumers and colaborators likewise wade points out digital transformation in heis as an imperative deployment model and has led organizations to rethink how they can use technology to improve their performance or expand their busineses digital transformation is al about fundamentaly with change and involves people proceses strategies structures and competitive dynamics authors such as solis et al consider that the digital transformation involves realignment or new investment in technology and models comercials to more efectively engage digital customers at each point of contact in the life cycle of the customer experience companies should think in digital transformation as formal efort to renew the vision models and comercial investments for new digital economy for his part goble specifies it as the profound transformation of activities proceses competencies and busines and organizational models to take ful advantage of the changes and oportunities from combination of digital technologies and their acelerated impact on society in strategic and prioritized way from general perspective as can be deduced from the definitions given by the authors digital transformation is complex problem that afects many or al segments within company managers must balance simultaneously the exploration and exploitation of the resources of their companies to achieving organizational agility necesary condition for sucesful transformation of their busineses hes et al in response to the problem the institutions of higher education are not imune to this imperative change as concluded by faria nóvoa saying that this transformation pre establishes that taking advantage of eficiently al the oportunities and potential ofered by the large number of digital technologies available completely redefine busines models in the entire value chain is not simple and of course it is complex task this chalenge is more presing for organizations that are constantly trying to ensure their competitive position in global market but the same wory is becoming relevant to universities as competition to select to the best students and researchers aligned with this scenario lópez segrera states that higher education institutions are influenced and conditioned by the policies of the nation state and by the global trends of the capitalist world system it sems that these influences on the university are much more powerful than the changes and transformations that can be produced by higher education institutions within themselves and in the society where they reside chapter research design and universities compete globaly for students academics and financing funds and only those that remain relevant and take advantage of the new digital capabilities wil benefit in this digital era pwc as wel as many companies higher education institutions have responded to the impact of digitalization through multiple separate and uncordinated initiatives as consequently they run the risk of not considering important elements of the digital transformation or ignore solutions that are more favorable for situations specific which could have unintended adverse consequences hes et al in adition to the above as result of the rapid pace of technological change and the ubiquitous technologies that emerge almost daily there is no one size fits al solution everyone that suports efective digital transformation in organizations carcary et al the chalenge is exacerbated by the fact that digital transformation organizational covers the entire scope of the organization and requires rethinking completenes of skil sets and investment strategy olanrewaju et al faced with this scenario higher education institutions are caled to face digital transformation sen as an organic metamorphosis and structural that wil have to be adapted over time making use of the the institution own resources making the most of human resources and the environment that surounds it to guarante its survival arango serna et al systematic literature review to clarify the existing knowledge gap quality evaluation criteria one of the tasks described as critical by kitchenham et al is the evaluation criterion of quality and is therefore considered chalenge in systematic review furthermore an initial dificulty is that there is no agred definition of quality of study however the crd guidelines and the manual of the cochrane reviewers sugest that quality relates to the extent to which the study minimizes bias and maximizes internal and external validity researcher wieringa et al exposes some aproaches to evaluation criteria for example is the problem clearly stated are the properties causal or clearly established problem logic is the research method sound the knowledge validation is validated in other words is the conclusion suported for the document is this significant increase in knowledge of these situations in other words are the lesons learned interesting there is enough discusion on related work for this purpose kitchenham et al constructed quality questionaire based on with et al the aplication of the digital technology in al aspects of human society stolterman et al as cited by boughzala et al citied by henriete et al rodrigues digital transformation is increasingly viewed as an imperative and has led organizations to rethink how they can use technology to improve their performance or expand their busineses digital transformation is fundamentaly about change and it involves people proceses strategies structures and competitive dynamics wade digital transformation implies an organizational change based on the use and convergence of several resources and advances of emerging technologies such as big data cloud computing artificial inteligence augmented and virtual reality mobile aps social media internet of things blockchains among others rodrigues sulivan digital disruption is defined as the changes facilitated by digital technologies that ocur at pace and staib magnitude that disrupt established ways of value creation social interactions doing busines and more generaly our thinking riemer et al betcho digital transformation is described as the profound and acelerating transformation of busines activities proceses competencies and models to fuly leverage the changes and oportunities of digital technologies and their impact acros society in strategic and prioritized way scop the realignment of or new investment in technology and busines models to more efectively engage digital customers at every touch point in the customer experience lifecycle companies neded to think of digital transformation as formal efort to renovate busines vision models and investments for new digital economy solis et al digital transformation as the practice which closes the gap betwen what digital customers already expect and what analogue busineses actualy deliver verdino faria acording to bharadwaj et al the idea behind digital transformation and digital busines strategy nóvoa is simply that of an organizational strategy formulated and executed by leveraging digital resources to create aditional and diferentiated value digital transformation strategy impacts company more comprehensively than an it strategy by adresing potential efects on interactions acros company borders with clients competitors and supliers mat et al transformación digital en las ies modelo de implementación digital transformation goes wel beyond de materialization of proceses encompasing an inovative use of new technologies cloud social mobile and an alytics as way to promote new services re define busines models and inovative interactions with its users faria nóvoa kaminskyi et al the widespread proliferation of digital technologies their penetration into basicaly al spheres of human life and society is reflected in the concept of digital transformation digital transformation determines the transition to masive use of digital technologies in the variety of sectors of the economy and society which improve or replace traditional products and services digital transformation of the university education system should have broader focus and has to include the modernization of corporate it architecture management which could provide an important contribution to structuring the eforts of inovation in education kaminskyi et al fleacă the author considered the modern developments in the area of modernizing educational system organizational practices fleacă stolze et al major chalenge faced by organizations today is how to adopt and leverage new digital technologies as the ability to promote digital transformation is in mindset as new digital technologies demand diferent mindsets and skil sets than previous waves of transformative technologies fitzgerald et al kaufman and horton kane et al bresinsky von two diferent but interdependent developments can be identified on the one hand inovations in digital reusner technologies drive the ned for transformation and adaption in organizations but on the other hand transformation new technologies and tols as wel as changing user requirements through digital inovations bresinsky von reusner digitized organizations ned to focus on both technology domain and social domain for sucesful transformation bresinsky von reusner pérez gama digital transformation seks to significantly improve the productivity competitivenes and quality of postsecondary education institutions digital transformation is an acelerated evolution it is also revolution because of its radical and structural implications for people as for infrastructure that also requires new educational and busines models grab et al grab et al syntheses that digital transformation consists of wide range of diferent components ac ros such diverse disciplines like computer science social science energy management and many more at this point firms around the globe predominantly center on dealing with the latest technological advancements those include the use of artificial inteligence internet of things cloud computing or social media the multitude and complexity of diferent topics under the umbrela of digital transformation poses particular chalenge for firms seking to pigy back entire industries and organizations thoring et al inovative digital concepts for teaching have the potential to substantialy change the way courses of studies are formed because they alow for the implementation of digital transformation before during and after understand the total picture with proper governance and analysis of the entire system is esential to acurately evaluate the digital cycle clair sulivan and staib in general digital strategy depends largely on several factors some technological and others of non technological nature rodrigues some reasons for that companies do not presure to adres digitalization proceses are evident given the chalenging nature of exercise or since the standardization of internal proceses can require lot of time and resources grab et al among these factors are the culture and internal organization organizational silos organizational resistance to change the lack of resources and budget the legal and regulatory implications the understanding customer behavior or impact lack of data to justify the value of digital transformation lack of skils and digital literacy and the security rodrigues chapter research design knowledge gap in response to the demands of the fourth industrial revolution the institutions of higher education have ben forced to transform to coexist in world digital however this digital transformation not only implies technological progres it is more transcendental and generates changes so significant that they afect the culture and dynamics university in al its contexts from pedagogical aproaches teaching and learning to administrative proceses research extension infrastructure budget among others in this context digital transformation in educational institutions higher education requires rethinking restructuring reinventing the institutions of higher education from its multipurpose multiproces multidisciplinary nature multi state and multi user it is colective efort that puts the person at the center of the proces of development transformation and its impact on society from the systematic literature review the prevalence of case studies is evident conceptual and ilustrative as clear indication of the lack of maturity of this phenomenon therefore future research should focus more on establishing the theoretical foundations of the field based on existing theories or developing others new ones reis et al which alow higher education institutions adres digital transformation oportunities and chalenges objective system general objective explain the influence relationships betwen digital transformation practices and implementation of digital transformation in public universities in colombia by designing an implementation model specific objectives ob identify the diferent dimensions involved in the proceses of digital transformation that have ben caried out in the public universities of colombia digital transformation in heis deployment model ob propose an implementation model that relates the dimensions identified in ob and the digital transformation in public universities of colombia ob develop and aply measurement instrument to evaluate the execution of digital transformation practices and the implementation of digital transformation in public universities of colombia ob adjust the digital transformation implementation model for public universities of colombia ob validate the digital transformation implementation model for public universities of colombia investigation methodology the proposal is designed considering quantitative study aproach of the investigation whose epistemological suport is positivism paradigm whose the objective is to verify hypotheses using statistical techniques or determine the diferent parameters of variable through numerical expresions sampieri et al acording to the author amador rodríguez adúriz bravo the guidelines positivists consider that science is body of knowledge made up of facts and theories that are considered true in the sense of being contrasted with the data observational and whose verification is caried out through the empiricist scientific method primacy of observation acording to sampieri et al the quantitative aproach is sequential and evidentiary the order it rigorous part of an idea that is limited and once delimited are derived objectives and research questions the literature is reviewed and framework or theoretical perspective hypotheses are established from the questions and variables are determined plan is drawn up to test them design the variables are measured in certain context the measurements obtained are analyzed using statistical methods and the series of conclusions this phase is developed under the quantitative corelational aproach the investigation quantitative aims to determine how various concepts are related or linked variables or characteristics among themselves or also if they are not related sampieri et al structural equation models wil be implemented structural equation modeling sem which is data analysis technique second generation multivariate combines aspects of factor analysis and regresion multiplex that alows simultaneously examining series of interelationships of dependence and interdependence betwen observable variables and latent variables as wel as betwen latent variables becket et al martínez fiero digital transformation in heis deployment model in sem modeling the aproach wil be folowed refering to the least squares method pls sem based on the analysis of variance which implies more flexible modeling methodology by not requiring parametric asumptions rigorous mainly in the distribution of the data pls sem emerged as technique to analyze the complex relationships betwen latent variables that alow explain the observed data and being technique under causal predictive aproach of sem emphasizes prediction in the estimation of statistical models whose structures are designed to provide explanations causal this method is also useful for confirmatory research joseph hair et al aditionaly pls sem has greater statistical power meaning that pls sem is more likely to identify relationships as meaningful when in fact they are present in the population joseph hair et al pls sem is now widely aplied in many social science disciplines including organizational management educational sciences behavioral sciences international management human resources management information management systems operations management marketing management strategic management hotel management and suply chain management as wel as the publication of several textboks edited volumes and special isues of academic journals cepeda carión roldán salgueiro martínez ávila fiero moreno joseph hair et al this statistical technique for series of estimates of simultaneous equations using multiple regresions are characterized by two basic components the structural model and the measurement model the structural model is the guiding model that shows the dependency relationships betwen independent variables exogenous and variables dependent endogenous the measurement model shows the relationships betwen the constructs latent variables and indicators observable variables in this model the contribution of each item reactive to the measurement scale is evaluated that is specifies which indicators define each construct furthermore it evaluates the reliability of constructs and indicators martínez fiero below are the steps to be caried out in the research se figure convergent validity and discriminant validity of the scales used subsequently the fit of the structural model is evaluated and whether or not they suport the research hypotheses specificaly for the development of point hair et al established the methodology that consists of the folowing stages to aply pls sem se figure chapter research methodology figure stages for analysis and validation of the model aplying pls sem stage specification of the structural model the structural model also caled internal model in the context of pls sem represents the constructs or latent variables circles or ovals the structural model also shows the relationships paths betwen the constructs latent variables can be exogenous those constructs that explain other constructs in the model or endogenous those constructs that are explained by the model trajectory models are developed based on theory hair et al in adition to observing the latent and observable variables it is also it is important to mention two aspects that may be imersed in the model and they are the mediation and moderation martínez fiero mediation involves situation where one or more mediating variables explain the proceses through the which an exogenous construct influences an endogenous one noreña on the other hand the moderation ocurs when the efect of an exogenous latent variable on variable endogenous latent variable depends on the values that third variable caled variable moderator which moderates the relationship noreña digital transformation in heis deployment model stage development and specification of the measurement model the measurement model of the constructs also caled external models in pls sem show the relationships betwen the constructs and their observable variables or indicators rectangles in general there are two diferent ways to measure unobservable variables one aproach is known as reflective model and the other is formative model in training model the arows go from the indicators to the construct indicating causal relationship predictive in that direction while reflective model the arows go from the construct towards the indicators indicating the asumption that the construct causes the measurement more precisely co variation of the indicator variables stage design study to generate empirical results in this stage it develops the colection and examination of data the apropriate sample size is evaluated and select the mising data estimation and aproximation model to run this stage researchers wil take into acount general rules such as those provided by cohen in his statistical power analyzes for multiple regresion models provided that the measurement models have aceptable quality in terms of loads external loadings must be above the comon threshold of thus the things the recomended sample size in pls sem is for power statistic of with significance level of minimum of and number two of arows pointing to the construct stage evaluation of the measurement and structural model the stage involves eforts to test the validity and reliability of the model and its coresponding theoretical relationships hypothetical validity is evaluated that is whether what is desired is being measured measure and reliability which is measure of the degre to which set of performance indicators latent variable is internaly coherent depending on the high interelationship of the indicators among themselves the individual reliability of the item internal consistency or reliability of scale convergent validity and discriminant validity in the evaluation of the global model estimation of the measurement model godnes criteria are not established adjustment covariance based sem but and evaluate the measures separately reflective and formative martínez fiero se table constructs hcm from its acronym in english hierarchical component models second order construct ocurs when latent variable it is measured by several first order latent variables in that case researchers should aply combination of the indicators aproach repeated and the use of latent variable scores in two phase hcm analysis in the first phase the model is estimated with the indicators of the first order factors ading al the previous indicators as indicators of the factor construct of second order this method is caled hcm hierarchical component method cepeda carión roldán salgueiro hair et al in second phase of pls analysis the model is estimated using the scores calculated by the program to each of the first order constructs rather than the data the scores of the first order constructs are the average loadings of the items of each component weighted with the loads estimated in the first stage cepeda carión roldán salgueiro joseph hair et al se figure digital transformation in heis deployment model figure hcm analysis aproach in two phases vl vl vl vl vl vl vl first phase duplication of indicators in the second phase score asignment second order construct vl to second order construct vl stage evaluation of reflective measures internal consistency or scale reliability acording to becket et al the construct reliability aims to test the internal consistency of al indicators by measure the concept that is the rigor with which the variables manifest they are measuring the latent variable the reliability coeficient measure which evaluates the consistency of the entire scale is cronbach alpha the lower limit generaly agred for cronbach alpha and aditionaly cronbach alpha is only aplicable to latent variables with reflective indicators cepeda carión roldán salgueiro convergent validity it is measure that indicates that set of indicators items or reagents represent single underlying construct martínez fiero is that is it evaluates the degre to which two measures of the same concept are corelated here the researcher can lok for alternative measures of concept and then corelate them with the sumed scale the high corelations here indicate that the scale you are measuring your intended concept becket et al convergent validity is calculated with the ave which measures that the variance of the construct can be explained through chapter research methodology of its indicators martínez fiero the ave must be greater than or equal to and provides the amount of variance that construct obtains from its indicators in relationship to the amount of variance due to measurement eror this means that each construct or variable explains at least of the variance of the indicators individual item reliability reliability measures the degre to which the measurements are fre of random erors this reliability examines the simple loadings or corelations of the indicators such as the construct they aim to measure the load value must be equal to or greater than since they indicate that the construct explains more than of the variance of the indicator which provides aceptable reliability of the items hair et al discriminant validity discriminant validity refers to the extent to which construct is empiricaly distinct from other constructs within the structural model hair et al the empirical test is again the corelation betwen the measurements but this time the sumed scale corelates with similar measure but conceptualy diferent now the corelation should be low showing that the scale is suficiently diferent from the other concept becket et al in sumary convergent validity confirms that the scale is corelated with other known measures of the concept while discriminant validity ensures that the scale is suficiently diferent from other concepts to be distinct becket et al aditionaly prior to validating the structural model it is necesary to study the validity and reliability of the second order constructs that wil act as indicators in the structural model stage evaluation of formative measures convergent validity is the degre to which the formatively measured construct is positively corelated with measure alternative reflective or single item of the same construct noreña the colinearity betwen indicators which arises when two variables are highly corelated and the significance and relevance of the weights which are the result of multiple regresion of construct with its indicators the weights are the main criterion to ases the relative importance of each indicator in the formative measurement models noreña digital transformation in heis deployment model stage evaluation of the structural model once the measurement model has ben analyzed requires evaluating the structural model the final stage involves eforts to test the validity of the structural model and its coresponding hypothetical theoretical relationships the structural evaluation of the model analyzes the the predictive relevance the size and the significance of the standardized regresion coeficients or path coeficients and the efect sizes and the interpretation of results and the suport or not of the hypothesis the basic pls algorithm folows two step aproach the first concerns the iterative estimation of the latent variable scores and the second step is refers to the final estimation of the weights loads and path coeficients through the estimation of ordinary least squares multiple and simple and in the analysis of main components martínez fiero stage advanced analysis once the structural model latent variables and observable it is also important to mention two aspects that may be involved in the model and they are mediation and moderation martínez ávila fiero moreno the core of mediation analysis is that it asumes sequence of relationships in which that an independent variable afects mediating variable which then afects dependent variable se figure nitzl et al mediation and moderation are similar in that they describe situations in which the relationship betwen two constructs depends on third variable mediation hapens when third mediating variable intervenes betwen two other constructs related more precisely change in the exogenous variable causes change in the mediating variable which in turn results in change in the endogenous variable in the pls path model therefore mediating variable governs nature that is the underlying mechanism or proces of the relationship betwen two constructs hair et al for its part moderation describes situation in which the relationship betwen two constructs is not constant but depends on the values of third variable caled moderating variable the moderating variable or construct changes the strength or even the direction of relationship betwen two constructs in the model hair et al the aproach separately evaluates direct indirect and total efects chapter research methodology figure general mediation model nitzl et al in adition to the analysis of mediating variables the results obtained can be expanded report the estimated path coeficients of the standard pls sem ading dimension to the analysis more specificaly the analysis of the importance performance map importance performance map analysis ipma that compares the total efects of the model structure on specific dependent construct target with the mean of the scores of the latent antecedent variables of said construct hair et al noreña as result conclusions can be drawn about two dimensions both importance and performance which is particularly significant to prioritize the management actions that should be taken consequently it is preferable focus primarily on improving the performance of those constructs that show great importance in terms of its explanation of certain objective construct but at the same time they have relatively low performance hair et al stage interpretation of results once the monitoring results are obtained of the previous stages the stage of analysis and interpretation of results begins to which decisions wil be based on the theory described in hair et al theoretical framework this section aims to contextualize the digital transformation in educational institutions higher education as an organizational transformation where they must be taken into acount acount and align diferent perspectives to synchronize digital transformation in one holistic and evolutionary integration over time this evolution may be the result of gradual change in the behavior of individual elements in the company or can be the result of deliberate and conscious action which aims to cary out changes in company harmsen et al with the fourth industrial revolution as says schwab the transformation in its scale scope and complexity wil be diferent unlike anything humanity has experienced before it is characterized by fusion of technologies that are bluring the lines betwen the physical digital and biological spheres the response must be comprehensive involving al policy stakeholders global from the public and private sectors to academia and civil society in consequently the presure on companies to align their busines strategy with the technological changes in the environment have increased significantly with the emergence and growing importance of new digital technologies the strategic context of organizations is being profoundly transformed changing the structure of competition behavior and expectations of customers the way busines is conducted the way products are made products and services are provided the way of working and ultimately the nature of entire industries teichert from the educational field the university has known how to adapt frely to the sucesive orders is socioeconomic to radical changes in science and intelectual culture if not so it has long ben would have gone down in history this scenario has alowed the university to continue to be powerful and omnipresent institution tribute that is due not so much to its transcendent virtue as if to its incesant adaptation scot adaptation required to face great chalenges variety of academic levels that proliferate digital transformation in heis deployment model rapidly and growing political controversy over the cost and financing of the postsecondary ofering the long standing monopoly of universities on production oficial knowledge now has new competitors whether from think tanks social networks or technology firms that atract top academics with data of great capacity and generous compensations the transnational competition for prominence of students and research has only increased in recent years driven in part by global hegemony of rankings as metrics of prestige such dynamism requires and rewards coherent sociology of universities as organizations eaton stevens the objective of digital transformation is continuous optimization in such way it can detect changes in the market and respond quickly goble to orchestrate these profound changes transformation is required within the universities synchronized as paradigm shift for leadership in education change ocurs as natural manifestation of the developmental sequence in the maturity transformation proces at the execution level there is the company operational related to normal operations first order system while that at the level of transformation is the busines transformation company second order system harmsen et al next digital transformation wil be explained as transformation proces organizational and its perspectives for change wil be described digital transformation as transformation organizational acording to kilman et al cited by calderón hernández et al the transformation is proces by which organizations examine what they were what they are what they wil ned to be and how to make the necesary changes for them the transformation is characterized by being non linear proces that requires great efort of the organization as whole and not simple aproximation of its parts in adition to achieve this it is necesary to understand that organizational transformations focus in human cultural social proceses encourages colaboration betwen leaders of the organization and members in conjunction with technological and structural elements calderón hernández et al pérez valejo et al on the other hand not alchapter theoretical framework organizational changes are in the same order of magnitude acording to bartunek moch organizational transformation is the work of facilitating change in organizations sugarman since the and these changes have received names like first order single lop alpha shift or second order double lop gama shift thus authors such as amir uri cited by pérez valejo et al introduced organizational change as strategic and lasting proces in the time the first order change ocurs incrementaly and is defined as those minor improvements and adjustments that do not change the core of the system and are developed naturaly within its established paradigm and the second order change is in the core of the organization and is ireversible the change has ocured in the very esence in the kernel and nothing special neds to be done to maintain the change that has ben made reached in contrast to first order change second order change has wider reach and is more durable it is deper and involves changes in the thought not only in behavior amir uri bartunek moch furthermore it is multi layered proces that simultaneously afects diferent levels of organizations and even to the context of the organization operation ferlie et al such change is often required when organizations change their basic mision enter completely new markets or when facing crisis by failing to met competitive chalenges sugarman the importance of external presures and the role of crisis in initiating change in large organizations ilustrating the cocktail of internal and external presures that produces strategic organizational change the transformation proces implies that the system would go beyond present forms since emergent forms rarely are clear it is imposible to specify the exact nature of the transformational change except to sugest that it generaly tends to produce systems with higher level of structure that can encompas and manage the expanded system greater simplicity general that increases the eficiency of the operation higher levels of consciousnes self reflective alowing the system to se its own functioning more clearly and therefore alows for more harmonious orchestration betwen al components of the system elgin bushnel in this sense it is the incorporation of changes important organizational aspects in the strategic management proceses of the organization digital transformation in heis deployment model which led to greater emphasis on macro or holistic view of organizational change ferlie et al in other words the second order change is change multidimensional radical organizational multini vel qualitative discontinuous that involves paradigm shift amir uri it is significant to highlight that organizational transformation is defined as the work of facilitate fundamental change in organizations and promote paradigmatic change sugarman when the organization belief system no longer explains the in reality nor does it help shape policies and operations the organization goes through crisis in this situation dominant coalitions tend to adhere to the old paradigm to increase centralization and to cal for going back to basics these actions they depen the crisis until turning point is reached in that case the organization either stops functioning or sudenly jumps to higher order and new paradigm with new vision of the world new organizational philosophy beliefs values structure policies and operations amir uri as adams points out organizational transformation means change in both thought and action as more fundamental level that has ben achieved so far by most of the change agents the author lewin cited by pérez valejo et al describes organizational transformation as modification of the forces that maintain the behavior of stable system so said behavior is product of two types of forces those that help change to take place driving forces and those who resist the change from ocuring restrictive forces who want maintain the status quo they also propose the change in thre phases the first of them is the thaw the motivation for change is created or its ned is evident movement can ocur through the asimilation of new information the exposure of new concepts or the development of diferent perspective and refrezing or stabilization of change calderón hernández et al later schein aded that to the unfrezing stage thre sub proceses discusion of the expectations induction of the desire for learning which ocurs once the the validity and relevance of the facts initialy discused and provision of security psychological which converts anxiety into motivation for change calderón hernández et al finaly change ocurs through cognitive restructuring in the which words are redefined concepts are interpreted more broadly or they learn new standards of evaluation and judgment calderón hernández et al chapter theoretical framework on the other hand the authors amir uri propose evolutionary change by distinguishing five general stages stage planed organizational change and development changes in the environment and in the organization adaptation eforts by development step by step changes step into the curent belief system purpose and mision stage awarenes incremental and minor changes canot provide satisfactory solutions there is cal to go back to basics and to stick to the old mudle through crisis stage creating readines for change the organization the author tichy argues that thre diferent perspectives coexist in organizational theory and practice representing diferent ways of explaining the organizational technical political and cultural reality the technical paradigm is greatly limited measure to organize the most efective way to get the job done the political paradigm includes theories of exchange conflict power and coalition problems and alocation of rewards and limits its scope to political aspects finaly the cultural paradigm it restricts much of its scope to cultural aspects tichy sugests integrating the thre higher education institutions implementation model design and validation of content transformation measuring instrument digital in education institutions superior validity comonly acepted definition of the validity of an instrument is the extent to which the instrument measures what it purports to measure slocumb cole it is also considered vital factor in the selection or aplication of an instrument zamanzadeh et al and serves as guide to determine the apropriate implications of the study findings slocumb cole specificaly validity is determined by examining concepts related to construct criterion and content validity devon block moyle wright et al construct validity refers to how wel an instrument identifies measures corect operationalizations for the theoretical concepts under study sampieri et al yin the criterion validity of measurement instrument is established by comparing its results with those of certain external criterion that tries to measure the same sampieri digital transformation in heis implementation model et al and finding statisticaly significant relationship betwen measure and criterion rubio et al and content validity refers to the degre to which the items of an instrument are representative sample of the content domain being measured escura devon block moyle wright et al magdalena et al zamanzadeh et al content validity content validity reveals ful range of the atribute under study devon block moyle wright et al in terms of clarity coherence relevance and suficiency of the dimension item with respect to content domain carbajal tamari to develop set of scale items researcher first defines the construct of interest and its dimensions searching the literature through opinions of experts carying out population sampling or through qualitative research devon block moyle wright et al on the other hand content validity can be characterize as face validity or logical validity face validity indicates that the measure apears to be valid at first glance logical validity indicates more proces rigorous focused on an evaluation provided by expert judges so that information can be provided about the representativenes and clarity of the elements and ofer concrete sugestions to improve the quality of the instrument rubio et al zamanzadeh et al if experts in the field are perceived as true experts it is unlikely that there is higher authority that questions the asumption validity of the test content lawshe in sumary escobar pérez cuervo martínez sugests the folowing categories to evaluate the validity of content of measuring instrument suficiency clarity coherence relevance and the rating scale does not met criteria low level moderate level high level finaly numerous analytical techniques have ben proposed to quantify the degre of agrement of experts on the relevance of the content of an instrument among the most used are aiken coeficient aiken the validity index of lawshe content cvi lawshe the content validity index cvr and the content validity coeficient cvc hernandez nieto and pedrosa et al detail other techniques the main ones are described below chapter design of the empirical study of aiken aiken coeficient is considered the most relevant statistic to evaluate validity of content escura evaluate the relevance of each item with respect to its construct but also considers not only the number of categories ofered to the judges but the number of participating experts aditionaly the ratings asigned they can be dichotomous values of or or polychotomous values of to pedrosa et al the statistic is calculated using equation where represents the median of the judges ratings represents the value lowest posible and represents the range of posible values within the scale of measurement used the statistic provides an index that goes from to we obtain value of equal to when al judges select the lowest posible score and value of equal to when al judges select the highest score posible non experimental descriptive study during the proces colected the qualitative and quantitative points of view of expert judges regarding the research topic folowing the methodology proposed by hason et al study design web based delphi proces was developed to involve expert judges and validate the content of the measurement instrument with respect to the implementation of the digital transformation in higher education institutions the steps were folowed preparation of instructions and spreadshets comitment with experts delphi method and colection and analysis of results preparation of instructions and spreadshets prior to developing the instrument review of the literature was caried out that alowed identify twenty nine items grouped mainly into four dimensions twelve of them belonging to the organizational perspective seven belonging to the socio cultural perspective five that represent the technological perspective and five related to the maturity of the digital transformation in higher education institutions se anex digital transformation in heis deployment model subsequently so that the information was colected in an operable form the items were adjusted and organized in an apropriate format and sequence zamanzadeh et al furthermore the instructions to the judges about the dimensions and the indicator that measures each item or group of items were explained in detail through video cover leter and writen documents sugested by escobar pérez cuervo martínez finaly the study respected ethical considerations such as aceptance permision to use and safeguard the information provided by the judges experts selection of experts delphi method the sample selection was non probabilistic purposeful and critical taherdost et al acording to the interest in participating in the study knowledge about the topic of digital transformation in higher education institutions experience and availability some experts were contacted through emails electronic available in the diferent scientific articles on digital transformation and others recognized experts in diferent countries initialy list of thirty five was designed two potential judges each of whom received cover leter and invitation to take part in the evaluation trial eleven judges acepted it was requested to the expert judges who responded to the self asesment that mets the requirements described in section to calculate the expert competence coeficient finaly the nine experts with rating greater than preparation the proces was created with criterion of seking the participation of expert judges from diferent geographical regions and with heterogeneous experience the delphi method consisted of total of nine judges four doctors five systems enginers or electricians who serve as profesors deans or directors of inovation in higher education institutions the group of experts also reflected diversity of opinions with varied geographical representation of the countries from colombia spain portugal guatemala and germany chapter design of the empirical study the role of the expert judges was to review these indicators and establish the level of agrement on the relevance coherence clarity and suficiency of each item with respect to the construct to which it belongs data colection the survey was conducted through the surveymonkey web aplication the delphi method is tok sent to them by email he asked the judges who acepted the invitation to respond within thre weks after receiving the email it is worth mentioning that comunication and evaluation by the experts ocured asynchronously up to two were sent reminders to participants who did not complete the survey within the specified time frame and finaly the survey was closed after two months with very significant contributions complete and detailed information provided by the nine judges the survey included four sections the first contained information about the study and the self asesment required to calculate the coeficient the second concerned data identification of the future evaluator the third described the main characteristics and dimensions of the university with their respective items along with the details of the characteristics of each construct scientific relevance and indicators to rate each item finaly the fourth section colected information from the judges self asesment to calculate the argumentation coeficient furthermore each the section ofered fields to fre text for observations that the judges would like to expres in this round and for each indicator the experts had to indicate their agrement or disagrement on level likert type scale not compliant low level moderate level high level acording to suficiency clarity coherence and relevance the analysis was caried qualitative in the wording of the questions and some of the context was modified to finalize the design of the questionaire in conclusion the study of the validity of an instrument is costly proces that it requires time to plan and execute in that order the first critical step to caried out must be the study of content validity because this analysis verifies that the instruments used for the studies are apropriate for the onstruct the population being investigated and the socio cultural context in which the study is imersed since content validity is prerequisite for other types of validity it must have top priority during the development of the instrument in content validity studies researchers can receive information invaluable from expert judges who provide constructive fedback on the quality of the newly developed measures and the objective criteria with which they must evaluate each element rubio et al consequently the analysis of the consolidated results of the instrument through the aiken and consensus coeficients indicates that the instrument has content validity and that there is strong consensus among the judges therefore second round was not required on the contrary values that do not exhibited statistical significance in their content validity and or had values lower than in the consensus coeficient were carefuly reviewed by the chapter design of the empirical study researchers and reflecting the observations provided by the expert judges the wording and context to facilitate understanding of the item acepting the sugestion of the expert judges items and of the technological dimension were merged into single item consequently the evaluation of the instrument described in this work facilitates obtaining of scientificaly valid and hypotheses creating key variables necesary for the analysis castro benavides et al and indicators that are measured in five point likert scale no degre low degre moderate degre high degre very high degre based on the literature reviewed in chapter the survey was structured in two sections and nine international experts evaluated its content validity using the delphi method the first section contains fourten items related to the main characteristics of the university and the interviewed the second section is related to the main perspectives there is four constructs that are operationalized as compon perspective entities organizational org information inf administration admn planing plan and proces proc total of twelve indicators were measured aditionaly it operationalize total of seven items or variables observed in the socio economic perspective cultural cult then total of five items or variables observed as components of the technological perspective tec and finaly total of five items or observed variables of digital transformation maturity dt_madurez se anex digital transformation in heis deployment model analytical aproach the pls sem method alows the estimation of complex models that include several constructs indicator variables and structural trajectories without imposing asumptions of distribution over the data aditionaly it has great statistical power which means that by aplying pls sem it is more likely that relationships wil be identified as significant when they are in fact present in the population hair et al as pls sem is causal predictive aproach to sem it is the apropriate method for the research when its objective is the prediction and confirmation of theory dash paul hair et al aditionaly pls sem should be selected when population smal restricts the sample size hair et al this study used higher order model or hierarchical component models hcm that involve testing second order structures containing two layers of components in the present study the higher order construct refering to organizational perspective org is composed of lower order reflective constructs inf admn proc plan similarly lower order constructs have reflective measurement model the other constructs of the model such as cult tec and dt_madurez are reflective folowing the steps described by hair et al the the first step evaluation begins with the examination of the measurement models and in secondly the structural model is evaluated evaluation of the measurement and structural model evaluation of the measurement model first of al it is necesary to create the construct with the scores of the order construct superior org its respective components and indicators researchers must aply combination of the repeated indicators aproach and the use of scores latent variables in two phase hcm analysis hair et al in the first phase se figure the repeated indicator aproach is used to obtain the scores of the latent variables for the lower order components loc in the second phase loc scores serve as latent variables in the measurement model of higher order component hoc se figure when you aply the analysis to the two phase hcm the hoc is integrated into the nomological network in such way that chapter results of the empirical study alows other latent variables not part of the hoc as predecesors explain part of their variance two phase hcm analysis can identify relationships of significant paths that would not otherwise be found hair et al figure higher order construct org internal model path coeficients external loads outer loadings and constructs digital transformation in heis deployment model figure structural model with path and coeficients the evaluation of the reflective measurement model is caried out through the internal consistency cronbach alpha and composite reliability convergent validity indicator reliability and average variance extracted ave discriminant validity fornel larcker criterion and cros loadings betwen indicators and latent variables and the heterotrait monotrail ratio htmt cepeda carión roldán salgueiro internal consistency cronbach alpha is measure of consistency reliability internal that asumes similar thresholds but produces lower values than the reliability composite hair et al aditionaly cronbach alpha is only aplicable to latent variables with reflective indicators cepeda carión roldán salgueiro higher values indicate higher levels of reliability and values of and higher high values are considered problematic as they indicate that the items are redundant which reduces construct validity al latent variable measures indicate reliability of internal consistency in the measurement model se table convergent validity the metric used to evaluate the convergent validity of construct is the average variance extracted ave for al items of each construct an aceptable ave is or higher which establishes that more than of the chapter results of the empirical study variance of the construct is due to its indicators hair et al al the sizes of the construct are greater than se table table construct reliability and validity average of the cronbach alpha rho_a construct composite reliability variance extracted bird cult dt_maturity org tec the factor loadings of the indicators the evaluation of the measurement model implies examine factor loadings the high values in the factor loadings reveal that the indicators asociated with the construct have much in comon the value of the factor loading it is also caled indicator reliability loads greater than are recomended since they indicate that the construct explains more than of the variance of the indicator which provides aceptable reliability of the items hair et al however instead to automaticaly eliminate indicators researchers must examine undermine carefuly examine the efects of item deletion on composite reliability as wel as on the average extracted variance of the coresponding latent variable in generaly indicators with external loads betwen and should be considered for removal of the scale only when the removal of the indicator leads to an increase in composite reliability or average variance extracted hair et al in consequently item cul was eliminated from the scale because doing so increases significantly the composite reliability other procs were maintained and tec_ as shown in figure discriminant validity traditionaly the fornel and larcker criterion is used to evaluate discriminant validity however the authors henseler et al demonstrate that neither the fornel larcker criterion nor the evaluation of cros loadings alow users of variance based sem to determine discriminant validity of their measures and propose new aproach caled htmt if the html value is below discriminant validity is established betwen two reflective constructs hair et al the results show that the htmlt discriminant validity values for al constructs they are les dt_maturity p_cul_ p_cul_ p_cul_ p_cul_ p_cul_ p_cul_ admn inf plan proc p_tec_ p_tec_ p_tec_ p_tec_ p_tec_ mat evaluating the structural model in the first instance the model prediction capacity is determined and subsequently it evaluates the extent to which exogenous variables contribute to the explained variance of the endogenous variables the evaluation criteria that must be considered are coeficient of determination which represents the predictive power of the sample because it is the squared corelation of the actual and predictive values likewise must calculate the redundancy and comunality index using stone cros validation gleiser this measure is an indicator of predictive power that measures how wel they are reconstructed the values by the model and its estimated parameters and the significance and relief statistical analysis of the path coeficients hair et al that analyzes the relationships betwen the constructs through the values obtained from the coeficients standardized paths aditionaly researchers should evaluate the predictive power outside chapter results of the empirical study of their model sample using the plspredict procedure described in shmueli et al before evaluating the structural relationships of the model colinearity must be examined this verification makes it posible to ensure that there are no biases in the results of the regresion hair et al although colinearity is evaluated betwen formative indicators in reflective models they are used to check if there are critical levels of colinearity betwen the sets of predictor variables mediating variables absorb part of the relationship betwen an exogenous construct and endogenous in the pls path model through the indirect efect which is the relationship betwen the exogenous latent construct and the mediating variable and betwen the mediating variable and the endogenous latent construct therefore the mediating variables reveal the true relationship betwen an exogenous construct and an endogenous one hair et al for evaluate if there is mediation and if it is total or partial the direct and indirect efects are evaluated and totals acording to the methodology described by hair et al total mediation ocurs when the mediated indirect efect is significant but the asociated direct efect is not therefore the mediating variable explains completely the relationship betwen an exogenous independent variable and endogenous dependent it is also caled indirect mediation only noreña partial mediation ocurs when mediating variable explains partialy the relationship betwen an exogenous construct and an endogenous one noreña the algorithm that was folowed to evaluate the mediating variables of the model is described in figure the procedure includes the analysis of the efects evaluating their significance subsequently the vaf for vaf values greater than there wil be complete mediation betwen the and inclusive the mediation wil be partial and for vaf les than it wil
