guaranted parking ford media center rdbci vi article inovation telecomuting and public educational libraries ways to digital transformation in the post pandemic world of work jobson louis almeida brandão valmira peruchi gustavo henrique de araújo freire abstract introduction the development of more asertive public policies in libraries in acordance with the dynamics of telecomuting that are being created is an esential debate in the field of information science objective this article discuses the evolution of public educational libraries in telecomuting to serve comunity of profesionals who work and comunicate in network methodology methodologicaly the research has an exploratory level qualitative aproach developed through bibliographical research and elaborated from the data of doctoral research that uses the action science method results the results highlight the posibility of inovation through remote work in the federal public service especialy with the advent of decre of may the oportunity to inovate in the public sector with promising service performed by public educational libraries at federal institutes and the inseparability betwen work and research agendas as wel as betwen social development and digital transformation conclusion it is concluded that the paths for the digital transformation in the world of work can become even more productive inovative profitable and sustainable when the continuous and adequate investment in library infrastructure that fulfils an educational function and is of public nature is sought and in policies that ensure the performance of librarians as agents of inovation in federal institutes keywords public educational libraries inovation telecomuting work digital transformation author corespondence inovação trabalho remoto bibliotecas instituto federal da paraíba joão pesoa pb brazil educativas públicas caminhos para mail jobsonlouis gmail com transformação digital no mundo do trabalho pós instituto federal da paraíba joão pesoa pb brazil pandemia mail vperuchi yaho com br resumo universidade federal do rio de introdução desenvolvimento de políticas públicas mais asertivas em janeiro bibliotecas de acordo com as dinâmicas de teletrabalho que estão se rio de janeiro rj brazil constituir um debate imprescindível ao campo da ciência da mail ghafreire gmail com informação objetivo presente artigo discute evolução das bibliotecas educativas públicas em espaços de trabalho remoto para servir uma comunidade de profisionais que trabalham se comunicam em rede metodologia metodologicamente pesquisa rdbci campinas sp de nível exploratório abordagem qualitativa desenvolvida por meio de pesquisa bibliográfica partir dos dados de uma pesquisa de doutorado que utiliza método ciência ação resultados os resultados destacam posibi inovation through remote work in the service federal public especialy with the advent of decre of may the oportunity to inovate in the public sector with service promising role played by public educational libraries in federal institutes and the inseparability betwen work and work schedules research as wel as betwen social development and digital transformation conclusion it is concluded that the paths to digital transformation in the world of work can become even more productive inovative profitable and sustainable when seking the continued and adequate investment in library infrastructure that they fulfil an educational function and are public in nature and policies that ensure the librarian role as an agent of inovation in federal institutes key words public educational libraries inovation teleworking work digital transformation credit recognitions not aplicable funding not aplicable conflicts of interest authors certify that they have no comercial or asociative interest that represents conflict of interest in relation to the manuscript ethical aproval not aplicable two availability of data and material not aplicable authors contributions conceptualization research methodology project administration visualization writing original draft writing review editing methodology project administration supervision writing review editing brandão the peruchi freite jita dc public libraries article submited to the similarity system submited acepted published editor gildenir carolino santos rdbci campinas sp introduction promoting social development through digital transformation in the world of work in post pandemic environment is as chalenging as it is promising after al oportunities often arise in unpredictable moments of crisis and consequently unexpected changes public libraries are at the center of these changes and oportunities in the networked information century this phenomenon requires information profesionals to take proactive aproach to inovation inovation is comprehensive and transversal so we adopt as conception of inovation the development of new products and services with inovative methods and actions such as for example citizen labs ideas incubators virtual learning environments creative spaces and participatory environments enabling aces to online colections and digital information these inovations which when put into practice bring improvement to service product or proces existing in library contributing to make the lives of people who use the products and services ofered by it easier the maping of scientific literature to identify the evolution of the theme inovation in the field of information science caried out by gabriel júnior sousa and silva states that it is very dificult to have definition of inovation that mets al areas and contexts in the ic area inovation is very much characterized as proces of improvement or transformation of proceses and services in ci the concept of inovation as development or improvement of proceses and services ocurs mainly with the insertion or updating of new technologies and also transformations and modifications in management proceses this type of inovation in existing proceses is always thought of to met the demands of specific group of users of information services for some types of institutions that ofer information services inovation in services and products ofered becomes more dificult proces due to the aforementioned costs necesary for the efective implementation of new services gabriel junior sousa and silva discus two types of libraries very comon in brazil the public library and the university library about the first the authors state that it has enormous potential for inovation as from the information and comunication technologies icts because they enable beter interaction betwen users products and services favoring autonomy in tasks related to the services ofered by the library however it is pointed out as the main chalenge the fundraising for the apropriate investment in these technologies given the reality of public libraries in the country notoriously known as precarious from the point of view of economic investment from public policies in relation to the second the authors point out as barier the lack of knowledge for the library maintainers of the importance of inovation to generate value because they perceive it as conventional space gabriel junior sousa and silva point out that the concept of inovation in university library should also be asociated with the development and improvement of products and services related to scientific comunication since large part of its public is made up of researchers and students who ned scientific information to cary out their activities and develop their research it is important to mention that both in the study by gabriel júnior sousa and silva the most updated scientific maping on the theme inovation in the ic field and in al the scientific literature investigated as from the research that originated the present article there is no aproach on inovation in libraries of federal institutes which curently in brazil play an educational role in the public sector in more comprehensive way than university libraries for serving users linked to the secondary technical and higher education level and for being present in widely distributed maner throughout the national teritory this gap begins rdbci campinas sp to be filed with this article the first of series of publications that intends to adres the isue with the intent of dev eloping it in the scientific and profesional field with view to both the public educational library and the librarians work beyond the library in other spaces suitable for their work in inovation ecosystems during the pandemic period betwen the years and profesionals from various fields learned new lesons about the most diverse isues that interfere with lifestyles and ways of life as we know them this was landmark of significant changes including changes in the world of work and employment among several the isue of changes in the way of life at work especialy the future of remote work and the role of public educational libraries in this dynamic context in brazil interested the present study during enancib the authors of the present article proposed that these are libraries that suport with info educational actions the teaching research and extension practices developed by public educational institutions whose function is educational and their nature is public conceptualy from the perspective of their organizational identity public educational libraries were defined as information units with priority educational purpose and of public nature which met the information neds of both the academic public at al levels of teaching neds and skils and the technical administrative public and the comunity in general through info educational actions the colection of such institutions can be made up of works that are multicultural extracuricular and linked to the lifelong learning proces covering al age groups without distinction the libraries of the federal institutes are an example of this type of information unit in brazil however this does not exclude other libraries to identify themselves in this organizational identity being necesary to depen the theme in future studies two points constitute the starting point that inspired this research first the observation of the recent transformations that have ocured in the working environments of the comunities to which the authors of this article are linked caried out during doctoral research second the contemporary reflection woven by an experienced north american profesor about the inovation that has emerged over time in public libraries author of many boks and articles about the policymaking proces and how to improve the management of public organizations steve kelman profesor of public administration at harvard university published on august in the traditional and renowned american blog about federal public administration fcw federal computer wek an article entitled in its translation public libraries and government inovation this article is the focal point of the reflection that originated the present research and discusion it is usual that at the core of discusions on public information policies in the field of information science ic in brazil convergence is sought in an interdiscipl inary way betwen what is said in the scientific literature of the administration field and public administration with the ic literature itself and librarianship in numerous instances however recently the debate on sustainable development urban infrastructure and smart cities has gained notoriety and broadened the interdisciplinary range of isues investigated in this scientific field this ocurs due to the evidencing of the urgency in solving and dealing with climate isues for human survival on planet earth and its unfolding which include rethinking the quality of life at work and the ned for presence in diverse situations and environments it has ben trend therefore that profesionals and researchers from other fields of knowledge with emphasis in this discusion on the field of architecture and urbanism become interested in public libraries and their social function in urban spaces historicaly there is an evolution in the apreciation of libraries as civic spaces beyond the idea of exclusive spaces for the promotion of reading and boks defended throughout the th century as places primarily for study and research kelman mentions in his article his satisfaction in recently coming acros the article by liz mcormick sumer urban scholar at new urban mechanics in boston usa rdbci campinas sp who works on management inovations for the city the article titled in translation the radical potential of libraries mentions new ways of library use folowing the pandemic and was published on the city of boston institutional blog specificaly on the page of the mayor ofice of new urban mechanics which is kind of research and development laboratory in boston and also serves as civic incubator for ideas within the city government in europe there has ben lot of talk about the implementation of distributed citizen labs in public libraries initiatives such as the recent ofer of the course laboratorios ciudadanos distribuidos available at for librarians and profesionals from brazil in the distance learning modality promoted by the ministry of culture and sports of spain through the general direction of boks and reading promotion demonstrates the importance of the theme and of the insertion of libraries in the context of citizen inovation diego garcia cordinator of the libraries laboratories project of the mentioned spanish ministry highlighted at the begining of the course through spech broadcast on the youtube platform on april th the importance of reinforcing the role of libraries as meting and colaborative learning spaces where the promotion of democratic values is guaranted distributed citizen labs conceptualy can be understod in broader and more complete way from the perspective of social researcher lorena ruiz diseminated within the first module of the course promoted by the ministry of culture and sport of spain divided into six aspects namely chart distributed citizen labs defined in aspects aspect conceptual perspective first the citizen lab is new form of institution one in which openes acesibility and re apropriability predominate in citizen lab people can make proposals and thus become producers of their own or other people ideas rather than consumers of something predetermined by the institution second citizen lab is meting space for diferent actors to colaborate on the development of shared idea third participation in citizen lab is its conection to its closest environment regarding this aspect it is about valuing the culture of proximity prioritizing the meting and coperation betwen diferent actors linked to the same context neighborhod city an organization etc the laboratory is therefore tol for listening and observing what hapens in these contexts trying to identify the comunity neds desires resources and strengths that can be put into action to develop colective ideas fourth the laboratory works in specific way from the logic of experimentation and prototyping this is one of the most characteristic and relevant features of the proposal of citizen laboratory because it implies prioritizing the proces over the result acepting uncertainty and suporting it colectively and relating directly with eror understanding it as another learning resource experimentation due to its open provisional and even playful nature alows the diverse knowledge of al participants to be brought together and thus promotes coperation and the creation of bonds particularly of trust and reciprocity fifth the articulation of diverse actors around the development of comon idea generates large volume of knowledge citizen lab is not only space in which this production of knowledge is posible but also tol so that the knowledge generated continues to circulate after the lab is over and can be useful in other contexts to achieve this we work from the principles of fre culture fredom to copy distribute modify and improve other people creations documenting the work done in the development of each idea sixth and last the conceptual positioning and the main characteristics we have indicated respond to the fundamental purpose of citizen lab to create comunities of learning and practice these comunities are intended to be spaces to colectively test forms of self management knowledge production and coexistence because in laboratory people participate who for the most part do not know each other and have not chosen to work together and therefore it is necesary to establish learning relationship with others al this with the aim of improving the conditions of rdbci campinas sp coexistence in our neighborhods our cities or our instit utions in short in those places that are close and meaningful to those who inhabit them source chart organized based on the conceptual perspective of lorena ruiz the purpose of the distributed citizen labs acording to ruiz perspective evidenced in the sixth aspect matches the action science method almeida peruchi freire in which it is used the creation of learning comunities caled research comunity in the context of aplication of the scientific method being this critical for obtaining results thinking about the posibility of convergence betwen work agenda in the library and research agenda with group of researchers linked to the library for inovation it is infered that the implementation and or the development of citizen labs distributed in libraries can be part of the methodological strategy for socialization of information fostering the generation of new knowledge development of actions for information competence and for digital competencies in line with the asumption of the social responsibility of information science acording to mcormick libraries have served since the period of the industrial revolution as welcoming point for newly arived imigrants to learn engage and gain suport in their quest for american citizenship other posibilities are noted by kelman from other reports namely recreational use of the library by tenagers after schol hours use of computers and the internet in the library to resolve legal maters and use of the library to entertain children with storyteling historicaly in brazil the library spaces have always ben used in various recreational and formative ways beyond the storage of the bibliographic colection during the pandemic these spaces were physicaly limited making it imposible for people to atend exhibitions lectures training sesions clases and other cultural and educational activities that have always ben posible in library environments information and education services have migrated to virtual learning environments with this reading and comunication habits and practices including the ways of learning were even if temporarily modified to adapt to the restrictions of the pandemic period and the proper continuity of the activities the pandemic period was not the first historical moment that demanded inovation from libraries while in the united states of america libraries were important in welcoming imigrants since the industrial revolution in brazil libraries were and stil are welcoming places for people in conditions of social and economic vulnerability in the post pandemic context without restrictions of physical presence in the library environment it may return to its normal performance but probably having to inovate before the changes in the informational behavior of people which was influenced by the pandemic period certainly new demands wil emerge regardin the ofer of products and services within the hybridism of curent times given this observation kelman asks what wil hapen after libraries are reopened in safer more vacinated world mcormick is also concerned about this future of the library in the post pandemic context and reports on the development of work betwen his ofice the boston public library and the city department of the environment in which they are experimenting with developing two overlaping ideas namely how can libraries evolve into remote workspaces and serve the comunity by playing critical role in heat resilience as boston gets hoter such question emerges after year of closing physical aces to libraries during the pandemic period the work developed by mcormick makes it posible to note that urban climate resilience is one of the contemporary environmental isues where the library can efectively contribute as we wil se in the discusion presented in this paper starting in the rdbci campinas sp second section given the above our research question tok therefore the folowing contour how can public educational libraries in brazil evolve into remote workspaces and serve the diverse comunities of profesionals who work and comunicate in networks the objective of this article was to discus the evolution of public educational libraries into remote workspaces to serve comunity of profesionals who work and comunicate in network one of the most relevant points that interested the research was to know the posibilities of inovation in the public sector through remote work and the role of public educational libraries in this context from the perspective of information science methodological procedures of the research methodologicaly the research is characterized as exploratory of qualitative aproach developed through bibliographic research and elaborated from ongoing doctoral research which makes use of the science action method as technique the research uses reflection in action to obtain scientific evidence and analyze data that culminates in the formulation of proposals relevant to the scientific and profesional context we compared the data on the reality of north american public libraries obtained by bibliographic colection based on the reports of researchers and librarians working in this context with the brazilian reality this comparison resulted in the production of reflection focused on the performance of the libraries of the federal institutes clasified by the authors of this study as public educational libraries in pionering way in the field of information science in brazil chloé valdary enchantment theory is aplied as strategy of methodological aproach to produce critical reflection about inovation in the public sector emphasizing the subjectivity inherent to human relations at work statistical data from recent surveys by the institute or aplied economic research ipea and the brazilian institute of geography and statistics ibge were also consulted to suport this reflective study with evidence the reflection presented in the folowing sections was structured in thre parts which adres the triad inovation remote work and public educational libraries in theoretical corelation with the posibilities of scientific and profesional action based on the purpose of highlighting necesary debate in the field of information science in the st century specificaly such debate subsidizes the evolution of studies on public information policies in libraries and their social implications in brazil the present study was caried out with the suport of two research groups the result of an inter institutional partnership betwen the research group on project management in education science information and technology projecit from the instituto federal da paraíba ifpb and the research group comunication networks and information policies from the universidade federal do rio de janeiro ufrj part of the data obtained in the present investigation is also the result of doctoral research in progres at the graduate program in information science pgci at the federal university of paraíba ufpb the present article therefore is the result of colaborative and integrative work in the scientific comunity where to start thinking about inovation through remote work to get to the answer to the question that gives this section its title we start from kelman perception of inovation in american public libraries when discusing specificaly the public library contributions to urban climate resilience in boston based on the work developed by mcormick highlighting that during the pandemic the library system implemented fre outdor wi fi spaces at locations while branches were closed providing secure outdor internet aces the libraries created rdbci campinas sp six shaded work areas to make the fre wi fi easier to aces and more fun to use they have set up picnic tables an outdor café and misting tents outside the libraries as wel some of which have already ben set up as places to aleviate borowing requests although kelman is not sure why so much inovation has emerged over time in american public libraries while some other government organizations themselves remain tied to conventional practices he points to it being due to the general lack of political controversy surounding public libraries the researcher notes that usualy government inovation arises from crises and threats but that it is diferent with libraries what drives inovation in libraries is their organizational security which fosters the confidence and self confidence of inovators this may be favorable and preponderant factor for inovators to find in the library favorable space for creativity and inovation not only in the united states but also in brazil this point is no diferent from the brazilian reality as we have observed in recent decades however when it comes to inovation in public libraries it is not quite like that for it is complex isue coroborating with kelman we infer that the reality of these information units sugests that more organizational security favors the creation of space for inovators to aproach change with confidence and self confidence both in the united states and in what we can estimate in brazil from the evidence colected mcormick makes us reflect that in times of instability around the world where trust in public institutions has diminished and continues to be threatened public libraries remain highly trusted public entities she corelates this trustworthines given to the library to public from al neighborhods various age groups and generaly by diverse audience she concludes her article by mentioning that despite the gradual replacement of physical records of knowledge by the world of digital information the role of libraries remains more important than ever this position coming from profesional from another area outside the field of librarianship and information science is critical to validate and legitimize the discourse of librarians who fight for more investment and beter working conditions to ofer new and beter services and that has often ben discredited by public managers in one of the recent publications of the federal council of librarianship herera librarian of the public library of the city of san francisco in the united states justifies the relevance of inovation in libraries highlighting that today and in the future libraries must constantly reinvent themselves we can remain loyal to our core mision of providing aces to information and promoting reading however we ned to re examine the traditional model to shift the focus more toward bringing the library to the people this means that we ned to reshape service models to one that is more proactive in comunity outreach and to ofer services that target the user we also ned to make our libraries more acesible as comunity spaces for education and civic engagement now is the time to reinvent the way we do our work librarians have remarkable skil sets to help build comunity teach the new knowledge and redefine our public libraries as learning and knowledge centers of the st century that wil help solidify the information digital and social divide data from the survey conducted by the national system of public libraries indicate that there are public libraries throughout the brazilian teritory considering the sum of municipal district state and federal libraries which would ofer an aproximate average of one public library for every inhabitants snbp there is no disclosure of separate data betwen levels of gov ernment despite this the brazilian institute of geography and statistics ibge released in data from the municipal basic information survey munic which pointed to reduction in the number of municipalities with public libraries by over four year interval in the period from to it is asumed therefore from the reports and the observed data that there is posibility of greater stability within state and federal libraries compared to the municipal rdbci campinas sp reality this may vary acording to the economic conditions of each municipality after al there are exceptions and the case of são paulo is one of them considered one of the municipalities that stand out in the valorization and quality of public libraries such as the mário de andrade library which is municipal and the award wining vila lobos park library which is statewide in brazil data from the brazilian institute of geography and statistics ibge in already pointed out record numbers of remote work in the home ofice format even before the covid pandemic the number reached milion brazilians working in this condition in the mentioned year ibge points out that at the time the home ofice work regime became an alternative to circumvent unemployment disclosing the data silveira highlights that acording to ibge the home ofice coresponded to of al employed workers in the country excluding public sector employes and domestic workers compared to when the historical series of the survey began this contingent increased by the home ofice highlighted the ibge fel betwen and grew in and fel again by in betwen and it grew by góes martins and nascimento published through the institute for aplied economic research ipea conjuncture leter in the first half of which presents oficial government statistical data on remote work in brazil based on the year such data was also published by agência brasil public news agency of the federal government which confirms its relevance for governmental decision making proceses in brazil serving as basis also to compose the evidence of studies and scientific research on the subject this survey pointed out that there was decrease in the number of home ofice workers in the month of november however the number remains much higher than the milion pointed out by the ibge in being registered aproximately milion in the recent ipea survey brasil the recorded drop is natural considering the proximity of the pandemic control observed from the advancement in safety protocols and vacination and gradual return to normality what is curently raising questions especialy in the field of public policies which also interests information science in terms of information policies is the permanence and or transf er of in person activities to the remote work format exclusively or as hybrid the advantages and disadvantages of this migration and the conditions of viability and permanence of this work model the most recent fact in the post pandemic brazilian context which contributes to inovation in the public service is the publication of decre of may which regulates telework and productivity control in the federal public service under the executive branch the greatest inovation provided by the decre consists in the autonomy for the top directors of the entities of the indirect federal public administration which includes federal public autarchies and foundations to authorize the implementation of the management and performance program pgd which was previously restricted to the ministers of state the untying favors the reduction of bureaucracy in the implementation of the program the normative act improves both the management of results of public agencies and agents and the rules related to telework with this telework wil now be posible on part time or ful time basis in federal institutes and universities this government inovation in brazil was posible due to the sucesful experience with remote work during the covid pandemic in an increasingly digital reality it has become evident to public managers the viability of telecomuting in the public sector the measure can contribute to the reduction of costs of the public machine can favor the cultural change of time and atendance control by controling results and the quality of public services and can also result in higher quality of life for federal civil servants beter productivity and serve as an example for governments at the municipal rdbci campinas sp and state levels to rethink the form of work adopted without compromising the eficiency of public power and encouraging profesional performance in acordance with the objectives of sustainable development the evidence of inovation through remote work and the corelation with libraries have ben noticed in scientific works in the field of information science we highlight the increasing aproaches about coworking and other inovative spaces chart in the molds of the present research structured from bibliographic research and with qualitative aproach the study by moyses mont alvão and zatar is one of the examples of recent scientific publication that points out these inovative spaces in libraries the spaces noted in the research are maker spaces learning comons and coworking spaces which acording to the researchers make the library more active colaborative creative and inovative which difers from traditional models that emphasize the consumption of knowledge moyses mont alvão zatar chart inovative library spaces these are spaces qualified to function as incubators of ideas in the most diverse areas which favor creativity experimentation and entrepreneurship in them makerspaces comunity spirit and colaboration are stimulated and technologies and tols are made available to create individual and colective projects these are spaces that are conducive to colaborative learning they consist of learning comons meting space to discus projects and hold metings they are created as an alternative to clasroms informal learning environments these are spaces that have the objective of sharing the physical structure furniture rental costs and comercial adres which alows an environment conducive to coworking the exchange of experiences the sharing of knowledge the participation in events and training programs source chart organized based on research by moyses mont alvão and zatar regarding the exemplification of these spaces we have that maker spaces in brazil as mentioned by moyses mont alvão and zatar are present in schol libraries and also in public libraries the example of initiatives such as in the vila lobos park library bvl that hold maker workshops that teach diferent activities such as bok production robotics home maintenance with focus on diferent user profiles also has an inclusive and acesible environment with several asistive technology devices such as page fliper ergonomic table autonomous reader audio player ruler rail adapted keyboard and mouse computers with scren reader adapted mouse and keyboard has already ben indicated as one of the best in the world for its iluminated environment spaciousnes and democratic space it has also ben clasified as an active library whose architecture itself favors the reader experience besides stimulating and facilitating activities of multiple natures moyses mont alvão and zatar cite the são paulo library another state public library as an example of learning comons it was conceived to be bold space and ofer comfort autonomy and atention to users sen as central elements of the library it ocupies an area of square meters to met the neds of diferent user profiles it has technological resources and makes microcomputers wireles and self service terminals available it was inspired by the santiago library in chile and was nominated in as one of the best in the world the concepts are very similar within colaborative space proposal we can afirm that in some libraries there is the presence of two or more of these spaces in the research by moyses mont alvão and zatar the researchers again point to the parque vila rdbci campinas sp lobos library bvl of the state of são paulo sp this time to make mention of the coworking space it contains in bvl opened coworking space on the second flor of the library which coresponds to shared workrom with infrastructure an wi fi network for use by micro and smal companies startups or people with projects or ventures in development the projects selected through public notice can use the rom fre of charge for ten months in return they must ofer workshops or seminars in the project specialty for of the public al these inovative spaces converge towards the idea of library that aims to be center of socialization and conviviality moyses mont alvão zatar libraries in the st century are moving toward being spaces with greater interactivity intense colaboration and more fruitful and complex relationships this spirit of welcoming and inclusion that has always ben present in libraries is acentuated as the social dynamics of digital transformation we experience in contemporary times takes on new contours and evolves with remote work being more frequent in the lives of several profesionals for example network comunication requires that more atention be paid to managing emotion and understanding the dimensions of organizational solicitude mutual trust aces to help active empathy leniency in judgments and courage von krogh ichijo nonaka both are important in enabling the proceses of facilitating knowledge creation and why not also organizational inovation one of the theories that has stod out internationaly in contemporary times is the theory of enchantment especialy in times of remote work in recent publication on instagram the national schol of public administration enap linked to the ministry of economy of brazil posted on its oficial profile on august the folowing question why is it important to create and maintain rituals to generate conections with your co workers in the post enap mentions the american activist and writer chloé simone valdary who aplies the enchantment theory in leadership training and in the compasionate fight against racism as stated by enap the theory is inovative due to combining social emotional education character development and interpersonal growth as tol for leadership development in the theory aproach valdary blends elements of pop culture to facilitate the disemination and understanding of the dimensions and principles of the theory diseminated among students schols companies and governments in several countries including the united states south africa the netherlands germany and israel the theory was presented for the first time to brazilian audience during live online broadcast from enap on april chloé valdary spoke with diogo costa the president of enap and highlighted the importance of aplying the thre fundamental principles of the theory in the development of human beings namely treat people as human beings and not as political distractions when criticizing elevate and empower never with the intent to tear down or destroy doing everything with love an compasion love in the sense of the grek term agape not based on conditions enap in this discusion we highlight inovation in the context of public organizations and realize the relevance of leadership social emotional education and the theory of enchantment we also discus the interdisciplinary convergence betwen administration and information science and as result it is posible to transpose from the literature on family rituals in the context of psychology the conceptual distinction betwen ritual and routine to the organizational core taking as basis the question raised by enap why is it important to create and maintain rituals to generate conections with your co workers when proposing to think about enchantment in times of remote work we sought in azevedo rdbci campinas sp explanation under the perspective coined by fiese et al the diference betwen routine and ritual detailed in thre dimensions namely comunication investment and continuity regarding routines the first dimension refers to the instrumental act this is what neds to be done the second dimension refers to the temporary character and litle consistency after the routine is performed the third dimension tels us that it is directly observable and detectable by outsiders and the behavior repeats itself over time in contrast to rituals the first dimension refers to the symbolic act this is who we are the second dimension tels us that rituals are enduring and afective and the experience can be repeated in memory the third dimension refers to the extension of meaning acros generations and this is interpreted by insiders azevedo transposing such knowledge to the organizational environment we can understand that routines organize work proceses and their repetition over time can transform them into rituals through anticipation and emotional investment however ritual can become routine if it starts to be felt as an obligation we can consider that routines and rituals enable organizations to deal with the adversities that emerge from their performance whether public or private we can also consider that we canot disociate the study and research on inovation and remote work from socioemotional isues involving people of diferent generations especialy in the context of public educational libraries this inseparability is even more evident since it is space where these several generations met and sek to met information neds and other types of neds ranging from children entertainment to being suport point for tenagers after schol for refuge imigrants seking information to achieve their citizenship among others so far our reflective path has alowed us to realize that starting to think about inovation through remote work inserting public educational libraries constitutes broad debate with several chalenges besides he above it is also necesary to think about information policies in libraries and the ned for social and emotional education of young people and adults it is not posible to think about inovation in this context without trying to understand the isues that make sense for new generations such as the and alpha generations which are the most chalenging audience for libraries at the moment how to aply eficient library management to promote the development of the generations this is one of the implications of the debate which leads us to start thinking about generations management developing information actions that leverage the best of each one of them can be starting point of work and research agenda for research librarians in the context of the federal institutes public educational libraries have the comitment to atend and satisfy through their products and services the employed generations the unemployed ones and those who are in the proces of training to aces the world of work and employment very son the chalenge is even greater in this context thinking about the inovative contribution of the public educational library to the isue of remote work therefore wil require thinking that its strategic management may include everything from the analysis of reports to the evaluation of quantitative and qualitative indicators on the diversity of generations it is necesary to think what can enable more asertive actions such as the development of incentive programs for productivity the promotion of greater involvement of social actors in decision making proceses greater digital presence and engagement of young people and adults and other actions even motivational ones also focusing on the management of emotions in the workplace subject that has received more notoriety and relevance nowadays the pandemic and post pandemic context worldwide has inspired us to be creative inovative and adaptive we have learned by necesity at the time of the pandemic and are aplying to the new moment to work wel remotely moving towards hybrid models remote rdbci campinas sp and face to face activities more flexible and adaptable to networked social dynamics we are facing crises and oportunities promising service is in demand and public educational libraries are at the center of the problem and the solution from it solutions may emerge that contribute to inovation through remote work if posible ading the importance of the thre dimensions comunication investment and continuity defended by the enchantment theory along with its thre principles which colaborate in facing and breaking paradigms that interfere with productivity and organizational culture in the public sector promising service performed by brazilian public educational libraries importantly inovation in information services is central to the evolution of libraries public educational libraries have evolved to become remote workspaces with the purpose of serving comunities of profesionals who work and comunicate online is the creation of remote workspaces or zones in educational libraries realy promising and viable initiative perhaps the answer to this question is only posible with the implementation of public policies that guarante the promotion and therefore the adequate investment in infrastructure and beyond experimentation may be the best alternative for these libraries to become citizen laboratories and efectively fulfil their educational function with inovative services based on the idea of learning libraries guided by the five disciplines of peter senge personal mastery mental models team learning shared vision and systemic thinking other questions emerge from this conjuncture namely how to define the diversity of remote working profesionals who would sek the library as remote workspace posibly the implementation and management of distributed citizen labs can contribute to this knowledge of the public and their neds it is action and reflection in action that wil guide the evaluation and inovation agenda that is sought in remote work and libraries the very social mision of the federal institutes in the context of profesional and technological education in brazil with emphasis on the importance of ofering remote work suport service in public educational libraries justifies the investments in this segment of profesional performance of librarians what can we reflect on in this section to start thinking about the construction of work and research agenda the search for ways to contribute to the suces of digital transformation in the world of work which encompases greater public investment in libraries is chalenging digital transformation is proces not an arival point or destination in order to contribute to the formation and development of research agenda on inovation in the scientific field of information science and in the profesional field of federal institutes in brazil it is necesary to bring together researchers especialy research librarians linked to these institutions working in the country gabriel junior sousa and silva in their maping of the scientific literature on the most productive authors in the subject of inovation indexed in brapci in the period to identified that the only researcher linked to federal institute is the librarian and phd in information science valmira peruchi from the federal institute of paraíba fipb from this study it is observed change in this scenario with the begining of research agenda that can fil this gap and overcome the incipient scientific production on the theme from series of publications acording to this article that is also the result of doctoral research regarding the work agenda the function of the public educational libraries is to contribute to the federal institutes in their mision to promote teaching research and extension through profesional scientific and technological education with the union of information rdbci campinas sp education and technology to ensure sustainable local regional and national development even in the face of the context in which we find ourselves in which it is chalenge to build online the relations and structures of an educational institution as in the case of the federal institutes and their public educational libraries acording to paula silva and woida libraries are the basis of education serving as suport for teaching research and extension and for this reason they are reinventing themselves in the curent scenario by ofering services and informational products such as bok loans in delivery training workshops lives of information competence on how to use information sources safely for research standardization of academic papers scientific writing among others with the ned for the services provided by public educational libraries having to adapt during the pandemic to the social isolation and distance the profesionals who work in them had to adapt to new reality the remote work thus they have had to review their services and actions to continue with the importance they have always had in the educational context while stil meting the information neds of their users in satisfactory maner as quickly eficiently and efectively as posible as is customary trends are becoming reality in our day to day lives it must also be understod that they have had to reinvent themselves in ofering and making online information products and services acesible and easy to handle for users the user experience is central to this way of life to work with the emerging reality public educational libraries have expanded the use of services ofered on social networks such as instagram twiter and facebok as wel as service chanels using whatsap and electronic forms and have made available and asisted in the use of open aces databases that enable users to aces boks and scientific articles in this way the libraries have ben engaged in improving their information services and products by making information available through websites social media and networks such as instagram twiter facebok and other media these comunication means are great diseminates of information and where several subjects are conected daily causing information to circulate at greater sped because these informational chanels alow librarians and users not only to sek interaction but also to make information sharing paula silva woida the pandemic required the proces of joining technology and education forcing us to use in systematic and general way digital media for sharing information providing services and other activities it is necesary to think and plan for this post pandemic context with the ofer and creation of inovative spaces with services that ensure the safety and health of everyone involved in the libraries this proces can be guided by an agenda oriented to social development as the digital transformation guides contemporary life in al proceses and information flows agenda for social development and digital transformation drawing up work agenda in paralel to drawing up research agenda is not only posible but necesary these days there is clear inextricability betwen the work agenda and the research agenda as much as there is for social development and digital transformation from this century onwards in an experimental way in this section we wil adres proposal for work agenda that can be aplied in public educational libraries through research agenda that is being constituted in the scope of the research group on project management in education science rdbci campinas sp information and technology projecit linked to the ifpb campus joão pesoa and registered with the national council for scientific and technological development cnpq since some questions can be aplied via mail to the librarians responsible for the libraries in the system to have local sample of the perception of these managers on this subject and later expanded for comparative studies this is proposal for aplication in future studies there was no ned to aply questionaire at this point in the research because we are in stage of reflection these questions could be developed based on smal group of guiding questions namely during the pandemic what did you do diferently in your remote activities that you did not do before the pandemic and that may have generated inovation in the library is inovation through remote work posible traditionaly the library is study and research space for students do you think the library can become remote workspace for profesionals what conditions would you ned to make this service viable ruiz our translation states that al living beings share vulnerability not as weaknes but as that which in neding each other alows us to link aly and suport each other the researcher points out that this vulnerability became much more evident with the social and health crisis steming from the covid pandemic as argued by ruiz we have the potential to create colaborative networks in research and the workplace but we ned the resources and proper infrastructure to do so these resources and the necesary infrastructure can be obtained by formulating activity specific public policies in the public sector however it is first necesary to spread among librarians researchers public managers and other profesionals relevant to the isue in public organizations the potential of the public educational library in order to generate inovation from remote wor in this sense it is necesary to develop research agenda that suports work agenda so that information policies are asertively developed resources are alocated and the promotion is efectively caried out in these public sector environments that lack inovation chart first topics on the research agenda topic description organizational identity of libraries in federal institutes inovation remote working and infrastructure of educational libraries digital transformation and inovation in information services through projects learning and practice comunities in libraries and research groups users ned and experience in virtual learning networks social media marketing strategies for educational libraries public policies to combat intergenerational information poverty source authors the seven themes pointed out above do not exhaust or limit the research agenda that is being constituted they are the starting point for research work based on the science action method in the context of information science constituting an unprecedented proposal for intervention in the scientific field bringing theoretical contributions to scientific field that is increasingly aligned and closer to the practices of information profesionals and the neds of curent and future generations of information users and producers in networked society rdbci campinas sp final considerations the results highlight the posibility of inovation through remote work in the federal public service we are facing an oportunity to inovate in the public sector with promising service that can be performed by public educational libraries in federal institutes in brazil the apropriate infrastructure for remote workspaces we also observed an inseparability betwen the work agenda and the research agenda as wel as betwen social development and digital transformation from this century on as far as these educational libraries are concerned the study aims to contribute to the development of more asertive public policies for this type of library its public and its new work dynamics that are being constituted it is posible that solutions to real problems faced in the daily life of information profesionals wil be proposed based on the research agenda that is being developed at the inter institutional level the fruitful path that science action has ben building in information science in brazil with studies that bring together the theories in use in the profesional context with the theories proclaimed by the scientific field shows the posibilities of inovation that are to come the alignment of studies on educational library infrastructure with the development of smart cities in the context of creative economy entrepreneurship and digital transformation wil reveal new posibilities and solutions in the core of the field of information science to met the emerging demands of the network society it is therefore promising theme for us to start thinking about the construction of brazilian digital agenda based on the contributions of this scientific field we conclude that the paths to digital transformation in the world of work can become even more productive inovative profitable and sustainable when we sek continuous and adequate investment in infrastructure and inovation of libraries that fulfil an educational function and are of public nature folowing the high level of social relevance of the federal institutes in the context of inclusion through profesional scientific and technological education in brazil it is necesary stil continuous investment in the formulation of public policies especialy information policies to ensure the role of the librarian as an agent of inovation in federal institutes as the next step of the authors of this research considered as fruit of the research scientific article wil be comunicated on how the information policy corelates with the inovation policy in federal institutes covering in its discusion the theoretical pragmatic model for the development of information policies of brandão and the chalenges arising from the post pandemic scenario from the digital agenda elac and the recent actions ocured in brazil that favor the development of the digital society
